Reviews.Title: “Was a little dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: jzl_12
Reviews.Content: Bungalow on Water DOES NOT look like the one they have posted on their website. It wasn't very clean at all and did NOT have the views they show - For that amount of money, I was expecting A LOT more and didn't get it. The pull out couch was the most uncomfortable thing I have every slept in and the noise across the bay, terrible! I do have to say that the staff was great and they helped us out a lot with our issues. Nice place, kids loved it but I liked the connecting rooms with garden views MUCH more than the bayside bungalow. Terrible service at the restaurant and Baleen was VERY overpriced. Haven't decided if we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “We Stayed for just under a week.”
Reviews.Author: aylaab
Reviews.Content: The room that we had was very nice and updated, the bathroom was good to except that we had ants. We wiped them up the first and third day but they just wouldn't stop coming back. I cant imagine that this isn't something that the cleaning people didn't notice, but they didn't. We had a room on the bay and it was very calm and not very windy so it was nice to sit out and enjoy the sun. One afternoon we had lunch at the bare foot restaurant out side, they had heaters to keep you warm which was nice. I ordered a chicken ceasar salad ($15ish) and it was awful, tasted like instead of making a dressing they just used straight mayo. Sick! My husband ordered a burger which is hard to mess up and he said it was fine nothing special. The other two couples we were there with were also not impressed with the quality of their meals in comparison to the cost. When our bill came, we asked our waiter to split it between the three couples, and he then asked us to total up our own bills and just give him cards to charge. Sorry but isn't that HIS job? Overall for expectation of high quality, fine dining at the resort you would think that they would make sure to hire ONLY the most competent people to assist their guests. That was very clearly not the case. In the gift shop there were people all over the store and a huge line of people to pay for items and only ONE person checking them out.... Since when is standing around your most important job? You are in the service industry. The gentleman who was in charge of the bike rentals was very friendly and helpful and actually seemed to have knowledge about his job. Refreshing. One day we decided to take the water taxi over to sea world which was great, and a fun way to arrive at the park. Only downside to that is that if you want to use the shuttle to come back it only comes back at 5 &6 pm, so you have to be there all day. Which was fine, but it would have been nice to use it to come back earlier. They use Orange Cab to suggest to their customers, but it seemed that they were actually more than other local cabs? not sure, but probably not by too much. I would go back there, but next time I would eat out in town to avoid the poor service and blah food.

Reviews.Title: “Great family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Beth K
Reviews.Content: Our family recently took a winter getaway in San Diego, and Paradise Point was perfect for our needs. It's a little oasis in the city, quiet, peaceful, lush, and beautiful. The rooms are little bungalo duplexes and ours was on a peaceful cove right across from the tennis, basketball and croquet courts. The shop on the grounds is happy to loan you tennis racquets, and putters for the little putting greens that are sprinkled around the property. There is a lovely marina where you can rent sailboats, kayaks, motorboats, or jet skis. We rented a sailboat for a lovely sail around Mission Bay. If you're not an experienced sailor, for a reasonable price you can hire on a captain to give you a lesson, or just have them sail it for you. The pool is large, and warm and very tropical feeling, and there is a lovely lagoon that meanders around the grounds. Our room was clean and spacious and had a small kitchenette with a sink and fridge. They also have fire pits on the beaches. (you can buy firewood at the little store, but it's pricey) There is so much to do in San Diego that it would be hard to do it all in one visit, but Paradise Point is close to everything. It's within a mile or two of Sea World. It's also very close to Mission Beach, and a kitchy old boardwalk amusement park. (can't remember the name right now.) We never had the opportunity to eat at the hotel but the marina restaurant looked lovely, had good choices, and was reasonably priced. If we're back in San Diego, we'll stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Probably would never go back. Too many other great places to stay.”
Reviews.Author: roadlinergal
Reviews.Content: Secluded, not much to do at resort. Very spread out and LOTS of walking to get anywhere. If you have mobility issues, very challenging. Our maid service was very poor - had to come back 3 times in 1 day. Very few places to eat, but food was VERY good. Grounds were stunningly beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on a tropical island. Close to everyting but the feel of seclusion surrounds you.”
Reviews.Author: Jkatie
Reviews.Content: When you arrive you feel far from the hussle and bussle of San Diego. You are transported to the tropics. Surounded by lush gardens and quiet. Children friendly with walking paths and pools. If you choose to stay you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Place of plently "policies" designed to rip of guests”
Reviews.Author: DMGR28970
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip for a small group in anticipation of booking a larger group of high end business travelers. As a professional I wouldn't book this place even if it were free. They have policies that are very guest unfriendly and all designed to bait and switch room rates and gouge prices. They have a 72 hour cancellation policy which is fine, but one room was booked and then less than 10 hours later cancelled and they still wanted to be paid full price for the room. All the guests were government employees except one guest forgot hise id. Even though the rest of the group had required ids, the hotel had a policy to bump the price up substantially. The front desk failed to make a change in the dinner reservation. Just forgot. Their "business center" is one computer and there is always a line to use it even to print simple tasks like boarding passses. Rooms were supposed to be king. All were 2 queens instead. The floor is some kind of cermic and freezing cold. No slippers or even a small rug to break up the cold. The heaters make more noise than a locomotive. It is liky TRYING to sleep by the railroad tracks. Lighting is poor and unsuitable if you want to read or do any work. Watch your bill. They will try and double charge you for the same room. DMGR

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Tricia H
Reviews.Content: We were sooo pleased with the resort. The grounds were keep in immaculate condition it is extremely tropical and colorful. The rooms were uniquely decorated and we loved the comfort that the rooms had. It was really nice to have a refrigerator in the room so we could keep beverages and snacks cool. The restaurant was tasty and the view of the bay is incredible. It is a short distance to anywhere on the property so a daily walk to enjoy the tropical gardens and wildlife is a must. We will be back. The gift shop or Island Market which is centrally located is outstanding!!! We found unique goodies for whole family and it was reasonably priced. Central location of the resort made it quick and easy to enjoy other San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for our 30th Wedding Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy F
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have been to Paradise Point Resort & Spa. I have to admit like others after reading some of the negative comments that I was unsure about my choice BUT please remember everybody has different opinions! I have to say I was mesmerized as we drove onto the grounds and found such beauty! We were greeted by Ben who was super!! Diego at the front desk was amazing, great comps, again Thank you!!! When we arrived in our room, which were upgraded to, we opened our patio door the the view and had ducks waiting for us (ok I am a sucker for furry friends.) We also had a very nice card and a basket of fruit waiting for us. We enjoyed our first evening by the pool and hot tub, right outside our room. Again amazing! The next day we grabbed our coffee and scones at the coffee shop and again, staff superb! Headed off for a road trip to Joshua Tree..long drive but beautiful, despite the wind and extremely windy road on the way back, but what and adventure! when we got back to our room we had a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of wine waiting for us, courtesy of our daughter and son in-law! Called the front desk for a cork screw, not realizing one was laying on the table...arrived in 2 minutes! Cannot ask for better service. So if you are ever in the area I would highly recommend Paradise Point. The amenities as super and the staff are just as awesome. Yes there is a resort fee of $17 and there is a parking fee of $32 a day, but have you checked out some other places? Our original plans were to go to Vegas, hmmm, can you say resort fees...I will take these fees and get an awesome stay, great beaches, at a very classy resort!! Great job all of you, pat yourselves on the back. We will be back! Beds were great, room was clean!

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: knm_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Bayside Bungalow, which was beautiful, but by far the best aspect of Paradise Point was the consistently great service! Whether it was at the cafe, the restaurant, or the guy driving the golf cart, everybody was friendly, helpful, and delivered the type of service you'd expect at top tier resort. The grounds were also amazing. We enjoyed the pools, the basketball court, and roasting marshmallows by campfire. Looking forward to going back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “A True Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Susie C
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to get away to and relax. I couldn't have picked a better spot. The staff is warm and welcoming and the rooms are great! the Resort was more than I expected, and I was able to just sit back and relax near the lagoon while enjoying the beauty of my surroundings. The beach is also perfect for any time of the day or night, we were able to enjoy s'mores while sitting on the shore to watch the sunset. It really is paradise.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds, but rooms need some freshening up”
Reviews.Author: my3sons88
Reviews.Content: just arrived today, as we drove through the resort, we noted how beautiful and serene the environment was. truly a paradise. we felt as though we were in hawaii/maui. check in was a breeze, staff was friendly. however, when we entered our room, a strange odour permeated the room (smelled like a combination of detergent and vomitted baby's milk}. wall paint had chipped off, lower portion of the front door had paint chipped off, bathroom walls and door paint were terribly scuffed. in short - rooms needed a coat of fresh paint. love the hard wood floors and spacious bathroom. so, management, when you have the time and money, please repaint/upgrade the facilities, then it will truly be a paradise in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't read the old reviews.... This is all you need to know”
Reviews.Author: Destinedfor2013
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Paradise Point, to get away from the midwest "blah" winter we've been having. Knowing that San Diego was our destination, we started looking around for properties to spend our 5 nights and 6 days. To be honest, we also were a bit apprehensive by the negative remarks made by some reviewers, so we looked for a bit at the Hilton by the Bay, and a couple of others. However, after some discussions, we decided to go with our instinct, realizing that there will ALWAYS be unhappy people out there, quick to nit-pick every last detail, and those whose standards are just ridiculously unattainable. THANK GOD we listened to our inner voice. From the moment we turned the corner on Vacation Drive, we knew we had arrived at our home for a week. Pulling up to the valet, we were greeted by the main man, Marc Garner, who quickly became our SD guru of all things. We cannot say enough amazing things about the staff at PP, from the valet, cleaning crew, grounds keepers, room service, spa staff, bar and restaurant crew, and management. The GM of the property has a kind, compassionate group of extraordinary people working for him, who go out of their way to make the guests at this resort feel as if you are the only people they are there to take care of. But we MUST give extra props to our guy Marc..... He's a gem.... We will certainly come back and he is one of the main reasons why. Our bungalow on the beach was a sweet little apartment, very clean, with a immediate beach access and a fire pit steps away. We ended up meeting some incredible people the first night we were there and met up a few more times throughout the week.... A nice community feel if you're up for that, but no pressure if you're not. The grounds themselves made you feel as though you were on an island of a combination of Tahiti, Figi, and Hawaii. Bikes to ride, mini golf to play, multiple pools to swim in, (including an adults-only pool), spa to relax in, bars on the water to let loose, a phenomenal restaurant to dine at, trails to walk, and beachfront to get lost on. And this is all just on the property. Rent a car if you'd like to get our and explore. Head to the San Diego Zoo and be sure NOT to miss Balboa Park. Go to Ocean Beach, Pacific Beach, Mission Bay, Belmont Park, head down to La Jolla and see the seals, then make a reservation at either George's and have the carrot cake for dessert or stop in at Crabcatcher. Make love and enjoy the love. It won't be hard to do at Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience; there are better choices in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable with a great shower and nice king bed. The TV service was not digital and had a very muddy picture. Price was affordable using a Groupon. But the food service was subpar. It took us an hour and 45 minutes to get served breakfast -- usually one of the great pleasures for us when we stay at a nice place. The only breakfast restaurant was severely understaffed. After being seated 15 minutes, we asked a busboy to find our server and watched as he approached a server who waved him off. We were ultimately served by a bartender who was extremely pleasant. I did speak with the manager who offered us another night at the resort, which we declined. Our second morning we drove to a local breakfast spot that was great. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: comoxtravellwer
Reviews.Content: My daughter had booked us in at paradise from Mar 4 for 3 nights,supposedly a 4 Star property,we were advised that when we checked in there was a $32.00 per day parking fee,plus an additional $17.00 for use of the internet, pool and other various venues,we paid,After the first night I had to go around and ask if the housekeeper was going to come in and tidy up our rooms at 5PM,which they did.My daughter complained on checkout about the added expences but to deaf ears,my wife detected bites on her back,which turned out to bed bug bites,I will DEFINITELY not stay there or recommend that property in this life time

Reviews.Title: “nice family weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the view from the garden room. the grandkids were able to climb trees, feed the ducks. We were very close to the pool. Everything was beautiful and clean. The staff was friendly but overworked - had to wait quite a while at the coffee kiosk in the morning, at the gift shop to rent a bike, and then again to check out of the hotel. Very few TV stations were offered - but it's San Diego - why hang out in the room? Close to the roads for Legoland, the ocean beach, and Sea World. A Great Weekend!

Reviews.Title: “we had a great family vacation, memories will last forever!! thanks so much!!!”
Reviews.Author: murrains
Reviews.Content: we had a awesome vacation the grounds are amazing, staff was so helpful even with public transportation, we will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: PollyMommy
Reviews.Content: We booked a King bayside suite for the weekend $308 When we got there we were upgraded to a bungalow. It was nice and large with living area, dining area, kitchenette, and double sink/closet bathroom. They even gave us a tub of choco chip cookies! Score! YES I know parking is $32 a day and resort fee is $17. But I knew all this because of you guys here! The room was clean. Service at Barefoot Bar was poor at lunch and great for dinner. The PP grounds are beautiful. Nice pools and gym. We had a fire in the beach fire pit both nights. Just really relaxing. If you look for deals online it can be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: scoobydoobeach
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Paradise Point for over 25 years, with family and as a couple. Our latest visit, however, was one of the best ever. Nothing is so relaxing as sitting in an Adirondack chair looking at the Bay, watching the birds and the boats go by. We had two ducks come sleep next to us on our patio while we snoozed in the sun. The rooms have been remodeled to include flat screen TVs, comfortable beds and a table with chairs so we could eat and look out at the Bay. Our sunsets were amazing and of course, you may enjoy a fire in the fire pit on the beach. Going in the spring can be a crap shoot for the weather but the crowds are lighter and you can find yourself alone for hours with the birds and the boats. We do not use the pool or the gym much anymore but I like the inclusion of everything, including wifi, in the resort fee so I have the option, particularly if our grandchildren come with us. I was also pleased to learn that the new owners of the resort focus on green practices in their products and organic or local food in the restaurants. A nice plus for a great place to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Long Review for You...”
Reviews.Author: WhiteRock_Gal
Reviews.Content: You DEFINITELY want to rent a vehicle if you're not arriving in one!! More on that later... We were Priceline customers and they treated us well (not differently as other hotels do). Front desk was friendly- as soon as she started registering us, I asked if it was possible to get a room with a view. They were all sold out but she did give us a room VERY close to the bay! Such a lovely view! The front desk girl told us that she was going to initially put us in a room with a parking lot view- it pays to ASK for a nicer room & they do accommodate so make sure you ask! The room itself- or what it really is, a bungalow- was a decent size. One big room with 2 bed and a separate area for sink and bathroom with tub and toilet. Yes, the room was old and did look dated. No, the beds weren't as comfortable as one would hope (too soft, slightly saggy?). BUT we did only pay $80 a night so absolutely no complaining here. The room was clean and you could tell attempts were made to make it look well-kept. There was a small safe in the "closet" area and that's always appreciated. Oh, make sure you bring slippers or flip flops to wear around the place! Even though the weather was warm, the floor was COLD and hard on our feet! The "amenities"- we were charged $15 nt for resort amenities (it's since gone up to $17 I believe). We were gone for most of the 3 days were there (to the Zoo, SeaWorld, etc) so didn't get to utilize the amenities as much as we could have. We were close to the main pool and it looked nice. We did get a chance to play mini-golf and that was fun for our 7 yr old (it's just a small course spread out around the resort). I know you could rent bikes but we didn't want to fork over $25/hr. And the spa seemed to offer a lot of interesting services but, again, didn't want to be spending the big bucks on those (they weren't cheap!) Lastly, we did end up getting up room service one evening and it was VERY expensive! We ordered 2 burgers w/ fries and a small pizza for our kid. On top of the food, they charged us $5 for room service + tip (it was either !5% or 20%- can't remember) so I think we paid something ridiculous like $65 for this meal!! Bit pricey IMO. Back to the vehicle point... we didn't rent one and kicked ourselves the whole time we were there! It seemed every one else had one, though. Smart people. The resort is on it's own little "island" and there's nothing around. I mean nothing. No pharmacy or fast food joint. Which could be nice if we had a vehicle to jump in and drive to these places. We did walk to SeaWorld- took about 25-30 minutes from our room to the front gate. It's just over the small bridge but it was hot and we were a bit tired by the time we got there. On the way back, we cabbed it because we were tired from walking around all day. Now, cab prices. It cost us about $10 one way from SeaWorld to the resort. Not too bad. But the next day we went to the Zoo and I think it cost us about $25 one way. Rent a vehicle!! Yes, most likely you'd have to pay for the parking at the resort which I hear is like $30 night but the inconvenience of it all... esp if you're bringing kids- not worth it. First you have to call a cab, wait for the cab, pay the cab- on the way back, same deal. We did ask about buses but it was going to take us 3x the time to get where we wanted and it did not appear to be easy at all. With a kid, this would've been a nightmare so we abandoned that idea. If you're going to the resort simply to enjoy the lovely views and all it's amenities, and don't plan on leaving at all, then don't get a car. But if you want to be able to even leave to get a meal outside the resort, I think you'll want to ensure you have a vehicle. Last thoughts... the resort is very peaceful and laid out so nicely. Lovely views, ducks everywhere, little ponds, chairs set out to read by the views, golf cart escorts... really quite quaint and reminds one of another era. We'd never been anywhere like this (in North America) and were a little awed by the size and greenery. Nice place if you want quiet time or a romantic getaway or even to take the kids away for some fun. It seemed it would suit a whole demographic of people. I just don't think I'd pay the "regular" prices during high season. I hope this lengthy review helps! : )

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not sure if we'd go back”
Reviews.Author: elleebug
Reviews.Content: My hubby stayed here as a kid when it was called Princess Resort, and he always wanted to go back, so we took our 22 month old to Disneyland and Sea World and decided we would stay here, even though it was so much cheaper to stay elsewhere. The FD clerks were always very friendly and lowered our parking fee to $10/nt, but the parking spots are made for tiny cars. We were cramped by big vans and SUV's on both sides of us, and sometimes it was a challenge getting our baby into the carseat. The rooms were smaller than I expected, and we got a free upgrade to the "Garden View", which all that meant to me was you get 2 chairs outside to sit and see your neighbors, but there was no view. We stayed 3 nights and after the first night we noticed tiny ants crawling all over the desk, even though the only food we had was in the fridge. So on the 2nd day we told the FD about it and asked if they would also change the lightbulb outside our door as it was burned out and very dark when we arrived at night. We also wanted housekeeping service this day. But when we got back after a very long day at the Zoo, we found ants still all over the desk, and they didn't change our sheets, just remade the bed. I wasn't very impressed about that. I mean we are paying $25 in extra fees a day on top of the room rate and we can't even get clean sheets? The "resort" is nice, and the lobby area at night is neat as they have it lit up with fire, and the Barefoot Grill has fire too. I could see staying here if you were coming to San Diego for a week long visit and only had 2 or 3 days planned, where you could spend the rest of the time at the resort and enjoy the amenities, but when you are staying 3 nights and have 2 whole days planned, you do not get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Paradise is what they say when you check in!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela L
Reviews.Content: Definitely felt like we were in Paradise all week long. Very friendly and helpful staff. Food was great and service was top notch. Wonderful time at this resort. No complaints. So quiet and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “a great getaway from the city”
Reviews.Author: skrooz
Reviews.Content: My cousin took me here for a 2-day getaway for my birthday on March 2012. The bungalow she got was right by the beach. It was quite breathtaking. It was very quiet and relaxing. The staff was super friendly. I got a massage and body scrub at The Spa. The massage therapist was good but he was too chatty. I would have given this resort five stars except for three things. One. The telephone was dirty. Two. The remote for the TV was broken and it took them awhile to send somebody to fix it. Three. The food in the restaurant in the resort and room service needs some kind of "umpf". It's quite bland. The menu needs more of a variety.

Reviews.Title: “Will be our first choice for accommodations in the San Diego area. Best sleep I have ever had in a hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: FromSouthTexas
Reviews.Content: Will be our first choice for accommodations in the San Diego area. Best sleep I have ever had in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Second time”
Reviews.Author: BillRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: We had such a good time at this resort that we came back. This time with our 8-year-old granddaughter. If possible, she loved it even more than we did. For the first time we ate at the restaurants and went swimming. As the last time, our rooms were wonderful. We took two upgraded rooms on the little cove and could not have been happier. This will not be our last time at this place - it keeps getting better.

Reviews.Title: “Paradisiacal”
Reviews.Author: normpich
Reviews.Content: As usual, unbeatable in San Diego, if you were looking to stay enjoy outdoors life in a superb ambiance surrounded by Water, Fresh Air, Luscious Vegetation, and plenty of visiting Birds. Great place for Family gatherings, Nature lovers, Waters Sports, Joggers, and also for Group events. The weather contributed beautifully, since during our 4 night stay we enjoyed wonderful Sunshine with 78 F. temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time, you truely feel transformed when you are here!”
Reviews.Author: RoomServiceGal
Reviews.Content: Went here as part of a group for a relaxing weekend and it was the perfect spot to unwind. I understand they have made some upgrades, get a room by the bay! Baleen had an amazing menu (try the pork chop) and how fun is it when you can have smores on the beach! If you can't spend the money on Hawaii, go to Paradise Point and enjoy all their amenities. You truely feel like you are transformed when you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Massive fees”
Reviews.Author: CJ222
Reviews.Content: I was shocked when I was awarded a four star hotel on Priceline for only $67 per night. I would quickly find out why. Parking is $32 per night (up from $25 last year apparently, looking through older posts), resort fees are $17 per night, and the main pool by the spa was closed for renovations while I was there. It looked like the spa was closed too, but I can not verify that. They tried to justify the fees by saying I got the hotel for such a great rate, but if I were interested in paying $116 for a hotel I would have bid that high. I would have even considered this a steal if only the resort fee were levied. For the excessive parking fee of $32 per night (I paid $22 per night at my hotel downtown--where parking is actually at a premium) one of the resorts work trucks parked in my reserved spot during the second day I was there. Luckily I had rented a car, because if not I would have been miserable. The resort is very secluded from any other restaurants, shops, or bars other than the overpriced ones they have onsite ($30 for pasta w/no meat and happy hour priced beer), and as a solo traveler it was not ideal. The actual room was fine. I see a lot of terrible reviews on here about the rooms but I did not experience any issue with bugs or any smell, although I was not in a bay front room. It definitely wasn't luxury, but it was far from a hostel as someone suggested. (Though the towels were awful). The area and views were quite lovely as were the pool areas (an adults only pool was key). I think the resort has real potential.

Reviews.Title: “March whirlwind”
Reviews.Author: Lakeboater27
Reviews.Content: We booked the weekend through Southwest. Upon arrival we were in awe, beautiful setting, night torches ablaze. The room was a garden view and was very nice. The room was very clean when we arrived. On day 2 we had been out and got back at 4, the room had not been serviced yet. We called and they said sometimes they didn't get all the rooms done until 5. Not exactly great for a couples weekend. Room service was very prompt and food excellent. Towels very scratchy.... Plan on walking alot if you stay. Overall pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, yes...value, so-so.”
Reviews.Author: Angela A
Reviews.Content: Overall, Paradise Point is a beautiful, breathtaking place with amazing views of Mission Bay, beaches and more. Stepping out of our room and onto the surgary sand was wonderful. The staff was courteous and friendly. The only things that were unpleasent was that there was old, moldy fruit in our fridge, our valet didn't pick us up upon checkout as requested, the market was highly overpriced and there were little ants that found their way into our room. We did not let any of that damper our relaxing vacation. We had a fabulous time and would probably stay there again despite the minor issues. The birds and wildlife are abundant...even had a group of ducks follow me around in hopes of a cracker...I gave in. ;-) They were too cute. It truly is a beautiful place and it's its own island. How cool is that?!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not be Cheated!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathy H
Reviews.Content: We booked 4days 3 nights there. It was super dark when we drove in as they only lit up with fire in the facility (like "Survival" feeling). Never did we expect the room in there to be like "Survival" too. They given us standard room saying there is a garden view. My foot.. its was only a tree truck and a tiny patch of grass and they call it garden! We find that it was unacceptable and therefore upgrade to patio room. It was slightly better but was horrible too. The room sucks. There are cracks on the wall & on the bathtub. The paint on the door was peeling off. The carpet on the floor has a thick coating of "hair/fur" and so is the panels on the window which is extremely dusty. It was really a paradise for the insects cos we could find ants on the coffee table. We had tough time sleeping through cos was sneezing in the room, not sure if it was cause by the dust on the bed or in the room. There are additional charges for the carpark and internet. Terrible, terrible place... 4 star???? Dont be cheated. With the amount of $ paid there, we could get better & cleaner room. Don't Ever go there.. people given thumb up there.. really doubt their integrity!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Katlak
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with small bugalow type rooms.Even if your room is not on the bay it is a short walk. The bayside dining is realaxing for breakfast and fun around happy hour when the weather is nice. You can dock your boat after a few hours on the bay then stop in for something to eat. Paradise Point is one of my husbands favorite resorts. Parking is pricey, I really don't understand how Hotels think it is right to charge people to park while they are staying at their hotel. CRAZY.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: RDTO7777
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights and checked out after the first one. Beds are really bad, couldn't sleep most of the night. Internet connection didn't work. They charged for parking ($30 / night) and internet ($17 / night). Rooms look like military barracks.

Reviews.Title: “Local excursion felt like a real escape”
Reviews.Author: jwmoose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live about 30 minutes from Paradise Point and chose it for a locat getaway / overnight break from our two young kids for her birthday. We were at a Bali, Indonesia resort in 2008, and surveying the Paradise Point property upon entering the grounds brought me back to those tropical days. The initial positive impression continued as everyone from valet to the front desk courteously ensured that we knew where we were going and what we were doing in pursuit of some R & R. Our bungalow was spacious, well situated, and super clean. Time slowed down (needed that) as we walked the resort, climbed the observation tower, and had a drink at the restaurant bar. The resort is centrally located not far from the heart of San Diego, so we were in Coronado for dinner in no time. We didn't even get to take advantage of the pools/jacuzzi, outdoor activities, and fire pits and s'more kits, so I can imagine that families would find ways to stay entertained for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Delusionally (prob not a word) over-priced”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyBoySB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding. Property was nice, definitely a little dated. The rooms were fairly clean and quiet. Staff was friendly. One night including taxes/resort fee/parking hit a grand total of $280. A financial reaming considering the age of the resort and the condition of the facilities/rooms etc. You could do a lot more with that amount of money in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jess_in_DC
Reviews.Content: So I am not a resort type of girl but I really enjoyed Paradise Point. It was chill and relaxed. Their customer service was excellent, truly excellent. My sister (who admittedly can be demanding) called to ask for microwave delivered to our room so she could heat up her leftovers. 10 minutes later we had our microwave, no questions asked. Our room was great - clean and spacious - with a lovely patio we ate breakfast on. It felt private and secluded. It was also easier to explore San Diego from the resort than I expected. The resort is on the bus line. It's also a long walk to Mission Beach (about 2 miles) but a lovely walk if you want to eat out in Mission Beach. There's a nice running loop of 5 miles too from the resort. I was running a conference for work there and their conference staff was amazing. Seriously every request was granted quickly. The food and coffee were really good too. They let us eat our meals as a group out on the patio overlooking the bay -- and they also gave us the flexibility to move the group inside if needed. We really enjoyed having our meeting there.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise with a hit to the wallet”
Reviews.Author: SingingMamaTucson
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Price line and were very exciting about getting this resort. We have stayed at this resort several times. We booked 2 rooms for 4 nights. When we checked in we were told there would be a $32 parking fee, per night, and a resort fee of $17 per night. That's an extra $100 per night. This resort is on an isthmus, why we would be charged for parking is beyond me. And a resort fee, is crazy. We will never stay here again, it has dampened our spirits. If I had not booked through Price Line I would check out today.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Milwgirl24
Reviews.Content: The resort is very beautiful, everything from the rooms, lobby, grounds, pool area, etc. It's a very relaxing place and would be somewhere I would love to stay for a few days & not leave. My only complaint is the mandatory $17 resort fee they tack on for the "convenience" of using the fitness center, etc. and the steep parking costs. The girl checking us in said "it's normally $28/night but I'd be happy to cut that in half for you." Ok thanks, even $14/night is steep when you're already paying alot for the room. Either way, if you can get a good rate it's worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Garden of Eden”
Reviews.Author: Edward B
Reviews.Content: Resort name is an understatement. It was like living in The Garden of Eden for three days. Harbourside room was awesome! Easy access to all of San Diego, #5 and #8.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent space for conferences, friendly staff, beautiful resort.”
Reviews.Author: jesmick
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort, well maintained, with excellent amenities. The food on site is a bit pricey, but good. The staff is fantastic. I didn't walk past anyone who didn't smile and say hello. It felt like they were all glad to have me there. The conference facilities are very nice and could fit anyone's meeting needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Event Location!”
Reviews.Author: Scott N
Reviews.Content: My son and his new wife could not have picked a better place to be married. Family and friends from all over the county stayed at Paradise Point and enjoyed a beautiful wedding, reception and three day stay, all at the same location. The group and package rates were a big help for our large group on a budget. The Bell Captain Marc and staff were all over helping us with an issue free stay. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort”
Reviews.Author: NativeNYer39
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is always my "go-to" when visiting SD. I have stayed here a number of times and am never disappointed. Great location and easy on/off freeways, beautiful grounds, lovely beach, extremely attentive and friendly staff. Dining: I've eaten at the Barefoot Bar & Grill on previous visits and was not that wow-ed so I haven't been back to eat - only for drinks, and I would absolutely recommend it for that (outdoor patio on the water? Hell yeah!). This visit we ate breakfast at Baleen and it was delicious and service was great. Oh, and thank God for adults-only pools :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Paradise Point!”
Reviews.Author: MontaukFan
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The breakfast at the barefoot grill was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Staci W
Reviews.Content: My husband selected this resort because, after a few days downtown for business, we wanted more of a get-away. We found Paradise Point the perfect place. It's just secluded enough to be quiet and comfortable, but still close to attractions and dining. I read other reviewers' complaints about the high cab fares, and they are pretty steep, but it was so economical to stay at the resort, that it really off-set the higher cab fares. (And it was worth it to use be in a quiet bungalow!) We walked to Sea World and a whale-watching expedition and took the bus up to La Jolla. I recommend both. If you don't want to, there is no need to leave the resort. We also enjoyed running around the small island and sitting by the fire on the beach outside our bungalow in the evenings. The only negative (and I don't know what the hotel staff could do) was that at this time of year (February) they only have one pool and hot tub open and people had their babies and small children (ages 9 mos. to 3 yrs.) in the hot tub! This was just so inappropriate, unhealthy and unsanitary we left and didn't get to enjoy the hot tub. Again, not sure what the staff could have done except enforce an age requirement, but it was disappointing nontheless.

Reviews.Title: “NOT so paradisacle...”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany B
Reviews.Content: My husband spent HOURS researching somewhere to take me for a surprise weekend getaway. The Paradise Point was what he came up with... boy did he regret it! This place is SUCH a dump! I don't know who rates these hotels, but it was rated as a 5 Star. Well, apparently the Motel 6 has jumped in it's rating as well. If this is a 5 star, then is the Four Seasons a 12 star?? My husband had booked a King room. We have a baby, and luckily I had called ahead to ask about cribs. Well, this "luxury" hotel does NOT have cribs, so I brought my own. Thank goodness, because if they did, I can only imagine the condition that it would be in. So when my husband went to check in they told him they "only had queen rooms available." He said, "I booked a king!" They said, "Yeah.. whatever.. we only have queens." Disappointed, we headed over to the room. They also charge you a fortune for SELF PARKING right in front of your room. Ridiculous. When we walked in, I could BARELY breathe because it smelled so bad. When I walked into the bathroom, it was covered in mold, and there was a cultured marble counter top, with a plastic toilet and shower. NOT the "marble" bathroom pictured and described in the ad. It was so disgusting there was no WAY I would go into that bathroom. And it said "Walk in closet?" Perhaps a cockroach could walk in there! Then our room was on the street, as it was advertised as a "Garden room on a private island." Yeah, so private that we could hear the songs people were playing in their cars as they drove by, and their headlights shined into our room. We called and spoke to the manager and demanded to be moved. Meanwhile, I went back out into the car because I couldn't even stand the smell. Suddenly 4 King rooms became available. How did that happen?? So the manager moved us. When we arrived in our new room, it smelled almost as bad, but was so humid I couldn't stand to be in there. Same bad bathroom, and there were dried drips of semen on our brown bed cover. The floor was so dirty I couldn't walk on it, and the bathroom was covered in the same mold, and paint was peeling off of the walls. REALLY?? This is 5 STAR?? I don't think so. It was so disgusting. My husband was mortified because I was so upset and he was trying to do something nice for me. The manager offered to move us again, but I said, "I'm starving and don't want to waste any more time waiting to be moved to more of the same." This had already taken over an hour and a half. They came and cleaned our room to try and make it better. The manager said that he would call us and bring a dehumidifier... he did neither. He did not offer to comp us dinner or anything, only to refund our money and send us back home. After driving 4.5 hours, that wasn't really an option. The grounds are VERY sub par, and when we checked out, the girl seemed totally put out that we received a SLIGHT discount. I couldn't sleep because there was a heater from 1969 that was in the wall and kept turning off and on very loudly. Honestly, the property looks like it was built 50 years ago and hasn't been touched since then. The pools are horrible, and it smells awful. The only thing good I can say about the place is that the restaurant was really good. But seriously, RUN for your lives. This is a 2 STAR property. They should be embarrassed!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect destination hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Diego1
Reviews.Content: It's somewhat cliche and maybe I mentioned this in my last review but they really do make you feel as if you are in some type of tropical paradise. Everyone was extremely pleasant and welcoming - not the fake forced hello at most hotels but the genuine aloha type hospitality. The rooms are great (very clean) and the grounds are very well manicured and look incredible. Seriously, it's a little paradise. I also spent a lot of time exploring San Diego and the location made it easy to get to the cliffs or to head up north to Torrey Pines.

Reviews.Title: “This was the very best vacation me and my husband ever took, the staff was wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maxiegirl01
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went for our anniversary, and we were so happy we chose paradise point resort enjoyed everday!!! We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: pressonjh
Reviews.Content: The resort has a great stay and play location, nice pools and gardens, decent food, nice spa, marina rentals, walking the beach.... The rooms/bungalows are a little sub par for such nice grounds. We found them clean with decent beds, flat screen, couch and fridge. The staff accommodated us with a microwave upon request. The 1 king bedroom we had (304) was a non-view rm (almost literally), with windows facing the hedges along the access parking roads. If we return here we'd probably pay the extra 100 p night to stay in beach side accommodations or ask for a noisy poolside room for the kids to enjoy. Housekeeping was not the best, just perfunctory. Ice machines are at pools, so it can be a little jaunt. I recommend this as a place to stay and play. If you're away exploring very much, you're missing what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “The devil is in the details but overall experience was great”
Reviews.Author: djrhoffman
Reviews.Content: We had a recent family vacation here and overall we really enjoyed it. The bungalows were spacious and the grounds lovely plus the hotel is in a location that is convenient to many attractions including Sea World, Old Town, Downtown and Balboa Park as well as boasting it's own water activities. I travel frequently and I was a little nervous after reading many of the reviews but I think this hotel is better than many people said it was. It wasn't a 3 star hotel. It had all the 4 star amenities, the issue is that many of the details aren't as polished as many 4 star hotels and the clientele felt more downscale than you'd expect to see at a 4 star resort but it had everything we needed: nice pool areas, a solid restaurant (on the bay), a nice spa, quick room service, and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “trip to paradise”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly W
Reviews.Content: My stay at Paradise Point was exceptional. I had a great time. It was relaxing and made me feel like I was on an island retreat getaway. The scenery was beautiful. Hotel staff was very knowledgable and welcoming. I will return for future vacations and would recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful venue”
Reviews.Author: mlewsimpson51atyahoo
Reviews.Content: We got a great off-season price on a very nice location and stay at Paradise Point Resort & Spa - my business associates had great privacy, peace, views in an environmentally aware and sensitive location. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Reg B
Reviews.Content: I had the great opportunity to stay at the Paradise Resort & Spa and it was fabulous. The staff from drive up to exit were outstanding. The grounds are immaculate, the breakfast, lunch and dinner menu's were complete and offered a variety of great dining choices. My room faced the harbor and what a relaxing sunset with the beach, water and boats. This was a business trip for me and I travel extensively, one of my biggest gripes is not being able to work in peace. That was not the case here, I was able to work and enjoy the tranquility together. I enjoyed room service with hot food delivered, concierge service with knowledgeable people. The list of my great experience goes on. I would suggest this Resort for Absolute Relaxation, Business Meetings and Corporate Events.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BelDanChicago
Reviews.Content: This resort was perfect for a quiet rest away from the midwest cold. Weather couldn't have been better, mid 60's to mid 70's and sunny. The grounds were so beautiful and so spread out that we didn't even see half of them. It was so peaceful and green with ponds, waterfalls, birds, ducks, and herons everywhere. Flowers bloomed all around. The grounds were beautifully maintained. Our room was perfect, a garden bungalow with a view of the bay and a few steps from the beach. There was a large closet/dressing room for hanging clothes and suitcases. The bathroom was a little older but spotless, had two sinks separate from the shower with plenty of towels that were replenished daily. The bed was a bit hard but there were plenty of pillows.There are two restaurants on the premises but The Barefoot Grill was closed for renovation for most of our time there. That created some confusion at Baleen (the main restaurant) as they were picking up the slack. The staff was fantastic at both places (Barefoot opened the outside patio the last two days) and the food was very good except for lunch our first day. Every staff member we encountered was pleasant, helpful, and courteous, from the wait staff to the groundskeepers. We had a massage at the Spa and it was wonderful. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was airport transportation was included in the package. Our decision not to rent a car, in part because there was an additional daily fee to park, worked great for us. When we wanted to leave the resort we called the front desk and a cab was waiting for us in 10 minutes. There are set rates to many of the usual places one would want to visit, e.g. the zoo, the old city. The only criticism that we have is we wished there was a microwave to warm our morning coffee or re-warm left over food and to have better lighting in the bathroom. The bed could have had a little more padding. Next trip we would just walk the grounds and hang out at the pools. You would never know you were right outside a large city. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Terri W
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at The Paradise Point Resort and Spa in the Spring of last year as a reward for my husbands great work for his company. The resort was beautiful!! We stayed in one of the bungalows that were located right on the bay. It had a separate living area and a closed off bedroom with a front patio that faced the bay. We took advantage of the spa service, cocktails and dining at The Barefoot Bar and Grill, and even had a gathering around our own private beach bonfire one night. We would HIGHLY recommend this beautiful property to couples, families, or corporate events! Thank you for a most memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: mommountain
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. The rooms are little duplexes, so they have a nice private feeling. We traveled with a 3 year old and a 1 year old. My children loved feeding the ducks and seagulls every morning right out the back door of our room. You wouldn't even have to leave to hotel to have a great vacation. You can rent a boat or go on a sail trip right from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accomadating. The Hotel is a perfect location for San Diego, everything is minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Never have to leave the property”
Reviews.Author: YEGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay of nine days in early February. It was very quiet, for most of the trip we felt like we had the place to ourselves. Friday & Saturday nights were a bit noisier as there was a business conference being held, but there were no problems. The staff are all very friendly, smiling and waving and saying hello. We were upgraded to a beachfront room, and it was so nice to walk out the door and down to the water. Our toddler loved building sandcastles just in front of the room. Other highlights for him were feeding the ducks that hang around on the pond (and they sell little packages of duck food in the island market), climbing the lookout tower, going swimming in the main (heated) pool, and roasting marshmallows on one of the fires they have. As parents, we appreciated the onsite laundry (which was located by a pool, so you can go swimming while your clothes are washing), the good housekeeping staff who were accommodating to our child's naptimes, and the feeling of quiet & safety. I felt no hesitation wandering around the resort after dark. The food at Baleen was good, we ate there every day as the Barefoot was closed for renovations The staff were understanding about having a child in tow, and promptly brought to go containers, and supplied us with the extras (ketchup & peanut butter) that toddlers appreciate. We had an awesome stay, I'm sure I'm forgetting things but can't say enough good things about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away”
Reviews.Author: res0rtist
Reviews.Content: Quite a large resort with good amenity, the ground was kept in an adequent level. Some improvement will make the place look a bit more up to date. The decor of the room is a bit out of date and very economically concentrate. The staffs are the charm of the this place. Friendly and helpful. Air condition in the room can be quite loud. At least in my room

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Running_Erin1078
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this resort are absolutely beautiful, especially at night. There are paths amidst the lush foliage and numerous little sitting venues, around ponds and fountains, on gazebos, etc. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are fairly large, very clean, and are decorated in tastefully minimalist fashion. The on-site restaurant, "Baleen," was excellent. Breakfast was a bit expensive but very good, and they had a farmers market pizza that was to die for! The bay near the resort is very calm and has beautiful views. Overall, a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd S
Reviews.Content: Stayed 13-nights - excellent staff - beautiful property - large - very well maintained - takes army of people to run the place - large employer - significant contributor to local economy (they do their part - important to me). Very much enjoyed the resort, our lodging, our stay - we were well treated. Resort parking costs a little steep - adapted - however - and - utilized the excellent SD tranit system. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very cold room”
Reviews.Author: yvonne5175
Reviews.Content: We arrived Dec 223rd, 2011 after a long flight and arrived to the beautiful tree lined resort, all the trees were decorated with lights which was lovely. Day 1 we found our room very cold and reported to |Reception. Xmas night we were freezing and went to bed fully clothed!!!!! We both got sore throats from the a.c and made an executive decision to check out the next day. We were booked in for 10days, reception were apologetic but for our own health sake we left. On reflection we did not check out how far it was from the city and it was costly popping in and out. It is a lovely resort and the food and staff the excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. They have firepits on their private bayfront beach. While we were there, there were soooo many ducks and gulls. One of the pools had poop around and in it- and not just a little. We spent one day at Mission Beach. It was okay. On our last day we drove to Coronado Island- much better beach area! Wish we had tried that one first. If you like bar-b-q, you must go to Phill's BBQ- located a few miles away. The bbq sandwiches are HUGE and prices are good for portions.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to get away, conference, and /or do the family vacay.”
Reviews.Author: MyAbundance
Reviews.Content: The property is huge, serene, divided good, and has an amazing offering of amenities. I stayed for a several day escape and decompression and glad I came to the right place. It is ridiculously easy to get off property and visit mission beach, the gas lamp, old town or wherever. Sea World is a walk away. I had a snafu with a room and the staff handled it amazingly well. Sometimes fitness. Enters seem to be haphazard and run down, this one is sorta "mama bear" and just right. Outdoor heated pool, multiple pools, paddle boards, bikes, boats, great beach, just super nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Secret gem from a long lost paradise called California”
Reviews.Author: Gigantalope
Reviews.Content: Paradise point is a hole in time. It features mid century architecture, whimsical buildings with roof-lines shaped like the waves of the Pacific; luxurious private bungalows from the era of film stars like Doris Day, and an thick jungle array of mature tropical plants to rival the best botanical gardens of Jamaica or Hawaii . The fare available there is excellent The seafood is wonderful and portions ample. It's in a perfect location for day trips to normal attractions (Padres, micro brew tours, Old Town, Seaworld, Gas Lamp...) but it's so quiet and private, it's as if you really are on your own holiday isle. There are Bungalows available right on the water where you can even have a cozy fire, listen to some Martin Denny and enjoy the best life has to offer. The little store in the resort gives a mulligan to those (like me) prone to forgetting items, like sandals firewood, or wine. (beer selection could be improved) The place was built in the post war era, with ample space which was the custom then, and if you are into vintage stuff, you can get a bungalow and park your vintage car along side setting up the perfect tableau from the glorious past, and still enjoy the luxury and comforts we expect now (hot tub, spa treatment, good coffee, wired & wifi...) The staff is proud of this city, and proud of the property. They are warm very knowledgeable, and happy to find event the strangest details out of what's going on locally. On my visit, much work was being done to update. If you are planning an event of any sort, especially if you want a dose of Big California, this place is unparalleled.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Devoided
Reviews.Content: Was in San Diego to celebrate 21st birthday of my daughter. I had never heard of Paradise Point I am now glad that the website I booked through selected this property. During check-in the fact that it was my daughter's birthday came up, the clerk immediately presented my daughter with a large bag of chocolate pretzels and upgraded our accommodations to a bay-side suite. the patio door on the room opened up to Mission Bay. The beach was 25' feet away and the water about 100'. This truly made the visit special...thank you Paradise Point. We didn't have time to partake in any of the free activities, such as, swimming, tennis, horseshoes, etc. Even though the grounds are a little dark, we felt very safe. I constantly saw security driving around the grounds. We ate at Balleen for breakfast one morning and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise in the heart of San Diego, worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: mybeach101f
Reviews.Content: We arrived at night and were immediately entranced by the lit torches and Christmas lights everywhere. The entire island is a beautiful garden full of fountains with torches. In the lobby it was like a castle with bricks and beautiful couches. Our room was large and well furnished. Fire pits are all around the island so bring your s'more ingredients. The pools were warm and beautiful. People were friendly. One tip. When you get your room, ask the bell man to show you to your quarters. They really should recommend using the bellman if its your first time there. The map makes it look easy, but its not! Finding your room in the dark makes a frustrating beginning to an otherwise wonderful location. It is very dark.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: G0Bucks78
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the resort and had a great time. The grounds are amazingly beautiful and staff was the most genuinely friendly we have ever encountered. From feeding the fish and sharks to swimming in one of several pools or playing on the beach, this resort has it all. Can't wait to be back!!! I've heard their catering staff is unbelivable too!! If you want to host an event, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Another trip to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: cpersonporter
Reviews.Content: Awesome bellhops, front desk personnel, restaurant staff/food, pool and grounds area plus quiet. Love the inland waters and the activity that it draws. Close to Sea World. Really stayed at the resort a lot this trip and enjoyed the main pool. Watching the sunset by the marina is priceless. We'll be back for a 4th visit someday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Staff really friendly & helpful. Was able to rent a boat out & sail around the waters.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Creepy at Night...”
Reviews.Author: IngZel
Reviews.Content: We drove down to San Diego to stay with our niece at Paradise Point and ended up staying only 1 night. She was there by herself originally (she is an adult) and was scared by how dark and her words "how creepy" it seemed at night on the grounds. The lighting was minimal at night and it was hard for us to find her room. The room was very nice but she had called originally for Room Service and was served a shrimp salad with shrimp that looked raw. Granted, it was late at night but shouldn't it still be cooked throughly? We ended up driving off the property to find another place to eat. We were down there looking at colleges for my daughter and since we were going to stay another night, I decided to review Trip Advisor on my iPhone and pick another hotel...which we did and were very happy with our new choice: Grande Colonial in La Jolla. Thank you Trip Advisor!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Days in Paradise..think Gilligan's Island meets San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: rev123
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days in Paradise...kinda sorta. This resort is so unusual-sort of like Gilligan's Island meets San Diego! Think tikki torches..water falls..palm trees and glitz. Favorite things: 1. STAFF-extremely nice and helpful 2. GROUNDS-beautiful -especially at night 3. QUIET-you'll sleep great! 4. LOCATION-perfect place to do San Diego from 5. EXERCISE CENTER/POOL-amazing! Not favorite things: 1-HOTEL PRICE...Crazy expensive!!! (check out hotwire.com for a possible deal) 2-PARKING PRICE...$35!!!!!!!! Really?!?!?!?!?! Can you say...RIP OFF?? (to be fair, I did get comped due to it being my birthday and as I said...super nice staff! advice...go on your birthday!) 3-"RESORT FEE"....$15!!!!!!!! Again..really?!?!?! All you really get for that is internet. Yikes! 4-RESORT NEEDS UPGRADE..I think Paradise Point was probably much nicer back in the day. It's great still, but you can tell things haven't been upgraded in a while. It does look like they are starting do do this (they were ripping up the main lobby when I arrived and redoing it). Bottom line...I enjoyed the place alot and will go back if ... 1-I get a good deal from hotwire.com again 2-they wave the ridiculous parking fee again 3-they reduce the $15 resort fee/internet fee Loved the place...just potentially way too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away”
Reviews.Author: flynomore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at a beachside bungalow here. Although the property is old, that just enhances the charm by providing mature landscaping and a nostalgic Southern California feel. Also, old does not equate with dated or run down in this property. Everything is kept up to impeccable standards, very clean and updated for the most part. The bathroom tub looked like it was from the '50's, but that was overlooked by us in favor of all of the positives of this resort. The grounds are beautiful, and make you feel like you are in Hawaii with tropical plants and flowers all around. With 5 pools, I can't imagine they are ever over crowded. So much property to stroll through and very convenient to most of San Diego. It's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “A Winter Paradise”
Reviews.Author: FitzySyd
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 3 night stay here in early January. The rooms are fairly basic and the resort is in need of a general refurbishment of areas, eg spa flooring, but the Resort exudes a relaxed colonial charm with lovely pools, good tennis and basketball courts, pleasant lagoons and appealing restaurants. To charge for parking in the off season is a bit rude, although we did get a bit of a discount. Bonus was a coin laundry by one of the pools where I could finally get some washing done, in a very pleasant environment! It was pretty quiet being Winter and we had lots of facilities to ourselves which was great. Staff were all friendly and helpful, especially the Lobby Cafe Barista and the Receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, friendly staff and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Samantha S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort with our toddler on a family vacation. The grounds are lush, manicured and beautiful. The walkways over the lagoons don't have railings so it is a bit dodgy with an energetic toddler. Rooms are basic but comfortable - bring slippers, the floors are hard tile. Easy 15 minute walk to Seaworld. Car necessary though. Had a great stay and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: Timmius
Reviews.Content: I kind of feel sorry for Paradise Point. It must have been THE spot in the '70s. We specifically asked for a room that was a suite and had a rom that could be closed off so our 21 month old could sleep and we could still hang out. Thats not what we got. Also, the room was musty smelling and their was old food in the refrigerator. Single room, junior suite. Thankfully, they graciously fixed it. The room was ok. It looked as if it was upgraded in the last 3 - 4 years. Again, the amenities were dated. The walls in the bedroom were bare. The bathroom set-up was weird. The room was definitely not small child friendly. The front door had no dead-bolt or "chain", so evertime my son would pull on the handle, he could open the door and walk outside where the water was 100 feet away. That was pretty scary. Overall, everything was mediocre. We really didn't use it as a resort, and we may have missed out on that. One great benefit was it was 5 minutes to Sea World and less than 15 minutes to the San Diego Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WCZ
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. It is very centrally located to attractions in San Diego. Loved te easy in, easy out. I did not do enough research when booking room, thought a Jr suite would be a bedroom with a living area. It was just one big room! With 4 of us from 8 to 50, this did to fit sleeping arrangements. Would not stay here again because of this. Also was very spread out, we drove to the hot tub and pool at night because it was to cold to walk! Otherwise, service was great and we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed in room, but decent resort.”
Reviews.Author: monksters
Reviews.Content: I I travle often for business trips and have had the opportunity to stay at several outstanding resorts. When I recieved the info regarding this conference, I was excited to take my family along from everything we saw on website. Unfortunately, our room was the most damp and musty room I've ever stayed in. The air conditioner didn't really work too well, but the smell was almost moldy smelling. The bathroom floor was a bit dirty on arrival and the walls weren't all that clean. The location was great for Sea World, but other than that, cab fare will drive you crazy at this place. There is really nowhere close to the resort as far as local attractions and restaurants. On the flip side, the onsite restaurants served really good food. The bell hops are extremely friendly until you decide to walk to your room. Then the attitude begins. Also, beware on taking their recommendations on cabs. We took their "preferred" vender and later found out by hailing our own cab, that we were being overcharged compared to the local yellowcab. If you are looking for a place to just hang out and enjoy the resort, you could probably get it, as others at the conference were very happy with their rooms, but make sure you get an updated room. Afterall, it's San Diego, and there's not much bad you can say about that. Be sure to count on a $25 cab fare to anywhere from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: This resort is awesome!!! We stayed at the resort in January and were more than pleased! This is not the traditional "hotel" as your room is a unique "bungalow" style room. This means you do not have to deal with the rowdy teens making noise or listen to someone else's loud television. We stayed in a bayside bungalow that overlooks the bay. It was amazing. It was obvious the room had been recently renovated creating a more modern feel with 2 flat screen T.V.'s and a huge bathroom. There was even a small kitchen area with refrigerator and microwave to keep leftovers cold and reheat them in the morning for a nice snack. The bay has several fire pits available to the guests to have your own fire pit to roast marshmallows right on the bay. The private coves are exclusive to the resort guests which makes this portion of the bay very private. The hotel staff are very friendly, we even got a welcome call from the front desk to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. The gals at the gift shop were very helpful, even very knowledgeable of the the local attractions and the best way to get around town. Kuddos to Paradise Point and their staff!! They made our vacation a pleasurable one!!!

Reviews.Title: “A vacation inside of a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Todd2PS
Reviews.Content: This is truly a resort hotel on it's own island. The rooms are spread out so you really feel like you're on some tropical isle. The plantings help. My room faced right on to the water. What a treat to be able to walk right out the room door and be on the beach in literally two steps. The room also had a refrigerator and microwave. I have to admit I enjoyed using both and just enjoying my own little bit of paradise. There is a very nice restaurant right on the water with terrific views, a exciting menu, etc. But, a bottle of wine, some cheese and bread and I wasn't goin' anywhere. There's an outdoor place near the restaurant that serves breakfast right on the water. I'd love to know if there's anywhere else in San Diego where you can have breakfast outside on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome honeymoon experience. Get a bay view to appreciate the whole island experience.”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: We loved the bay views. Full Capricorn moon over the bay just made our morning. Bed was so comfortable and room large with every need met.

Reviews.Title: “Old resort, made over.”
Reviews.Author: TheClems
Reviews.Content: This is clearly an old resort that has been very well maintained. We were able to upgrade to a suite upon arrival and we were pleased to find it was a bungalow, on the sand, with a fire pit perfect for roasting marshmallows. Our kids loved that part. We loved that it was modern and stylish. Drawbacks: the little kitchenette has zero supplies. So don't expect as much as a paper napkin. The TV get's terrible reception. The door locked us out one night and we had to call maintenance. Thankfully we had a cell phone on us. We were at the fire pit and needed to go in due to light rain. They were able to fix it pretty fast and brought us two bundles of firewood to make up for the inconvenience. Tip: if you are going to Seaworld, buy your tickets from the hotel shop. When we took them into Guest Services to get them converted from Length of Stay tickets to the year long pass the man at the counter said tickets bought at the hotel are the best because they come without a name printed on them. He said they can be used all week and then converted in to anyone's name for the year long pass. If you knew you would not be coming back but have a friend who is, you can put the friend's name on it.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed two nights over New Year's Eve and had a great experience here. Service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: jimbo4unions
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay away from the main hotel areas of San Diego. Great restaurant for dinner there too.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Somers1
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely the most loved of all the properties we have visited in San Diego. We are from North Carolina and thoughly loved our stay right before Christmas 2011.Room was VERY clean, staff was VERY courteous, food was excellent at both restuarants. It was a summer vacation in the middle of our winter. We would certainly go back if the opportunity comes around again. The parking fee was completely a nuisance. That is the only piece in my mind that was not justified. But, we knew it upfront so we accept it. Anyone from NC who asks, we will highly recommend. We have already spread the word to Moorpark, CA and Union , WA, to our extended families!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: This resort is fantastic, a real prize. We arrived early for check in and was greeted by a friendly staff willing to check us in early. In addition, we requested an upgrade which was handled in a great way. Sitting on the beach outside our suite was fantastic I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Decision”
Reviews.Author: gal-gallivanting
Reviews.Content: This resort is a real showpiece, crÃ¨me de la crÃ¨me & our favorite! I use to live in San Diego, so I know all the other hotel choices, but this is our favorite and 3rd time back. Our little family of 3 stayed during the 2011-12 New Years/Christmas break for 6 days. I think all the rooms are wonderful even if you don't get a beach front one. You can still walk over to the sandy beach & sit in a chair or lay on a towel. Surprise, surprise, we were the only ones on this wonderful private (yet public) white, clean, sandy beach just steps from our room. Upon arriving, we did have a problem with our room's toilet & they very quickly accommodated us to another working room. For our inconvenience they waved our parking fees. Our room was very nicely appointed, very fresh clean sheets too! The resort has 5 pools & lots of things to do. But then, all of San Diego has lots of things to do! At the hotel's Baleen Restaurant, I had the best Pork Chop dinner I've ever eaten, and my husband really enjoyed his fish dinner too. We also enjoyed every mornings breakfast sitting outside in the sun on the waterfront at the Barefoot Grill (morning cafe), you can also eat inside. Bottom-line, we would return to this resort in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't have to pay for all the amenities...”
Reviews.Author: RyanO86
Reviews.Content: I am actually sitting in the airport waiting on my flight home. Just finished my stay at PP with my wife. We stayed for 5 nights in a Junior Bayside Suite. When we first arrived at the Hotel we were greeted by an extremely friendly bellman named Anthony, he goes by Tony though. He loaded our bags for us on his golf cart while we went into the lobby to check-in. Check-in complete, we followed Tony in our rental car to our suite on the bay. He put our bags in our room for us and gave us a tour of our outside space as well as inside of our room. Tony's attitude definitely welcomed us to the more relaxed California lifestyle. The room was very nicely decorated and very clean. I feel bad for the reviewers who wrote a bad review because of a spider or a bug, this has nothing to do with the housekeeping, they are not exterminators. Who doesn't have a spider in their personal residence? Give me a break. Room was very clean. Other vacationers do decide that the chairs behind your room are open to whoever needs them because they are too lazy to carry their own and they did not even have the decentcy to return them, but this is to no discredit for the resort. The reason I titled this review the way I did is because of the few amenities they offer they are all extra charges outside of what you have already paid for your stay. I think for the price you pay to stay there that the parking for your one vehicle should be free. Firewood I also believe should be a free bundle per night per room if you even want to start a fire which not everyone even does. Anything outside of the first free bundle can be charged. Also to bike around the resort for an hour for the two of us was another $25, not too pricey but should still be part of your stay, still keep the time limit, and maybe a penalty fee for a late return, but free for an hour to begin with. There is only two restaurant choices and one of them is more upscale and we both brought vacation clothes, so maybe that is our fault. Our stay was nice overall the surrounding area of the resort is BEAUTIFUL and the area is easy to navigate and the resort is very close to Sea World which is nice. I would also recommend going to Ocean Beach and experiencing a true beach community. The people and the vibe at "OB" are very welcoming. It also has a wonderful pier and you can catch some surfers if you are lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: :Our visit brought back memories of childhood stays at the same property in the 1970s, with modern upgrades, extraordinary service, and delicious food! We were tempted to skip the Zoo and just stay on the beautiful resort grounds. The room decor was unique, and a perfect blend of old and new, with a bit of an Agatha Christie flair. Our family (3 generations) has been staying at this site (in all of its former and current modes) since the 1970s, and are planning to return with all 3 generations together next year, as our experience in January of 2012 was so incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Five-Star pretender”
Reviews.Author: sakgan
Reviews.Content: Whenever we travel to a new city just to vacation and have no first hand reviews of hotels to stay in, we stay at the Hyatt just so we can be guaranteed five-star service. just this once, we thought that staying at a downtown hotel beats the purpose of travelling to SD, since the fun to he had are at the beaches and looked out a 5 star resort style place and came across Paradise Point. but, to our dismay they were nowhere near 5 star. The beach front villas are anything but. they face a cove and nothing else Even basic amenities like a microwave is not included - had to pay $10 / night to warm up the baby food Housekeeping did not clean anything except make the bed Bathroom door only locks from the outside and not from the inside $4 delivery fee for a pair of plastic silverware key card did not work for half the trip (we got a $50 credit for that though) rooms are good sized, but if you book the villa thinking that you will have total privacy, you will be disappointed The only thing that kept us from having a totally ruined vacation was the awesome city of San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: LC C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at plenty of hotels during my life, and this one was my favorite of all time!! I have decided from now on I will never listen to negetive reviews and only decide for myself! I was expecting the worst to the point, I packed my own coffee pot and cleaning supplies, cereal, cutlery..... WHY did I waste al that room!
