We were still able to spend quality time with our family and friends that had travelled with us. Kudos to the staff for handling that situation with such grace!

Reviews.Title: “Redone and worth a look - and stay”
Reviews.Author: JingleIH
Reviews.Content: Recently redone and very nicely so. Beautiful views of the water. Quite private and beautifully landscaped and kept. Service A+ except in the Barefoot Grill, where they need better training, but I think that is coming. A great place for a wedding or reunion. Everything for the wedding we attended was right there - and beautifully done. A couple of minor things they need to work on - lighting in the rooms (but I was there with someone with sight problems, so perhaps was more picky than most) and the electrical sockets.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations in every area. When can we go back???”
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful gardens and views. We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our stay and just wish the weather was sunnier and warmer so we could have enjoyed the pool areas more. The room was updated, very clean and a pleasure to relax in. Great resort and location. Would love to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Totally surprised.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: Was apprehensive about staying here due to some reviews but upon arrival I was totally blown away by the tropical grounds and convenient location. Rooms were extremely clean and accommodating. Our room had a slight musty odor upon arrival, but was alleviated after we turned the air on. Employees are extremely friendly and helpful. Grounds were extremely clean and well kept. Pool/spa area was very tropical and up to date. Barefoot bar and grill was very well situated with views of the bay. Definitely would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke I
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on Priceline for this resort for our anniversary. We walked to Sea World..it was THAT close. Wish we could have stayed longer and used all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Msanc14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend in a bayside bungalow. Bare foot bar and room service food and service were good. The room was outdated and was not clean. For over $500 a night I expected better amenities (i.e. extra soap, lotion, a mini bar, plates, utensils etc). You are definitely paying for location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Chrisj319
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found the resort very comfortable and inviting. It is a laid back place with focus on the family from the ducks on the numerous ponds that you can feed to the pools and bike hire, lots to do if you atre that way inclined or just chill at one of the pool. Great resort and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: BR58
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect, the grounds are stunning. Since this property has been here for years, the rooms, although updated,are not quite what you may expect for these prices. Close to a lot of activities or you can stay there and have plenty to do. The pools and waterfront dinning are great. We have been several times and always enjoy our stay (they shuttle guy's are great) but there are small things they could do to improve the experience. The $15 Passport (a fancy way to charge a resort fee) is something they should do away with. The Internet access is extremely poor and for over $300 per night, come on,they should not charge for it. A make up mirror in the bathroom and do away with the pump soap in the shower. All in all a nice weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “One night ok - probably wouldn't have stayed longer....”
Reviews.Author: newtravelgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight during a road trip from our Anaheim vacation. The room itself seemed nice, but if you looked closer, your could see it was a little run-down, perhaps could use a little reno in the bathroom, etc. The rooms are very spread out, which makes it hard to get to the pools for a quick swim, etc. We asked several employees how to get to the beach and we got very vague answers. We finally figured out a way to get down there (with a stroller) and was not impressed. I expected a little picturesque spot where we could sit and watch boats for a bit, but what we got was spongy and rocky. And quite a climb back up the embankment (with a stroller) to the rooms. The main restaurant was good (Barefoot Bar), although the chairs and railings (overlooking the pond) could also do with a refurb. Food was decent and service was average. Seemed like a decent place to lay your head for a night or two, but I would have been disappointed with a longer stay here, expecting to use the beach and pools often. The big plus for this place was its proximity to Sea World! And yes, the resort fees were a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Just a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Mike90275
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a bayside one bedroom. We were welcomed and hosted by George the Duck (my kids named him). They rode bikes, they swam, and my wife and I had a wonderful dinner. This is a very special and magical place, with paths to the casitas with views, kidsâ€™ activities --- including a natural grass putt-putt course, huge pool, and never ending recreation. The parking fee is stupid. It's close to Sea World. It's now been a couple of months and my kids still talk about how great it was, and want to go back. Which is fun, because I stayed there in the 70's as a kid, and I remember it the same way. Only complaint, the bathroom could use some work, and the rooms have some sort of a weird African motif going on, with the out of place furniture --- but the reality is that is far from a valid complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Only if the rooms were kept clean.... terrible value”
Reviews.Author: SteveFromBelmont
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Paradise Point twice. The first time in 2010 we ran into a number of issues - the most significant was the bathroom in our first room was very dirty. We managed to switch rooms and get thru the trip without too many other issues. Management was responsive (this time). So, we tried Paradise Point again this year and - guess what? Upon checkin, the room smells really bad! We get maid service to address this. Next day is Seaworld (nice location for this) and we return about 5p. The room is not made up. Maid service is called and they make up the room. Next day, same issue. This time when I call maid service, I'm told that I have to wait until the maid gets around to us. At 5pm? After the trip, I wrote a detailed email to management describing these events and I essentially got back a canned email saying " sorry and hope to see you next time". No reply to my follow-up email. PS. Their location near Seaworld is nice but since everybody has a car anyway, I'd drive a few extra minutes for much better values.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property!”
Reviews.Author: Perkymum
Reviews.Content: The Bayside rooms are fantastic! Beautiful views, right on the beach...very family friendly. They offer a variety of different activities right there on the property! Great restaurants and pools!

Reviews.Title: “Add on room fees...”
Reviews.Author: CA-Thor
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point has a GREAT location with the Bay just steps away and beautiful grounds. My rant is the fees they tack on to your room rate PER DAY, $15 "Resort Fee" and $25 parking fee. These fees can not be opted out of except parking if you do not have a car and how many people go on vacation to So. Calif with out a car. So plan on an extra $40 to be added to you room rate, why not just make these fees included in the room rate?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent--Sea World Package!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle11795
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation and our children, my husband and I had an amazing time. We loved the sea world package and water taxi ride to sea world. The food, accomodations and service was excellent. We definetley plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding At Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: jilldanna
Reviews.Content: We had the joy of having a wedding at Paradise Point a week ago! It was a fantastic experience from the first day of arriving to see the site and talk with Julie Arroyo the catering manager to the day of the event. Julie helped us plan our event and was very patient since we were so new at planning a wedding. On the wedding day Julie was very attentive to our needs and the service of setting up the ceremony site to the reception was incredible. The food, especially the tray appetizers was terrific! (We chosed the plated service, chicken dinner and it was perfect) We truly could just enjoy our even as much as the parents of the bride are able to do this on such a big day! Thank you Paradise Point for making such a special day for us!

Reviews.Title: “A resort that cares”
Reviews.Author: Tesstravels_21
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Paradise Point Resort when San Diego was out of power - in fact the entire southern end of CA was out of power. It looked like it could have been a long time for the power to come back on. The management went out of their way to provide food for the guests. With very fast thinking and a lot of hard work, the staff pulled together and turned a bad situation into a great time for everyone. I look forward to staying there again! Tess

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zonie083
Reviews.Content: A great place to visit for a long weekend. Splurge a little and get a junior suite - don't worry if you can't get a water view as the grounds are just as nice. The big rooms allow parking right up to your door and you can bring your own bike and rid all over the grounds. (You can rent bikes too, but why if you're able to rack your own?) The resturants at pretty good. Bare foot bar has great drinks and a really good breakfast. Belens is good too, but the specialty that night was the martini's (Martini Night) which were well mixed and stiff with top-shelf libation. The rooms may seem out dated to some, but I've been traveling to SD since I was a kid and these rooms are update with nice beds and linens, good TVs and clean. Even the five star originals are out dated if you count the quality of the ageless building (including places like the Hotel Del Coronado and La Valencia in La Jolla) Staff was friendly and helpful, and there's just a lot to do there if you like a slower but interesting pace.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Claudia L
Reviews.Content: Awesome place for any type of visit! Ours was a simple family vacation with small children. Pools are great! The bay and private beach are the highlight for little ones! Can't beat playing in the sand, calm waters of the bay and kite flying. Feeding the ducks, turtles and fish is another highlight of this property. There is also a wonderful look-out tower to climb for a spectacular 360 view! Dinner is amazing and highly recommended at the award-winning Baleen restaurant. This truly is an awesome place and we look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point Resort vacations”
Reviews.Author: Danmo05
Reviews.Content: I had reservations about staying here after reading numerous accounts over the past couple of years, but was rewarded with one of our best stays in many years by this resort and their staff. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a bungalow overlooking the bay. This was quite unexpected but very appreciative. The property does show some age, but overall the facilities were in good working order. We did not eat at the property since we had our own transportation but I noticed quite a lot of guests did. The beach surrounding this property was kept clean of debris and clutter and we enjoyed the fire pit outside on one of our nights. The staff was always supportive in answering questions. We did have one surprising event occur on our 2nd night. This was the day southern California lost all power from 3:30PM until 4:00AM. The resort had the guests go to the pool area and served food from the gas powered grill free of charge. They also went out of their way for us to see in our dark rooms by supplying "glow sticks". Again, without charge. My only negative comment was that in the middle of the resort is a large flag pole flying the American flag that we used as a focal point if we got turned around. The flag disappeared after our 2nd night and was never raised again by the time we left 2 days later. The staff joked that it was stolen, but I never did get a serious answer to what happened to it.

Reviews.Title: “roaches, blood stains, and evictions, oh my!”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: Billed as a family friendly resort, we chose Paradise Point as the place to stay when we took our 3 year old to San Diego for his first family vacation. Placing our reservations a month in advance, I decided to splurge and reserve the bay view junior suite. We arrive with an exhausted, nap-ready kid at 2PM; we were told that our room was not ready yet, we're given pool keys, and told that we could visit any of the resort's pools while we wait. I ask for our room # so that I we could park and visit the pool closest to our room... we're told that they could not disclose our room #. Huh? Things got worse from there. At 3:30, we were given the go ahead to check in. We picked up our room keys, opened the door, and discovered that we had been given a garden view suite, not the bay view I had reserved. Strike 2. Going to the front desk and requesting a new room at this point is untenable...our child is exhausted...we decide to speak with the front desk the next day. That night, after the boy went to sleep, my wife and I decide to enjoy a glass of wine and some quiet time. We discover that we're not alone...another tenant, a 2 inch long cockroach is sauntering across the floor. This roach was so big, that I could have either smashed him with a shoe or put a leash around him...he does go very well with the three spiders in the ceiling. Strike 3. The roach successfully dispatched, our wine drank, we decide to call it a night...did I mention that we had to go to the store to buy plastic cups to drink our wine because the wet bar in our suite had no cups, no plates, no silverware, nothing? We crawl into bed and discover a blood stain on our duvet. It's not an OJ Simpson sized blood stain, but large enough that the maid should have caught it...we feel the benefit of the doubt slowly shrinking away. Morning. Surprised the coffee maker works, I have my morning cup and climb into the shower. When I get out, I reach for a towel to dry myself only to discover that it is as soft as a roofing tile. Seriously some free beach towels we got at dodger stadium that we use to dry our dog are soft as silk compared with ones. After a big day we return during naptime (1:30 PM) only to discover that the maid hasn't made up our room yet...so, off to the pool we go while we wait for housekeeping. Strike #?? I've lost count. My lovely bride stays with the boy (and her cocktail) at the pool while I visit the front desk to discuss my first day at PP. The guy at the front desk promises the maid will be earlier tomorrow, to report the insect infestation, and that the OJ duvet will be replaced. And the bayview room? He tells me that we got a free UPGRADE from a Bayview Junior Suite to a Garden View Suite. How thoughtful. It would have been nice to have been asked if we wanted this generous upgrade. Day 3. The towels are still exfoliating me, housekeeping had finished by the time we returned from Seaworld, and no signs of any other 6 or 8 leg co-tenants...maybe they're turning this thing around? Fat chance. That night we ordered an early dinner so we would have time to make smores at the fire pit in the main pool area with our son. We arrive at the fire pit at 7:30 PM. No fire. A couple sitting nearby tell us that they have already put in a request to have the fire lit. Not taking any chances I go to the front desk. The woman behind the desk tells me that she'll "put in a request for the service." When I ask her what that means, she tells me that she punches in the request in the computer which will cause someone to show up "soon." Not very reassuring. 7:45 PM. No fire. I return to the front desk. This time there are three parties ahead of me checking in. The woman at the front desk knows why I'm there, but she pretends she doesn't see me to make me wait. When I get to the front of the line, she explains that she doesn't know why the fire hasn't been lit yet. I suggest, impatiently, that perhaps she should pick up the phone and call someone. Her manager beckons me, promises she'll have someone there right away. 8:15 PM. Still no fire. My son is doing his best at waiting patiently for smores. I am no longer patient. So I bring him and his marshmallow laden stick to the front desk. The women there still have no answer for the delay, and seemingly no empathy for my problem. Exasperated, on my way out, I tell them to "light the damn fire pit." The manager behind the front desk threatens to evict me. Unreal. 8:30 PM. We talk with a security guard walking through the main pool area. He gets on his radio. The fire pit is lit within five minutes. Was that so hard? 10:00 PM. We decide to crawl into bed for our final night at the hotel. We pull down the sheets and see the familiar blood stain on the bedspread. Well, I guess I cannot complain lest my evicted family has to spend the night in our car.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: CrazyCatLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paradise Point for the last 6 days of a 2 week California holiday and really enjoyed ourselves. We nearly didn't book here given some of the earlier negative comments (especially regarding cleanliness) but I'm very pleased that we did. We are avid travellers having been to every continent and would say that our experience stood up to standards set by similar luxury resorts around the world. Having clearly also stayed at the same time as some of the negative reviews below (during the power outage) perhaps we were lucky, but I'd like to offer our positive views to provide some balance. Our first impression which lasted throughout our stay, was that this was a luxury resort with beautifully kept grounds, amenities and rooms. We were in a Lanai Garden King room which had a serene private patio overlooking a pond. Although probably towards the bottom of the rooming price range, our room was mopped every day, towels were changed when needed and after leaving a polite request for our housekeeper, extra complimentary coffee was left for us. We were very close to the waterfall pool which suited us as it was very quiet. Although I agree that the main pool did look murky, I don't think it could have been as dirty as alleged in previous emails if it was treated the same as the waterfall pool - the latter was attended to every day at regular intervals by a legion of staff. I do agree that the additional daily parking and the 'passport' resort fee were annoying but this was made clear at booking so we computed it into the cost of the holiday. Unlike many all-inclusive holidays elsewhere there are relatively few activities which are complimentary so be careful as extras can add up. We took out a sailboat from the marina for 4 hours and we didn't feel the charge of $30 per hour was unreasonable. We chose to pay the $28 daily parking fee and keep our hire car as it provided us with freedom to eat out and see San Diego which we preferred. Without this you would be pretty much committed to eating every meal in the hotel and in fact we didn't do so once as there are so many restaurants within a short driving distance. We felt that we did more than offset the parking fee by buying in both breakfast and lunch items from a local supermarket and storing them in our spacious fridge. Contrary to an earlier comment, I was impressed by how the Paradise Point staff dealt with the power outage. Considering there was no electricity at all in California, and parts of Mexico and Arizona, I'm not sure how possibly they could have anticipated an outage of this magnitude or have been entirely prepared for it. Having said that they dealt with the situation admirably by keeping one restaurant open in running a series of gas barbecues and drinks in iced coolers. They managed to keep going until 8.30pm by which time most families with young children had been fed. All in all, we had a fabulous stay and would definitely return or recommend Paradise point to others looking for a relaxing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: KYJman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paradise Point in August 2011 for a business conference. I was a little hesitant because of the negative reviews I had read on TripAdvisor but there were no other options for the conference. My experience was very positive. The property is beautiful (as others have stated) and has a tropical "feel". My room was excellent, food at "Barefoot" was good and the conference venue was exceptional. In particular, the waterfront conference setting was unique and beautiful. All hotel staff members that I encountered were very courteous, professional and offered to help make my stay enjoyable. The only complaint was that the internet connection was not very good in my room, either wireless or wired. I was not able to use my laptop in my room. I asked about wireless service at the pools, was told it was available but the signal was not strong enough to be useable. I had considered bringing my family to the conference with me but with two toddlers, we decided against this (in part because of not being sure of the condition of the property after reading the reviews). This is a great property for families but probably not for those traveling with babies or toddlers. There are apparently no suites with kitchens which many consider essential when staying in a hotel for several days with very young children. It is a very nice property, any former problems have been corrected and I would stay here again with no hesitation. I would suggest that the management gently reply to all of the negative reviews on Trip Advisor. These reviews are certainly considered when many people are making travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “tropical”
Reviews.Author: davidHullUk
Reviews.Content: this hotel was lovely didnt know what to expect after reading the bad reviews our room was lovely decorated clean and comfy could have been a bit bigger ,the grounds were lovely it was nice on a night doing the smores at the fire pits i we ate at both restaurants we would stay at this hotel again if in the area all the staff are very helpful and its a good location

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Audra P
Reviews.Content: LOVED our stay and will be back. Wonderful clean room, staff and restaurants! Beautiful garden grounds. Cool pools and walks along the private beach. Fire pits and smores at night. Could you really ask for more? Will be back as soon as we can! I really don't understand the "bad" reviews. The staff was always happy & helpful. The restaurants were awesome & the service quick. The grounds are SO easy to get around. It really not that hard! WHO CARES about TV! Come on! I didn't go on vacation to sit in my room and watch TV!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but definitely not a 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: SeattleLou
Reviews.Content: There were both good and not so good aspects of our experience at this resort. The hotel is in a great location, especially if you are planning on visiting SeaWorld or The San Diego Zoo. Our two rooms unfortunately faced the parking lot which did not provide a very scenic view. We definitely recommend requesting a room that faces either the pool or is on the water. Upon checking in one of the rooms, there was an overwhelming smell of paint in the room, as if the walls had just been painted. We tried to air out the room for a few hours but the smell was too much. We called reception so that we could switch rooms and we were moved to another room about four to five doors away. When we entered our new room, it literally smelled like a wet dog or smelly shoes (not very pleasant). We found the room change frustrating because we were traveling as a group and did not want to be split up from our friends. We ended up staying in the new stinky smelling room after airing it out for two days because we did not want to be moved any further from our group. The other room which our friends were staying in smelled fine, no issues. We also found the resort fee and parking fee a little steep ($15 a day "Passport to Paradise" resort fee and $25 a day for parking). We did receive a discount on the parking fee from the reception desk which made it more realistic ($10 a day). The reason why we felt that the resort fee was unnecessary is because we did not end up using any of the "inclusions" in this fee. (The fee includes the following activities: Bocce ball, croquet, ping pong, tennis, basketball, the fitness center and Wifi). The activities that we wanted to do, Miniature golf and the surrey ride were not included. The Surrey ride is $35 an hour which allowed all of us to ride together, four adults and two children riding in the basket on the front of the surrey. We really enjoyed the bike ride and would recommend doing it. The kids liked it the most. We also really enjoyed having a bonfire on the beach, on the last night of our stay. You can buy the wood and the items for making Smores in the resort gift shop or if you want a wider selection of snacks for your bonfire you can go to the store (Vons) a short distance away and buy your own items. Moving on to the interior of the rooms... We liked that the rooms had hardwood floors which is generally cleaner than carpeting. Unfortunately, the floors were not swept or cleaned during our stay! We had to literally wash our feet after walking on the floors, every time we walked barefoot in our room.That was both unecessary and quite annoying. The room includes a small refrigerator and coffeemaker. The beds were comfortable and the water pressure in the shower was good. There is a flat screen tv mounted to the wall which offers movie rentals for either $14 or $16 per rental, depending on how new the movie is. We must note that the tv reception was not good in either room. Several channels were quite fuzzy.If we were in our room more often, we would have found some of these issues unacceptable, especially for a hotel of this reputation. As we were rarely in our rooms, we didn't call attention to them. We did enjoy the grounds of the hotel. The landscaping is well done and pretty. The staff that we encountered were professional and nice. Although, we will note that some of the reception staff needs to be better informed of the check in process. Upon first checking in to the hotel, we were told that there would be $100 authorized on our credit cards for any misc. fees for each room (which is standard at hotels and wasn't an issue). Upon checking out of the hotel, my friend's card had the $100 held as previously mentioned but my card had $840 held. Not only was this unexpected, it was also very annoying to have to call the hotel after we had already left, in order to clarify the situation. I spoke with someone at the front desk, who said that the person who had checked us in should have told us that it was $100 authorized per NIGHT, not all together. This did not add up though, as we had stayed five nights, not eight plus and it was an odd amount held on my card, completely different from my friend's charge. Let me note that we didn't have any room charges, such as movie rentals or anything else that would have accounted for any charges. The staff member told me that the charge would come off in a few days. I did not make an issue about it, as the charge came off after about 4 days. It was simply an annoyance for me and a lack of training/communication on the part of the reception staff. All in all, our experience was average here. We would recommend this hotel on the basis of location, as it is so convenient to the beach and SeaWorld. Also, it is a short drive to the airport, Zoo and Old Town. Although,we definitely would not pay full price to stay here, it is not worth the full amount. Look for a package deal if you plan on staying here. *Tips for SeaWorld: We went to SeaWorld twice, using the two day pass that you can buy on the SW website. We really enjoyed the convenience of taking the water taxi from the resort even though it was pricey in comparison to parking at SeaWorld ($46 for four adults and two small children). It takes you to the back entrance of SeaWorld so that you are able to beat the lines and the quick trip over is relaxing. What we would recommend is: if you are visiting SeaWorld more than once: take the water taxi from the resort on the weekends when lines are the longest, park in the SW parking lot during the week when the wait is almost nonexistent (Parking is $14 a day or $19 for premium parking - i.e. Rows 1-6). Have a great trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Virginia20112
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the hotel's Garden Bungalows for 4 days at the end of August. The room furnishings were okay, but not outstanding. The pictures on the hotel website make it look a lot nicer than it really is. There were two flat panel HD televisions; however, neither had HD cable, so the TV images were fuzzy. Oh, and there were only 7 or so channels to watch. We stayed at Hilton and Marriott properties later in our vacation, and both had better television images and channel options. We don't watch a ton of TV, but it's a nice option when you're traveling with young children who have early bedtimes. The bathroom was mediocre. It lacked basic amenities, like a towel rack. For $600 a night, I expect to get a room with a towel rack in the bathroom, so that I don't have to lay the towel on the floor while I shower. Gross. The bathroom also just didnâ€™t feel very clean. Our room had a microwave and a small fridge, but we weren't provided cutlery, plates, glasses, or even a wine bottle opener. Thus, neither the fridge nor microwave was terribly useful. We ordered room service our first night, and set aside the unused cutlery to eat leftovers with the next day. The "helpful" room service took our cutlery when they cleaned the room, leaving us with uneatable leftovers. The pools were fine, but not really warm enough. Honestly, the other two hotels we stayed at during the rest of our vacation had nicer swimming pools and room amenities and were substantially cheaper. I think my biggest gripe about this property is that they don't provide complimentary coffee in their lobby. There's a stand in the lobby to buy coffee, but it costs $4 per cup. But, seriously, when you're charging $600 a night, the least you can do is provide guests with coffee. Yeah, there was a dinky coffee maker in the room, but they only provided enough coffee grounds for about 1.5 cups of coffee. The property is very close to the bayside of the beach, but Iâ€™d never dream of getting near the water. It was very muddy close to the shore and smelled vaguely of sewage. The fire pits were fine, but I think thereâ€™s only 13 or so pits for the entire property, so families are lined up waiting to use them. I wouldn't stay here again. Big waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Lights out in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: KKoerber
Reviews.Content: I was at the Paradise Point Resort for a business meeting this week, and the service was wonderful. The power went out all over San Diego County, and the resort went treated us very well. I had to pack my clothes quickly in the dark, and I forgot something. I called them the next morning (when everything was working again.), and they are shipping me my item. They also moved all of their food service to the outdoor grill, and fed us dinner. The power outage closed every restaurant and grocery store for about a 50 mile radius, so we really needed it!! Paradise Point is great when everything is working well, and when everything is not working!!!

Reviews.Title: “NO BAD DAYS IN PARADISE.”
Reviews.Author: allan s
Reviews.Content: why would anybody want to spend their vacation anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Monica Z
Reviews.Content: Being the manager of a 4 Star Spa Hotel in Canada, I have pretty high standards on holiday. Call me a hotel snob - I have been in the industry for almost 20 years. I was a bit skeptical reading so many unpleasant reviews but decided to give it a go as the price was right. After spending a night sleeping over at the Safari Park with the elephants, we checked into a Lanai Garden King (room 776) which was just fine as we spent all of our time at the beach or by the waterfall pool across from our bungalow. The room was recently updated,freshly painted, and the king bed was extremely comfortable. I loved the sink separate from the bath/toilet. Every single staff member we encountered was professional and friendly. We loved the Barefoot Bar and Grill so much, we ate there every day. Tim is a great bartender and Jessica is a great server too. Annabelle seemed to work every shift of every day. Bottom line, shop for the best rate and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “SPLENDID !!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ProudMommy72
Reviews.Content: This is my first time using trip advisor, and wanted to let everyone know about my stay. It is an Amazing place for families! Not sure the reason for all the negative reviews. But My family and I stayed at Paradise Point a few weeks ago. We visited from Arizona and had a pleasant stay. My kids enjoyed riding the surreys every day, we even rented a jet ski ! The resort has 5 pools! We only enjoyed the main pool, the food at Tropics Bar & Grill was DELICIOUS.. Also, we took a trip to SeaWorld which is right across the way from the resort, we rode the water taxi. My kids had a blast ! Celleesha (forgive me for the spelling) remembered me each and everyday, addressed me by NAME & my kids adored her! Seeing her smile was enlightening each day. She shouldnt be working out at the pool, she needs to be working some other department. Such good manners!!!! We stayed in a bayside bungalow!!!! Very nice and worth the extra money. Overall GREAT STAY ! We WILL BE BACK!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sea world”
Reviews.Author: hallage
Reviews.Content: This place was a grower with us ....on arrival being charged to park next to your accommodation $28 per day is just daylight robbery ......and then the drive up to your challet to find the outside with peeling woodwork was not great. What was great was the location - so close to sea world and 10 mins by water taxi to a private entrance was fantastic. However the beach bar was expensive $21 for a main course of meatballs and again drinks expensive and service lacking!!! by the end of our 4 day stay we quite liked it and sitting on the jetty watching sail boats with thes sun setting was great.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and outdated”
Reviews.Author: frankin7666
Reviews.Content: Way overpriced for the value, they charge 28.00 a day for parking and 15.00 a day for activities even if you don't use them! Resturants were just so so and everything in the room was just barely passible. housekeeping was less than impressive! dirty bathtubs, spiders in room !

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: westcoastla
Reviews.Content: I remember the first time I visited the South Seas themed Paradise Pointe. It was thirty years ago and the name of the resort was Vacation Village. My mom won two nights in a sales contest and this was one of the fanciest resorts we had ever experienced. My eyes widened as I gazed at the lagoons, tropical flowers and cabana-style one-story cottages. Located on 44-acres, the tropical island, situated on Mission Bay was filled with families riding bikes, building sand castles and swimming in the pools. I excitedly bounded out of the car and walked over to the lagoon filled with ducks and admired the observation tower. Many years later Princess Cruise Lines purchased the property when the popular television show, THE LOVE BOAT was one of the most watched television shows in America. Princess was going to sail to Mexican ports from the port of San Diego and package cruise and land vacations. Guests could cruise on their ships and stay overnight before or after the cruise at their resort. I never stayed at the San Diego Princess Resort, however in 1998, the resort was purchased by LaSalle Hotel Properties and one of San Diegoâ€™s top vacation destinations was renamed Paradise Pointe. Since then, Iâ€™ve been returning throughout the years. With one-mile of beachfront and 462 spacious rooms, the resort hasnâ€™t changed that much since my first visit. The decoration is more Balinese then I remember from the past. There are the Lanai Garden rooms with your choice of a King-size bed with a sleeper sofa or two Queen size beds. The semi private patio has two Adirondack chairs for reading a good book or sitting outside and enjoying a pre-dinner cocktail. The Garden Suites offer larger patios, walk-in closets and dining area with a wet bar. The Lanai Bay side offers nice views of Mission Bay and are situated near blazing fire pits for evening sâ€™mores. The Bayside Junior Suite Premium Lanai Suites offer more square footage, greater views and more amenities. One feels as if they are in Hawaii walking around the lush grounds. Itâ€™s not the fanciest resort in San Diego and you will notice deferred maintenance, yet its fun for all ages. There are five pools sprinkled around the grounds. All the pools have been updated and the main pool near the lobby has a sandy beach. The family lagoon pool has a hot spa, as does the quieter adult lagoon pool. There is also a meadow and waterfall pool. The tennis/basketball/croquet and ping pong area are underused, however guests seem to enjoy renting Surrey bicycles and playing on the golf putting course. There are two excellent dining options. The Barefoot Bar and Grill is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner offering glorious views of the sailboats, kayaks and paddle boarders on Mission Bay. For dinner, the elegant Baleen Restaurant was my choice for a birthday celebration. Even though the night air can be chilly, the restaurant has outdoor heaters to keep guests comfortable while sitting on the patio overlooking the lights of Mission Bay. Paradise Pointe is a successful wedding spot with at least three weddings going strong during our one night visit over Labor Day weekend. Guests wanting to spend a day at Sea World can leave their car at their designated parking spot and hop on the Sea World Water Taxi at the dock. The 15-minute cruise will take guests right to the exclusive back gate. A round trip ticket for adults is $9 and children $5. 1404 Vacation Road, San Diego (858)490-6365, www.paradisepoint.com

Reviews.Title: “Cool spot, great location, very close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: the Beach cabanas is the way to go. Water Taxi service to Sea World is very convenient and fun for the kids. on premise activities are fun and easy to use. Baleen restaurant is a bit over priced but food quality is great.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations we have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis N
Reviews.Content: We had a bayside room, the water was right out our back door. We have a boat and we could moor it right by our room, it was fantastic. The service was excellent, everyone was very nice. Theres alot of ameneties. Theres Tennis, Basketball, Ping-Pong, horseshoes, minature golf I know I'm forgetting other things that they had also. They charge you an extra 15.00 dollars to use all these things, but other places charge you for each service you want to use. In the long run it was cheaper. We had a wonderful time, I would recommend Paradise Point to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit, would come back again!”
Reviews.Author: iwanttogoonholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of four (two 'kids' in their twenties) for a week at the end of July. We have previously stayed here twice before and it is one of our favourite places to visit. We are always a bit wary of going back to places we've loved before, in case they've changed (for the worse) since our previous trip. However, aside from a couple of minor niggles, we had another great stay here. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and we love the resort feel. The location is very handy for all the San Diego attractions, and whilst you do need a car to get around, you can tell this from the location when booking. San Diego is also much nicer and easier to drive around than LA (for us Brits at least!) The rooms had been renovated since our last trip in 2007 and whilst the comments about the dusty floors did have some validity, overall we were very pleased with the standard of accommodation - after all, you're walking about in flip flops/sandals or barefoot, so you're bound to bring in a certain level of dust and dirt. We were given 'adjoining' rooms which basically meant that we had a bungalow to ourselves which was an ideal set up. The beds were huge - and high! Having fridges in both rooms and a microwave in one was also really handy. We loved being able to sit out on our patio and have breakfast overlooking the pond. It's a shame that they've changed the toiletries, as the old ones were lovely, although they've obviously wised up to everyone taking them home! The new ones are still really good though. We never had a problem getting sunbeds by the main pool, even if arriving in the afternoon after going out for the morning. Part of our Virgin package meant that we got free parking (always appreciated - especially when it's right outside the room), didn't have to pay the 'Passport to Paradise' fee and got $25 per room, per night resort credit - which equated to $350! It seems ironic that they are trying to introduce the mandatory 'passport' fee, but none of the staff around the resort seemed to know what to do with the slips of paper for mini golf, bike hire, etc. We were however able to enjoy two meals at the Barefoot Grill (including two free desserts for one meal) and two lunches by the pool with our resort credit and still had some leftover to treat ourselves with in the gift shop! The food at the Barefoot was delicious as usual, although we were slightly disappointed to see the menu had changed - we loved their Philly cheesesteaks and pulled pork! Nevertheless, the relaxed atmosphere and beautiful bayside location were perfect for that San Diego feel. If we are to return to San Diego again in the future, we'd definitely look to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: P S
Reviews.Content: We recently held our daughter's wedding at Paradise Point. Both the ceremony site and reception site were beautiful. Thanks to Julie, the Catering Sales Manager, everything was perfect. We could not have asked for things to go more smoothly. Working with Julie was a pleasure. She was thorough, helpful, attentive to our requests and preferences, and went the extra mile to ensure the event was extraordinary. The reception staff was also excellent and made sure that everything was to our satisfaction. The food and wine were also excellent. I would recommend Paradise Point without reservation for a wedding or similar event. The only negative was related to the lodging. We booked three rooms the day before the wedding so that we could get ready for the rehearsal. In spite of requesting early check-in and getting to reception at 1230, we could not get our rooms. They told us they would be ready shortly but we got one room at 3:00 P.M., one at 3:30 P.M. and one sometime after 4:00 P.M. which did not allow us adequate time to get ready for the rehearsal. Fortunately, we did decide to check in the day before the wedding. If we'd had the same experience on the day of the wedding, it would have been a disaster. As it was, we were only late for the rehearsal dinner. When they say check-in is at 4:00, they man it.

Reviews.Title: “Large property with many great amenities for families. Really enjoyed staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Linnea G
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort for families. The rooms are spacious and the property has so many great amenities for all ages. The tropical theme really made us feel we were on vacation. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and the furnishings nice. We really felt it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort on the beach”
Reviews.Author: joycekwong
Reviews.Content: The resort has lovely bunglalows on large resort grounds with direct access to the beach and waters. We stayed 1 night and only wished we stayed longer! The room was spacious and decor modern. Beds were comfortable. We loved the resort grounds, especially the beach and access to the waters. We also enjoyed our dinner there. Would recommend this unique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: michael c
Reviews.Content: Very nice grounds with lots of trees, plants giving a nice tropical feel. Staff was very pleasant . Minutes to Sea World. Separate pools for family with kids and adult area. Boat rentals available to tour the bay. Separate beach area with night time fire pits was nice. Restaurants were good, service a little slow. Good value for money, definitely would return if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience. Be careful to ask if the "GARDEN VIEW" room is really facing the garden or the PARKING lot.”
Reviews.Author: ClaudioArriola
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. Main complain, we booked a GARDEN VIEW (room 306) but it was actually facing the PARKING LOT. Rooms 305 and 307 had a real GARDEN VIEW terrace. It seems that one room faces the parking lot and the adjacent one the garden. Make sure you ask if the view is to the terrace or the garden. Besides that, we had bad luck twice on the restaurant where the chef made a mistake with our orders. The waiter was extremely kind and apologized for the mistake and offer free desert or a free drink. No big deal really. We stayed with our 2 1/2 years old girl and she really enjoyed our holiday. Was great.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome place to stay - for business or pleasure - while in San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: JenMartin73
Reviews.Content: This was truly PARADISE! Although I was here for business, I will certainly return with my family for pleasure. Everything was beautifully maintained, the staff were very friendly and accomodating and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise close by”
Reviews.Author: Krikor D
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of early booking discount, truly a great deal and very easy. Got upgraded from junior suite to 1 bdrm suite, on the beach - wow!!! Just great!! I first had some hesitations from some of the reviews, but on e I arrived the location and service live up to it's name - paradise. Even the drive gradually transitions you from the city to laid back beach city to beach town and then Paradise point - removed from everything. They have pools, tennis courts and Mission Bay. Could have used e Tennis courts, but Mission Bay is a gem. paradise point has a front seat view. The service is truly first rate. We got there early, walked in on the cleaning crew and they bent backwards to get ysnin ASAP. The cleaning staff are great, especially when there are 5 kids and party every night. Rented the bike carts and took a ride around - recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: OilerRob
Reviews.Content: Awesome place. Would go back next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A unique location which is great for families”
Reviews.Author: Whatleytupper
Reviews.Content: -great island feel with lots of beach access and views of mission beach -lots of different pools for kids including an adult only one -good access to everything if you have a car; not so good without - rooms were clean and modern though the buildings are older so everything is not in perfect condition such as our weaker ac unit -good food at barefoot grill though a touch pricey -a very expensive foodstore and rental place so bring your own stuff -a good family vibe; safe and contained -careful with paying for upgrades as prices can get steep with little benefit; we liked the north cove because it's shielded from the wind though closer to a public, less secure beach

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RVoller
Reviews.Content: I brought my wife on this business trip because the conferece was at this resort and we had stayed here before. The resort is top notch, unique and a great get-away. Very family oriented. The small bungalow is ok but is humid when you arrive because the fan in the bathroom is not adequate to remove all of the moisture. Turn on the A/C and you'll be fine shortly. You really don't want to spend time in the room anyway because there are so many little cozy spots to sit and enjoy the scenery outside. The place is big and made for alot of people trying to relax. There is a very large main pool area near the other amenities that becomes the popular place to hangout, mingle or just sun and swim. Other pool areas are more intimate and include hot tub, fire pit (lit for you daily), pool, lots of towels provided, close to their private beach area. Have I said enough yet?

Reviews.Title: “Good conference”
Reviews.Author: Kevin G
Reviews.Content: Conferene stay in August 2011 was very good. Excellent food, unique facility and site, great staff, all needs taken careof quickly and without hassle. Many pools and hot tubs to use. Nice facility. Good beds. Get a room with a view though, some are small and no view.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off Point Resort on Tourist Trap Island.”
Reviews.Author: tomBCN
Reviews.Content: This resort would be great if it was a low budget all-inclusive holiday destination, but instead it was outrageously expensive. For exemple: more then 100$ for 2 persons breakfast, 500$ a night for an outdated 2 person bungalow with very poor ameneties, $22 for a smores kit + $15 for the wood to make them,...

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: marissacocores
Reviews.Content: Great kid friendly pool. There are two great restaurants there. We enjoyed the bayside bar (more casual). Lots of fun things for the family. We went there for our anniversary without the kids, but will definitely go there again with the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experiences”
Reviews.Author: s_ton003
Reviews.Content: Just checked out and have very mixed feelings about this place. 2 adults and 2 teens we had 2 rooms. Room with 2 doubled nicer and bigger than king bedroom. Clean resort in fact the gardeners are very enthusiastic with their power tools. This is a great place to stay to chill and relax several pools to choose. Good resort for younger kids, it's safe and quiet at night. Not the place to stay if you want to explore the city but getting to the city is about 20 mins in a cab or takes about an hour on a number 9 bus and then catch the trolley at Old town. The city of San Diego is fabulous cheap easy to get around and has great weather. Old Town is fascinating, little Italy has great food, Phils BBQ is outstanding, downtown, harbour, seaport all wonderful. The jewel in the crown is Coronado. Food at Paradise point is very good reasonably priced and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Outing”
Reviews.Author: Indy_Bing
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Paradise Point and had a wonderful experience. The staff was very attentive to our request during the stay. We had a few meals at Barefoot and the staff was very kind. The food was AMAZING (I had the cheeseburger and fries) we all enjoyed our selection. The grounds are very well kept and we loved how close it was to the cove. Our daugther did fall and cut her knee. The Security Officer was quick to respond to the injury and did a wonderful job making her feel better. We will definitely be back in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel scratched our vehicle and refuses to pay for repair”
Reviews.Author: a069024
Reviews.Content: We parked in our assigned parking place which was near the hotel laundry facility. A sliding chain link gate was opended to access the laundry facility and it scratched the front bumper of our vehicle. We reported the incident to security and they took pictures promising someone would get back to us the following week. After no response I contacted them and was asked whether we were planning another stay with them because sometimes these things can be resolved with a resort credit. I said no because we live out of state. They asked me to provide a written estimate whcih I did. After another couple of weeks I got a call from their insurance carrier to take my statement. After another couple of weeks i get a denial letter! Funny thing is that on the day we checked out the hotel had already installed a parking block in our space to prevent this from happening to a future guest. I guess since I live out of town and was not planning to stay with them again they denied my claim.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: Ncll01
Reviews.Content: Many "Kid-friendly" hotels feel like you are trapped inside Candyland; with cartoony characters, frenetic colors, and placating child-like activities/offerings. However, Paradise Point offers a family vacation experience; with activities and tastes for all ages! For example: > Dive-in movie night: The kids splish, splash and see a favorite showing, while most parents, lounge poolside over catch-ups & cocktails. > Bonfires on the Beach: S'more's by the sea allows for nightly quality "family time" to connect over silly stories or games, in an unplugged beach setting. > Bungalows-All very comfortable with modern decor, updated amenities, and a "front porch" sitting area, on/or near the bay. > Food-Most resorts dumb-down their menu's to offer kid-fare; however, the meal options at Paradise Point, are more mature to satisfy adults, but still hold the interest of children. They do offer some of the typical, cheeseburger/chicken nugget staples, but also include more healthful fish, fruit and pasta options. **And, the outdoor restaurant on the bay is surrounded by streams of Koi and other sea life; which allows adults time to enjoy their own meals with a relaxing, almost tropical water view, while the kids are captivated in their surroundings. My nephews complained when we had to leave lunch, because they were having so much fun watching crabs crawl in the rocks and the sea birds steal fries from nearby vacant tables. > Grounds-The resort is not a Four Season's/Ritz caliber, however, there has been thought put into making the grounds feel like a get-away location. There are exotic florals/landscapes, "wild" marine life (ducks/birds/fish, etc.) roaming the property, and a quiet, serene feel throughout. > Activities-There are numerous on-site options such as boat/jet ski/paddlebike rentals, games, 3 pools (including an adult-only option) and beach sports. As well, SEA WORLD is a mile away, which is a fun alternative-especially, with the summer promotion of 2-day passes, which allows a more leisurely experience of the park. **There are a series of lagoons/lakes connected through the resort which are stocked with ducks and fish; armed with a box of crackers and left-over breakfast toast, my nephews and I spent 2 hours hand-feeding the critters and taking pictures. The ducks even started following us through the resort and the boys were thrilled with their new-found friends! *****Note: feed the ducks open handed, or you might get a slight nip. I have stayed at several kiddy hotels and always leave with either a headache, toothache, or purse-ache from all of the saccharine, screaming & spending! And, while Paradise Point is NOT cheap, there are mid-week less expensive and/or package options available. (If you sign up for their e-mail list, they send discount offers.) However, for me, I prefer to ENJOY family vacations, so paying a bit more for a little sanity and satisfaction, is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, the ugly”
Reviews.Author: couponmommy
Reviews.Content: I will admit that my family and I had a lovely time. My 7-year old loved the ponds and lagoons filled with ducks and other exotic birds (buy feed in the market and you will be surrounded by them!). We mainly stayed at the larger pool, which had bar and grill service. The pool is nothing fancy, but not very deep, so we did not have to worry as much. I wish that there were slides or a water feature--something to make the pool stand out. The room was fine--again, nothing fancy, but pretty large for a standard garden room (make sure that yours is NOT overlooking the parking lot). We enjoyed the chairs on our patio overlooking one of the lagoons--we brought a couple of bottle of wine and were able to chill it in the in-room fridge. There are NO luxuries (some would say, no basics even)...no robe, not water bottles, no turn-down service, no hair dryer, only 2 glasses and 4 paper cups for coffee. In fact, we returned to our room at 5pm one day and it STILL had not had maid service--we called and it was close to 6pm when she came. Not happy about that. But, on the whole, the room was clean and pleasant. They still have the ancient in-wall A/C which needs updating. There was also bits of trash around the entrance of our room--it is these small details which completely keeps the place from truly being a resort. BUT, the Barefoot and Baleen Restaurants are excellent--really good food, nice ambiance, generous portions. Room service was fast and delicious. My child cried when it was time to leave because we did not have enough time to do all that there is to do (we missed the movie at night over the pool, the bike rides, fire pits on the beach). SO, in some ways it was fantastic, some ways, completely disappointing. Truly, as long as the kid is happy, the bed is decent and Mom can get a good cocktail, I count our vacation as a success.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Digimom
Reviews.Content: Very private but centrally located. The rooms have a beach town feel and the bathrooms are a litle date but very clean. The home run is the setting and the privacy. It's a hideaway with very nice amenities

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: Tracey R
Reviews.Content: Out of the 9 hotels we stayed in during our holiday to California, this was by far the most disappointing. First impressions were not great. Our "garden" bungalow, overlooked a car park albeit an expensive one as we were all paying $28 a night on top of the room rate. It is not a bungalow, but a similar room to every other hotel we stayed in. It has no microwave, four paper cups, a coffee machine, a fridge so small you can barely get milk in it and two glasses - not exactly luxury. You pay $15 for "extras", which includes calls and some activities but not pitch and put golf, which most kids want to do, which is an extra $8 per child - more for adults. The pool is adequate but stark and concrete looking and the beach was awash with litter, discarded towels and debris. It has the look and feel of a 1980's resort which is living on its history rather than its current state. The fires around the complex are fine but subject to quarrels as families try and stake their pitch early. I am not sure how it gets five stars from any review and makes me wonder how valid they are. All in all, save your money, find somewhere cheaper but with mor integrity.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoy being there !”
Reviews.Author: Elya87
Reviews.Content: . It was so good in hotel ,(hotel has many interesting things ) that we did not go out from hotel !

Reviews.Title: “i love this place but its bit unkept.”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: My family totally loved this place. We loved the villa style room intead of having to go through the front lobby everytime you in and out of places. We brought our own bikes and enjoyed the bay area. We tried different pools. The staff was bit unfriendly and the place at times felt a little messy on the grounds. But the firepit at the pools and bayside was awesome. My family would definitely come back and stay....

Reviews.Title: “We fell in a Love with Paradise Point and I look forward to go back for next August .”
Reviews.Author: Sevki15
Reviews.Content: This is the best island Resort in San Diago, La Jolla . We just fell in a Love with Paradise Point resort and especially our private unit plus services. It is a cute and unique place . I would not want to say anything wrong with Paradise Point and stay in this place with out saying Noo. It gives you privacy , calm environment and no toxicity . We still talk about Paradise Point and definitely will go back . Thanks loads to GINO KESER who works at the reception as a Reception Manager. He was very professional and welcoming us every second with his help also guide. Many Thanks and look forward to go back next year to the Paradise Point. Sevki

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Get the bayfront room in the cove to avoid wind and to enjoy the beach.”
Reviews.Author: Don C
Reviews.Content: Remember that May and June means morning and possible all day fog. Late summer, Fall and Winter are best weather months.

Reviews.Title: “Truly is a tropical paradise--beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: RoxanneRustand
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Excellent food--loved the blueberry bread pudding and crab cakes at the Barefoot Grill! Excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Goeres
Reviews.Content: We reserved a junior suite bay side ( no other room available). We have rarely seen such a small j suite. Except for the flatscreen their has been no major refurbishing since it's building (must be beginning 70's) But must of all without any excuse is the cleanliness, hair an old overseen towles in the bathroom, sticky floors and hardly cleaned windows and so on. Just not worth the money, a San Dego Motel will do better for a sixth of the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Reunion”
Reviews.Author: mommatimbo8
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending a week at Paradise Point Resort & Spa with family and absolutely hated to leave there! Some of my family joined me in "Paradise" and we all had the best time ever! Every employee seems to be ready and willing to help their guests have the best vacation you ever had. The employees are so friendly from the wonderful bellman, Ben, to the bartender at the pool, Bryce, to the great people at the dock where you can rent boats, boards....whatever you like. Matt Quick, the Rooms Manager and Priscilla Garcia, the Front Office Manager, helped make our stay perfect by clustering our family in rooms all together. I stayed in one of their wonderful rooms on the bay and my family was right behind me! We all had the best time and now want to do this every summer. Even my nephew and his wife and their daughter and son-in-law came over from Arizona and stayed at Paradise Point and loved it. Paradise Point is perfect for the old to the very young. Beautiful surroundings, many pools and spas to choose from. We started coming to Paradise Point in the late 1970's when my children were little and just wouldn't stay anywhere else. Now my grandchildren are coming and having the best time ever. If you want to have a wonderful vacation and be treated royally, come visit Paradise Point. Great place for a family reunion! I even got on a jet ski and absolutely loved it! Visit Paradise Point the next time you're looking for a vacation spot! You won't be sorry. I highly recommend Paradise Point Resort & Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: AZSMF
Reviews.Content: I recommend the rooms on the beach, a bit dated but nice! Walk out of the room onto your porch with lush foliage and old trees surrounding you. Pour a glass of wine and enjoy the view across the beach to the water. Excellent for a relaxing weekend. Dine at Baleen where we found the cuisine to be just what the Dr. ordered. The barefoot bar and grill was also nice and right on the beach, cool

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: waggers999
Reviews.Content: The weather wasn't great for us but we had a wonderful stay. The pools were lovely and the food at barefoot was delicious although expensive. Good location but you need a car; highly recommend green flash to eat up the road at pacific beach. Would highly recommend pacific point, lovely!

Reviews.Title: “No better than a youth hostel with beach access”
Reviews.Author: SwissEmgem
Reviews.Content: Believe the terrible reviews and be sceptical with the good ones. My experience is near on identical with many of the previously posted bad reviews. The grounds are indeed quite impressive - from a distance. They have this distinct "Fantasy Island" feeling about them. However, upon closer look at for instance the lake area, you will see tainted blue ducks swimming along, because the have some horrible fluorescent junk in the water. There was electrical equipment lying arund everywhere. A hazard for small children - and my inquisitive son. But the rooms - they have been refurbished? That's the biggest joke. They are sooo small and the bathrooms are absolutely disgusting. Decor could have been quite pleasing, but most of the furniture was broken. The worst thing about this resort - I will have to repeat - is the cleaning! It started upon arrival: beer and coke cans directly next to the patio. Dust and undefined dirt under the bed. This however carried on and I had to complain twice about the cleaning. Reception did not seem in the least interested and it hardly got better. We had no hand soap in the bathroom, I had to wipe out the drawers before putting some clothes in. Mostly we ate breakfast outside the property, but before going to seaworld we tried out the breakfast at the resort. Good that was horrible and exceedingly expensive. But finally there is the safety issue. We hired one of their bikes to go around the property with our son. We realized that our bungalow was probably even in one of the better locations. Some bungalows border directly onto a public park with large car park and are literally situated next to the public toilets. No walls, bushes, fences or even guards to protect the property from trespassers or whatever. The bike ride for me was horrifying, knowing that anyone could reach our bungalow by beach access. This was particularly disturbing because at night we had to sleep with the patio door open, as there were no other windows. After that I could hardly sleep at night.... All this is only a fraction of why this property should not be so expensive and in my opinion should be shut down. Let nature claim it back or extend seaworld!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place lots of lovely scenery”
Reviews.Author: rayrockytwo
Reviews.Content: we are from england and we like to walk took 40 mins to mission bay/boulevard didnt want to hire a car but you prob need one for groceries although there is no kitchenette and the shop hardly stocks anything.. we had a bay view room after asking nicely at reception and paying a very nominal subsidy it was shear pleasure opening doors in the morning and seeing the bay and the birds/ducks and the smell of the sea. we believe a holiday is what you make it and we cetainly chilled, walked and even hired bikes , 15 mins to belmont park/ mission beach . the barefoot bar/grill is certainly good value for breakfast/ dinner and the adult pool was truly great no kids !! you can get taxis freely available and they will do a deal to downtown/ gaslamp area all the staff from the bellboys to the housekeepers were friendly and knew their work . overall i think the people who complain are serial complainers and look for faults in everything thank you paradise point it certainly was ....

Reviews.Title: “IÂ´d definitely stay in this hotel again, very pleasant gardens and atmosphere, comfy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Dulce1965
Reviews.Content: IÂ´d definitely stay in this hotel again, very pleasant gardens and atmosphere, comfy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “So little time for this amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: with5
Reviews.Content: We booked this amazing resort through Priceline for a one night stay in San Diego. The only downside we experienced was not being able to spend much time at Paradise Point. Check in was fast and the employees were extremely nice. We were not expecting much from our room based on other reviews of Priceline customers. We were blown away when we finally found our room. It was very clean and plenty big enough for the 4 of us. Not to mention we were just steps away from the beach and a fire pit! Unfortunately we had just enought time to unload our stuff from the car and head to the trolley station to catch a Giant's game. The game ended up going 14 innings, so we didn't return to the hotel until 12:30am. It was wonderful to be able to grab our chairs and a drink and walk a few steps to the beach to relax before bed. My husband and our girls had a little over an hour in the morning to explore the resort and loved everything they saw. Would love to go back and enjoy the bar, bike rentals, mini golf, beach, etc. at some point. We highly recommend Paradise Point for an amazing stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia H
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we knew we had selected the right resort to visit in San Diego. Our Bayside room was clean and situated between the tennis courts and the bay. The menu at Balleens was five star and prepared and served in an outstanding manner both nights. We had fun listening to the entertainment provided from all the wedding celebrations and got a kick from hearing the peals of laughter around the bonfire pits at night. It was really nice to see and hear the guests at this resort enjoying their time together with all the cool amenities provided to us. Our daughter and her family live in San Diego and visited us at the larger pool on Saturday. Perfect pool temperature for the baby. We ended up renting a 20' boat on Sunday and cruised the bay and finally got our tans. Thanks for a memorable weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place, and will return many many more times.”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: You do get what you pay for, and yes this place can get expensive during peak times. However, this place truly showed its worth to us. We came here for the first time in May for our daughters 2nd birthday. We wanted a beach vacation and I found this place while searching hotels near Sea World. I instantly thought how it reminded me of our trip to Hawaii, and how perfect this place would be, being right on the bay and with a room feet away from the sand. It did not disappoint for a second. The pools were great, the bike rentals on sight, the restaurants, quick room service, other activities, ducks and fish all around the property, but most importantly the fire pit on the beach 10 feet from our door and water another 10 feet, this place provided such a wonderful time for us and our 2 year old, that it quickly became one of the best places we have ever visited, and we travel extensively. As a side note: we wanted to come back to San Diego the next month for a quick getaway, and this place was a little too pricey being that it was June. I found the Hilton, across the street almost, and thought it was similar in features. We had such a terrible experience there that we checked out the next morning and I called Paradise Point. We were upgraded all the way to the Presidential Suite, and they saved our vacation which had so been nearly ruined by the Hilton. I can not say enough about this place, and with all that they have done for us, and how we were treated both times, this is my FAVORITE place to stay in San Diego, and should not be missed. We are going back in September. My only mistake in June was not going with Paradise Point to begin with. Don't second guess this place. Find a good rate, go with AAA or Destination Delivers, or call them, but choose this place for a real great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: rita11
Reviews.Content: First, the grounds were beautiful!!! We picked this spot because of the presentation on the internet. We thought we were getting a quiet resort spa sort of place, but it was not. It was very busy, lots of commotion and we had several rowdy families in the rooms behind us!! Several things in our room needed attention: the tub didn't drain, the air conditioner was not working, the patio table was broke, the sink was cracked , the hair dryer wouldn't work and the last morning the toilet wouldn't flush. When we called for service everything was taken care of right away, however, we felt that for the price we shouldn't have had to deal with all those issues. The resort was isolated and because we did not have a car it was an issue to get anywhere. Thus, we were inclined to eat there more and buy items from the gift shop, which was pricey. The floor in our room was very dirty, as someone else has stated. The first night I walked around the room in my socks and the bottoms were black after 2 hours of walking on the room floor. It was quite a walk to get anywhere on the resort, so if you have trouble walking this would not be the place for you. Overall, it was a very pretty place and generally the staff was exceptional. The food was good and the beach was quiet and clean. Downside - pricey, isolated and not quiet. Shuttles would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: beachmum99
Reviews.Content: The person that described this as "an 80 year old former super model with a facelift" is accurate. The lush grounds are beautiful, reminded me of Hawaii. The view from our room was incredible. We had a bayview junior suite and had a huge wall of windows. This is a big difference from the standard bayview room. The room updates were nice, but could have been better. New floors were put in as well as sink, but rather than replacing old trim work, it was just painted. Air conditioning needs major update. It is a wall/window type unit and next to the pull out sofa where the kids slept. We had to build a "pillow wall" to divert the cool airflow around the sleeping kids or die in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but wouldn't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Jenks99
Reviews.Content: Remote & because of that they charge exorbitant prices for everything. Cleaning is haphazard to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, but they nickel and dime you!”
Reviews.Author: Eastcoast2
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and nice. Resort is beautiful being right on Mission Bay with many water features and much space to walk or ride bikes. Very relaxing atmosphere. Resort rooms had been remodeled but done in a "quick" remodel way with many older features still showing. I am really picky and still found it nice and comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful. Upon check in we were informed of a 25 dollar a night fee for parking which is ridiculous seeing each unit has its own space (it's not like there was a parking garage or lack of space for parking) but we were told this was because there were no resort fees. However, they charged 10 dollars per person per day to use their gym, they charged to rent bikes and to play golf on their miniature course. With no resort fees, we thought these activities would be free to guests. One heated pool (there are more on property but not heated or as large) fills up quickly each day. The resort is located in a convenient location, out of the city but only 10 minutes away and was easy to get to any of the local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love!”
Reviews.Author: karenb9236
Reviews.Content: The resort was great, but the SPA was outstanding... great space, great massages, fabulous all the way around. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Amy2366
Reviews.Content: Great resort....the staff was super friendly and helpful. Room was beautiful...very family friendly. We have 2 kids (ages 3 and 4)...they loved it and had a great time. Barefoot Grill was very good and reasonable priced.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: well_traveledNyc
Reviews.Content: It's old and dated. The floors in our room were filthy. The food was expensive and skimpy on the ingredients (Cobb salad was nothing but lettuce for example). This place is waaaaay over priced. We did have one nice guy working there who was very polite. The view from the business facility was nice too. Would we go back? Not a chance.

Reviews.Title: “We are already planning our next stay”
Reviews.Author: llevybuch
Reviews.Content: My three best girlfriends and I came to Paradise Point last weekend to celebrate one of our birthdays. None of us had been to the property before and we were all very impressed by the beauty of the property and how it truly takes you away into a feeling of being surrounded in paradise. We had a wonderful room and found all of the staff to be helpful and accommodating. The second day we went to The Spa and each treated ourselves to a 50-minute spa treatment - and that was the highlight for all of us. From the minute we walked into the spa and were greeted by the warm and welcoming staff, to the time I literally feel asleep in the peaceful relaxation room before my treatment, to my appointment with Annette for a skin wrap, it was a truly lovely experience. Each of us tried a different spa treatment and had different therapists, and each of us came out with the same satisfied feeling of having been given a gift. We will absolutely come back, and in fact, we started planning our next visit (this time with our kids) before we left that afternoon. We are going back in a few weeks from now.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is the absolute best!!”
Reviews.Author: caroline4444
Reviews.Content: My family and I always look forward to our stays at Paradise Point Resort and Spa. We have held our family reunions at the resort for the past four years, at times my family and I have stayed twice a year. We love to stay at Paradise Point because it offers us Paradise. The tropical plants around the resort are gorgeous. Paradise Point offers so much that there is no need to travel elsewhere; such as biking, sailing, jet skiing, motor boating and our absolute favorite kayaking. The resort has five pools, our favorite pool is the main pool beause it offers movie night, what matter than swiiming under the stars while watching a family friendly movie. My family and I also love the breathtaking ocean views, the whole resort is surrounded by the beach. At night we all go down to the fire pitts and make smores, and just have fun. The staff is friendly, kind and helpful. Paradise Point really offers the guest PARADISE!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect, the good, and the bad”
Reviews.Author: birdand2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Paradise Point on our honeymoon. For the most part it was fantastic! I'll start with the Perfect. First and formost the grounds, pools, daily maid service, and the friendly employees were perfect! They waived the 25/per day parking fee for us! These things were more than we expected!
