We ended up walking around the transit station for a while until we found a transit official who offered us a map and further information. This does not reflect poorly on the resort, but made us wish Paradise Point offered a shuttle service. We enjoyed Paradise Point very much, and would definitely stay there again in the future if we ever visit San Diego again!

Reviews.Title: “we loved every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: rosie237
Reviews.Content: the grounds were beautiful, the staff very friendly and helpful, the food at the barefoot was great, the bay side views were fantastic, the water taxi to sea world was so handy, the gift store was good, and the leisurely walks and places to sit were very refreshing. all in all a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty...Terrible Customer Service...Still Waiting on Deposit....”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTrav111
Reviews.Content: To begin with we paid in advance on Priceline and arrived late. We gave the "resort" our bank card for incidentals and they charged us $100 for a deposit because we did not use a credit card. It was late, my husband was tired and he just handed them the card we used to pay for the room. BIG MISTAKE. Parking fees are a joke. We rented one movie. I am still waiting on the rest of the $50 plus dollar deposit that was left. I have called and called and called. I have left messages and sent an email and we still do not have our money back and it was over 3 weeks ago! They keep returning my call with an over the top sweet message to please call them back almost as if they are mocking me. Why do I need to call them them back. They KNOW what I want AND EVERYTIME you call them you get the machine. The sheets were disgusting. I changed them MYSELF and the room floor was so gross I had to wear my shoes. Do not get me started on the gross stuff on the bathroom wall. DO NOT STAY HERE! At one time I am sure that it was a very nice place, but not now.

Reviews.Title: “Like Maui in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: joncrx
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our time at Paradise Point. Ample room to wander in beautiful surroundings, great views and delicious smores. My wife and I actually had a problem with our shower not being that hot on our first day. Matt Quick, the rooms manager, was prompt, and more than helpful to resolve it with a beautiful room that had the working hot water, and one incredible view. We'll definitely go back and will be looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: momof4invegas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Diego for a four-day anniversary weekend. Having never been to the area, we chose Paradise Point because it looked cozy and seemed like a safe bet for a nice room and facilities. Plus, we were traveling over Memorial Day weekend, and I'd heard the beach areas got very busy. The private beaches and marina seemed promising. Our room was a regular garden view with king bed. It was nice enough, but nothing extraordinary. There was a coffee pot, a safe and a small, dorm-sized fridge, which we didn't discover until our last day because it was designed to look like a door on the desk. Had we actually used the fridge, it would have been nice to have a microwave available, but there was not one. The best part of our stay, hands down, was the room service. We ordered breakfast every morning, and I was skeptical about the prices being a good value...but they were. Everything we order was delicious, they were quickly delivered, and the portions were huge. Two of the days, we didn't even eat again until dinner because we were so full. The main pool was heated, but not the smaller pools in each grouping of rooms. The weather was uncooperative that weekend, so the unheated pools were out of the question. There was plenty of room in the main pool, but we didn't swim because it was where everyone had headed and we were looking for something more private without children splashing about (ours were staying with grandma). We visited the onsite store (The Island Market) several times. It was well stocked with snacks, souvenirs, and trinkets. They were priced as you would expect at a resort. The Barefoot Bar and Grill was a nice place to hang out if you are staying on the resort, but in retrospect, I'm sorry we wasted a meal there when there are so many choices in town. We walked past the marina, but it seemed to be mostly small boats and a couple of jet skis. We were more interesting in snorkeling and parasailing, so we ended up going to the public beaches anyway. About the only thing we did on the resort was renting bikes one day (I think they were about $20/per hour for each bike). The resort website is deceptive in this area because they provide a very detailed map of Mission Bay bike paths, but when you fill out the rental contract, there is a section which states you can't take the bikes off their property. It was okay, but you can only do so many laps around the parking lots. I would have enjoyed it much more if we'd been able to go cruise along the beaches just across the street. If I could do this over, I would walk over to the beach and look for a bike rental off-property or bring our own. In hindsight, I probably wouldn't stay here again. Our total bill for 2 people for 3 nights was just over $1,000. That included our three breakfasts, 2 in-room movies, $25 parking per day, and a resort fee (maybe $15 per day?). Considering that there were so many fun things to do in the San Diego area, we didn't spend $1,000 worth of time here. What little we did do (eating and bikes) was extra anyway. Next time we come to San Diego, I will have a better idea of the "nice" areas and the areas I wish to avoid and will just book a regular hotel with a year-round indoor pool! The "resort & spa experience" really doesn't justify the premium price of this location over any nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average and not much more....”
Reviews.Author: livethedream_8
Reviews.Content: The grounds are lovely, the rooms are okay, the service is good and the location is ideal - but overall it is an average place - not a WOW..... little things make the difference and this place just doesn't deliver that yet the price point thinks it should... As for the resort fee of $15/day - I don't understand this at all - bury the cost in the room fee - it is like charging me for a daily housekeeping fee or perhaps a daily pool cleaning fee - I am booked into a resort - why do I have this separate fee 'added' to my bill? Restaurants were all great - service, food, locations. Would like an earlier open for the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: ArtandNancy
Reviews.Content: The resort was full of beautiful gardens and waterways. You can easily walk around the property to the various pools, gardens and along the bay watching the sailboats and such. Although we did experience a couple of issues when we first arrived the Supervisor of the Front Desk, Priscilla Garcia, attended to our concerns and moved us to a more peaceful area in the resort. We do understand that some disruptions can not be avoided but she was not only willing but able to make our stay more comfortable. We were also able to go to the Bare Foot Bar on the property for an evening of socialization and breakfast also. The staff was excellent and the food was very good, they do not skimp on the portions. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this resort and would definetly stay here again. You can spend your whole vacation there and never leave the property although they are very close to places like Sea World, the San Diego Zoo and many Museums.

Reviews.Title: “The Prettiest Rip-Off in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: i983Jen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paradise Point for the long Memorial Day weekend. After 6 hours on airplanes, we arrived at the hotel just ahead of the 4pm check-in time. The front desk told us their computer systems were down, and they were unable to accommodate us. They did not offer to hold our luggage or invite us to relax by the pool; it was "Sorry, come back later!" When we returned after 4pm, there were lines of frustrated guests in the lobby waiting to check in - plenty of people were as unimpressed as we were. Previous reviews are correct about the outrageous parking fee - it is $25 per night. This would be reasonable if Paradise Point was within walking distance to anything in San Diego and we could leave the car behind, but it's not. The hotel is set back quite a distance from downtown or the beaches. The fee was a surprise to us. We had booked the hotel through Orbitz and thought we were paid in full, so we weren't happy. There is also abundant parking - every room has an assigned spot, there's a large general parking area, and a large parking lot for the banquet hall. Parking's not at a premium so it just felt like a big rip-off. Speaking of ridiculous fees, this hotel charges for EVERYTHING. Internet has a fee. LOCAL telephone calls are $1 for the first 30 minutes, and $0.10/minute after that. Fitness center is $12/day (but it's free if you spend $75 in the spa!). It even costs money to play basketball. We joked that we wouldn't turn on the TV because they probably charged for basic cable. To add insult to injury, the room is stingy with extras. We had no soap in the bathroom, no lotion, no water bottles, and no robes. Housekeeping didn't show up until 5:30pm on our last full day (and didn't collect our neighbors' dirty room service dishes for 2 full days. Gross.) The most deceptive fee of all is the daily resort fee of $15 per day. Upon check in, you receive a "passport" that says for $15/day, guests receive internet, free use of the fitness center, free outdoor games, free local phone calls, and a few extras. It's worded to make you believe that you need to ASK for this bundle, so my husband and I purposely avoided all of those things to avoid the fee. We had already paid for the room once and were annoyed by the secret parking fee, so imagine our surprise when our check-out statement had the $15/day fee, for an extra $90. When my husband went to the front desk to complain, the girl admitted that lots of guests were surprised by the extra $40/day (parking + resort fee), but there was nothing she could do. In all fairness, the hotel is very pretty and well-manicured. The pools and spas are nice, Barefoot Bar & Grill is a decent place to eat, and the beds were very comfortable. But we just couldn't get past the feeling of being nickel-and-dimed to death. Basically, a very pretty, very overpriced, and borderline deceptive resort. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service and Outrageous Fees”
Reviews.Author: beta1839
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay at this resort but are quite turned off by their poor customer service and all of the fees that we are forced to pay. After leaving our room at 9am yesterday and returning after 6pm it was still not serviced by the housekeeping staff. Called to get fresh towels and not even an apology was offered. Returned to room again today and the beds were made but trash cans still full. Once again, no apology from maid service or front desk. The fees here are also outrageous. $25 per day just to park your car here. That is $10 to $15 high. The mandatory $15 resort fee is a little high but atleast you get something out of it. The parking is just a way to stick it to you. Will have to see if things get better but it is looking like we will switch back to Dana Point and not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and Shoddy”
Reviews.Author: blueagave04
Reviews.Content: A spring getaway to forget,1st room was filthy,we also experienced a breech in the security of our room. 2nd room at a 100.00 more per night was better, but for the overall price, I have stayed at much-much better. The entrance to the resort is lovely and it is obvious that the money is in the landscaping and nothing more. Dining options at the time were limited, and should not be considered gourmet. This resort capitalizes on its proximity to Sea-World, but at the prices would be difficult in todays economy for a family of four, to stay at. Pools are crowded, noisy,rental of onsite amenities is very high. Beach areas unattractive and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Sharpgeorge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met at this hotel 33 years ago. I was the Security Director and she was a server at the Barefoot Bar. We have been married 32 years. This is the first time we stayed there as guests. The landscaping is amazing. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The restaurants are top shelf. Once you drive in and park your car its like you are on an island. There is no need to leave the hotel. Everything you could want is there.

Reviews.Title: “5 year old surprise birthday party”
Reviews.Author: Kidang
Reviews.Content: I decided to take our family to Paradise Point to celebrate my daughter's birthday. We had a bayside premier room that was breathtaking. Fireplace, flat screen TV, jacuzzi bathtub, among other amenities. We invited a few families to share the day with and they were so impressed with the grounds and location and the room. We definitely would come back again. My son and I got to feed the ducks and fish which was quite an experience. One of the ducks was so friendly, it ate from his hand. We played a round of golf on the putting green. We only live 5 minutes away, but it felt like we were on vacation on a tropical island. Loved it and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely tropical escape”
Reviews.Author: 1WineLover54
Reviews.Content: Coming up the drive to the "lobby area" of the hotel is impressive. Very lush and tropical. The hotel is secluded, the closest area is Sea World., which makes it nice for families. One of the first things you notice, besides all the flowers and trees is the people riding "surries" or bikes thru the property. Then you see people playing miniature golf on a small course that is along the side of the entrance road. No windmills or water hazards, just little putting greens connected like links of a regular golf course. Next to the lobby is a lovely large lagoon with waterlilys and plenty of fish and water fowl. The lobby is a little dated, but according to the front desk staff, will be renovated sometime soon. Next to the lobby is a market and gift shop that has lots of cool things to tempt you. The bike/Surrey rental area is right next door. The fine dining restaurant, Baleen is a short walk from the lobby and the prices are not too bad. The most expensive is the Steak and Lobster at over $50.00. Not too far from their is the waterside restaurant that is open all day. Not a huge selection but the 4 cheese grilled cheese with Tomato Basil soup combo is excellent. Be aware of the heron's, they like to snatch food off your plates. Didn't see this first hand, but was advise to watch out for this one sneaky bird who liked to surprise you and make off with part of your meal. The rooms are 1950's bungalows that have been updated inside. Very Hawaiian themed with cheery bright yellow walls. There are refrigerators in the rooms, which makes it nice to keep your leftovers or a bottle of wine. The coffee makers are the type that use the coffee pods and make either one or two cups at a time. The beds were incredibly comfortable. Housekeeping comes by later in the afternoon,evening offering robes to be used during your stay. The sink area is very small. Barely big enough for one person to put their items on, much less two. The lighting is terrible, until you realize that the hotel is using the CFL lightblubs that take a while to warm up and brighten up. They don't offer little bottles of shampoo, conditioner and body wash. They have gone green and installed bottles of aforementioned items in the shower area. Body lotion is not offered. Most if not all rooms have a patio of sorts. It is either in the front of the room, or our the back door. Ours was out the back door and over looked a pond with a fountain and was right next to one of the many pools on the property. Two Adirondake chairs and a small table were on the small patio. No fencing between the patios but it felt secluded anyway. Nice little area to sit, drink a glass of wine and read a book or visit with a loved one or friend. Each room is assigned their own parking space number that matches their room number. The meeting rooms were very nice and plentiful. Many options for a business meeting, a wedding or a prom. (all of which were going on during our stay). While the resort is spreadout, you can easily walk from anywhere on the property to the meeting rooms, and if you have driven to the hotel, you could always drive from your room to the meeting area. Very pretty place, very nice people and I will be back very soon! P.S. this property used to be the Vacation Village in its former life.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: janbok
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in 6 months and having read many of the reviews I can associate with a number of issues raised but must point out that under the new management, all of these issues are being addressed. The grounds are beautiful and tended carefully by helpful and friendly staff. The resort has a wonderful relaxed feel and was the perfect setting for a wedding. The wedding banquet was superb, many guests said the best food ever at a wedding, the service, table settings etc were excellent and the whole day went perfectly - nothing was too much trouble. The main pool was busy but there are a number of other pools that are more tranquil for those who prefer that environment. My bayside bungalow was well furnished and clean on arrival and I was very pleased with the maid service throughout my stay. I slept soundly in a very comfortable bed with little outside noise which is remarkable for the size of the resort. The Baleen restaurant has excellent food and great service. The Barefoot Bar and Grill is less formal and offers good value for money. Service is erratic but improving. Room service was excellent and the hot food arrived hot and always within the estimated time.The poolside food and bar and service was superb with all food being cooked to order in front of you. Also the coffee bar in reception served great coffee and fresh pastries with plenty of comfortable seating both inside and out. Staff are friendly and helpful throughout the resort. With regard to location PP is wonderful. A few minutes walk from SeaWorld and minutes away from local restaurants and other amenities. It is only a short drive from the city yet offers the relaxed feeling that a resort hotel should have. The Spa is wonderful, an oasis of tranquillity. Friendly, helpful staff and excellent therapists. It offers a comprehensive range of treatments and superbly appointed rooms. I was introduced to the Shellac manicure/pedicure and my toes look as good today as the day they were done - 22nd April 2011 - that's nearly five weeks! Fingers lasted three weeks easily even with a long journey home. I would return purely for a Spa break but I am sure that I will return on a regular basis. Any problems speak to the duty manager, the management are keen to ensure that your stay is memorable for the right reasons. I would like to see the Baleen open later in the evening and seven days a week in season and for food and drink to be available on the resort until at least midnight, in Europe we tend to eat later and find many restaurants in SD close too early!

Reviews.Title: “We will definately be back!”
Reviews.Content: This was a great vacation place for a family. We stayed in a bungalow on the bay. The water was calm and perfect for small children. We brought our own toys - kayak and paddle boards. The pool was warm and perfect for our small kids. Outdoor beach showers would be a great addition! Also brooms in the condos would be great although they do offer maid service, it would be nice with kids to stay on top of the sand! The Barefoot Restaurant was great - great service and food. Marc the shuttle driver was the most personable guy we have come by traveling! We used the fire pit for smoores every night and met great people during our stay! We rented bikes, played minigolf.....We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “i love it!!”
Reviews.Author: Boomer1971
Reviews.Content: my honey and i spent 4 awesome days at the resort. didnt want to leave. so much to do. love the lush tropical landscape, quiet too. my favorite the fire-pits on the beach. great food at barefoot bar. ate there many times. the rooms were clean and inviting. we stayed at lanai garden so pretty. thank u. we will be back. great birthday present to me. got to see grandkids too. family friendly pool. and close to mission bay. liked that. :)

Reviews.Title: “Radical San Diego Resort”
Reviews.Author: TahoeRick
Reviews.Content: I made the trip down to San Diego from Lake Tahoe, Ca and was not dissapointed with my stay at Paradise Point. My girlfreind and I, along with her friend/roommate, stayed there for my birthday and couldn't have been more pleased. We had a casita on the beach with our own private patio and lawn connecting to the sand. The room was perfect and very clean with well sized flat screen TV's in both the living room and bedroom. The bathroom well excellent and came complete with the two seperate sink/vanity areas. However, the main point of note was the customer service. The desk had beer delivered from their store directly to our patio area so we could conitnue enjoying ourselves, they fixed the sink we broke within minutes of calling down to the desk, and one of their staff even took our inner tubes to a compresser for us to fill them up with air without us even asking. All in all this was a great to spend a few days and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a great time in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: K56
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point has the best location in San Diego for relaxing on the water. The grounds are very tropical and you can enjoy the beach, multiple pools, sailing, kayaking, a fabulous spa, and more without ever leaving the property. We have stayed lots of places in San Diego and this is by far our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family resort or a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: kaciep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon night here 5 years ago and have been back a handful of times...now with our children. We are never disappointed. The resort is warm, inviting and casually elegant, the staff is gracious and helpful and the food is excellent. I can not think of a nicer place to stay when you are in San Diego. Also, the location is a short walk or 5 minute drive to Sea World and not far from the San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing environment”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarieGottlieb
Reviews.Content: When my family decided that we could get away for a few days, but didn't have time to fly anywhere for a lengthy stay, we knew that the only place in the area where we could go and really feel that we were truly away from it all, was Paradise Point. We have stayed there several times in the past, and we have always felt as if we are a world away from our hectic lives. This time was no different. Matthew, the rooms manager, was very helpful in recommending the perfect accomodations to meet our needs. He hit the nail on the head (Thanks Mathew!) Our bungalow was right on the beach, our kids could play on the beach and we could see them from our room, we were close to the pool and store, and best of all the bungalow had been newly remodeled - it was just gorgeous! As always we had a very relaxing stay at Paradise Point and would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to get away from it all!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: 4Traveling4
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our two night stay at a Lanai Garden room in Paradise Point. The highpoint of our stay was the sailboat trip we made on the bay; absolutely awesome! Boats were in good shape and service was very friendly. The Barefoot restaurant makes very good burgers (my husband had the same one two nights in a row) and is an adventure on its own with the creepy looking birds preying on your food and the leopard sharks and bat rays swimming right behind you. Obviously, very good times with an 8 and a 6 year old! A thing that we really appreciate; the hotel is trying to go "greener" than the average hotel, which makes you feel good about your choice of luxury. Our room was clean and was a joy to come back to after the maid had been in. We'd go again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly not a luxurious resort”
Reviews.Author: Swisstraveller37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paradies Point Resort for 5 nights in April 2011. To be honest, this is a motel like accomodation which has a nice seeting on an island in the Bay, but nothing outstanding. It is not worth the price you need to pay. The room itself (we had a Bayside Room) is not bad, but very small and the bathroom is really dated. The premises are dated as well and the restaurant is not worth mentioning at all. The pool area looked nice and the property is quite big, so if you enjoy staying out all the time maybe this is a good place, but again, not for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a family vacation, very child-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dg6yhw11
Reviews.Content: We had 2 adjoining suites right on the beach. The rooms were large, the bathrooms nice with 2 separate vanities and closets. Furniture was first-rate. Free internet and iPhone-friendly alarm clock, and OK TV on large screens - signal quality varied by channel. Each suite had a tiny kitchenette and a large dining-room table that easily held 4 adults and a toddler's high chair. The master bed was extremely comfortable and the overall impression was almost bucolic. Ducks wandered in the grass, there were fire-pits and the sand. Even the Heat and A/C was not the usual railroad-train quality, but were quiet and even had a fresh-air option. The rooms were very quiet. So quiet that we didn't even know that a prom party with over 80 people was just next door until a HS Senior asked if they had kept us awake! The staff was very friendly and helpful, all the staff, not just the front-desk and wait staff. Even the landscapers and cleaning staff smiled and said hello. We used room service for breakfast a few times. They were friendly and fast, the food was good and delivered hot. Did I mention that it is within walking distance of Sea-World? My son walked it with ease. I downgraded the resort for its restaurants of which we tried two, a casual one with a beachy theme, and a white tablecloth starched-napkin variety. Both feature extremely-high prices. The casual restaurant is in serious need of updating. The bench seats on the booths are padded with worn-out paper thin cushions that might as well not be there. The menu was dull as was the actual food. The drinks were watery. Apparently room service comes from the same kitchen - it is 10 times better. Also, there's a live band on Saturday night. The other restaurant is very much a mixed bag and almost seems to depend on the waiter. We ate there twice. The first time were were served by Brent and the experience was worth every cent of the $100 each we spent. Drinks were strong and well prepared, the appetizers arrived quickly and were delicious. Same goes for the main and dessert courses. Our second experience there was the dinner from hell. The drinks and appetizers went fine. Then we were forgotten. Really. After 3/4 hour my son had to take his toddler son back to the room. I finally managed to attract our waiter from the night before who brought over the manager. He really didn't seem to get it saying that my grandson's food was brought quickly (true). We did eventually get our main courses and the bill was discounted but I would not recommend eating there if they're busy. We didn't try any of the many other amenities. This is a great place to bring the family. Kids can play in the sand, the bay is smooth a glass most of the time, and Sea World is nearby. The area is safe and the staff is alert, both very important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday present”
Reviews.Author: SeaDog24
Reviews.Content: Our kids got us a weekend at Paradise Point for my wifes birthday.We arrived about an hour before check-in time.At the desk they gave my wife some cookies because it was her birthday.They then informed us that they were upgrading us from a bayside bungalow,to "The Governors Suite". WOW!!! That place is huge.The view was great ,and just steps from the beach.The only problem now is that we are completely spoiled!! We had a great time and the staff there was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RShepard
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! On arrival we were greeted by 6 baby ducks at our door, that continuously visited throughout our stay. The island reminded us of Hawaii where my husband lived for many years and yet it is just a few miles from our house, what a perfect staycation. We ate a Barefoot Bar and Grill numerous times during our stay and the food was always amazing. we especially like the breakfast, the Green Eggs and Ham and Blueberry Muffin Pancakes were our favorite...we had to order them every time! It was nice that there were multiple pools so if you didn't want the hustle of the main pool there were places to escape. Personal suggestion, bring your bike or rent one, it is a great way to get around. Also Paddle boarding is great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Island Resort in Mission Bay, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: like2g0
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point Resort & Spa is as tropical as you can get in California. Mature landscaping, lots of trees, ponds, waterways, waterfalls, bridges, secluded places, and its all surrounded by sandy beaches and of course views of the bay. We enjoyed breakfast and lunch at the Barefoot Bar with outside dining and were entertained by the locals....birds, all types of birds. I'm not sure what Harold is, but he must get out of the wrong side of his nest each day. He was so grumpy while protecting his turf from the numerous sea gulls and egrets and ducks galore. It was a circus. Wish our grandkids were with us. Then the fishing boat arrived back at the dock and the men fed the leftover bait to the fish cruising the surrounding pond. What a commotion in that water! Several types of huge pond fish raced some birds for the biggest treats. All got their fill. The longer we were there, the more we enjoyed the place. The room was great, we had a Bayside Jr. Suite, but save some money and get the Bayside Lanai - I think they are identical, except the Jr. Suite is a bit bigger. Ask about the difference if interested, it is confusing. We did have a "wet bar" which used to be called a kitchenette. Still has a small microwave and mini frige and sink. No more burners. Have to ask and probably pay for utensils/dishes or bring your own. Walkilng around, we spotted some Garden View rooms that were really nicely oriented, too. They are all bungalow style. All one floor with patios. Lovely linens. but too firm of a matress. Didn't think to ask for a topper? We played the 18 hole putting course that runs along the entrance drive - and it is really a fun litlle course, white mini-bunkers and all - much nicer than it looks as you are driving in. Altho don't expect regulation greens. Even hubby liked it. Didn't try the Spa, or Baleen, the fancy restaurant - it was closed the 2 days we were there, but next time perhaps. It was our anniversary, and I mentioned that. They gave us a very nice red wine and fresh fruit. Thanks! This is a wonderful place for families..lots of activities....and honeymooners. We loved the "adult" pool after trying the others. So quiet and the setting is lovely with that secluded woodsy feeling. New owners just took over the place. There is some deferred maintainance - at least the main hot tub/spa needs replastering. They have cleared out the over/undergrowth and I hope they replace the bouganvilla with something as colorful as they were. Our daughter was married here some years ago, and I do miss those bouganvilla. Now, that was tropical.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dirty room, hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: jerretired
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled 3 thousand miles to celebrate our 40th anniversary. The location of the resort was wonderful. Upon arrival, the desk clerk informed us that the parking fee was $25 per night. We were able to negotiate it down to $15. She then informed us that the "Passport to Paradise" package fee was $25 per night. This was a fee for using things like the pool, tennis courts, putting course, etc. I informed her that we wouldn't be using these facilities but it didn't matter. She said the fees were automatic, whether we used them or not. Again, we were able to negotiate it down to $15. So right off the bat, $150 (plus tax) would be added to our prepaid bill before we even got to see our room. Upon arrival to our room, we discovered that the TV did not work. After calling the desk an engineer came and had to fix it and replace the remote. After touring around during day 2, we arrived at our room late afternoon to discover that the air conditioning did not work. After calling the desk and waiting 45 mins. the engineer came and told us that the air conditioner needed to be replaced. Another hour wait ensued and the job was done. Also, every day when I stepped into the shower, dirt would wash off from the soles of my feet to the drain. Interesting because the only place I went barefoot was in my room. So much for efficient maid service. I write this review only because I hope that maybe someone would get the message and possibly use some the "extra fee $" to replace worn out utilities and hire more or better maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise point is the most amazing, relaxing beautiful resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: sharivizz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 11 year old son just got back from a 4 night stay at Paradise Point Resort in San Diego. First off let me start by saying our son has Asperger's (high functioning autism). We were really wanting a vacation since it had been over five years since we'd taken a "real" vacation. Our son likes places that are nice and quiet and not too noisy. After doing some research on the Internet I thought that Paradise Point sounded like a perfect fit for our family. I had read some negative reviews on here before we left so I have to admit I was a tiny bit apprehensive but let me put those fears to rest for you. Paradise Point is the ultimate resort! They have everything!! They have five amazing pools, two awesome restaurants (with gorgous water views), and a beautiful private beach that stretches all around the property. They have firepits all along the beach as well and you and your family can make schmores there at night. The room we had was absolutely amazing!! We were steps from the beach and we had a beautiful room equipped with a fridge, king bed, computer table, nice dressers and two big screen tv's! We were thrilled!! We had a beautiful deck equipped with patio chairs that we sat in every day. Our son loved the fact that there were ducks wandering all over the property and was ecstatic that the same group of three ducks came to our door everyday!! You can buy some food at the gift shop and feed them. Very reasonable price at only $1.50 per bag. Now I mentioned before that our son has high functioning autism so we found this resort to be perfect for children with special needs because of the serenity of it all. Definately not overstimulating and noisy. I have to also mention that I believe this resort is perfect for ANY family!! I think kids of all ages would love it! We are already planning our next trip back!! The customer service is impeccable and all of the employees go above and beyond to meet your needs. They can pick you up in golf carts at any time to take you and your family to one of the pools or dinner..etc. Did I mention there is an awesome store there with everything you could possibly need? My husband and son bought me a beautiful bracelet for an early mother's day gift! Oh and so many activities.... Bike rentals, mini golf, basketball and more!! Not to mention the onsite marina with boat and jet ski rentals. This was the most awesome vacation we have ever been on and I want to spread the word!! Go to Paradise Point for your next vacation!! The location is perfect too!! Two minutes from Seaworld!! Last but definately not least the manager Pat is really awesome! He makes sure everything is running smoothly and that your happy. We love Paradise Point!!!! :) oh forgot to mention the cleaning lady we had was extremely friendly and efficient. Our room was spotless everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: adamsmail
Reviews.Content: The excellent service started with the reservation personnel. We booked two rooms with Amy's help and it was hard because we had a long list of what we wanted location wise on a busy weekend. She spent a good amount of time with me making sure it was all just right. We had a wonderful stay and we will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for multi-generation getaway!”
Reviews.Author: redwineboy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times when our children were young. We wanted to share it with our grandchildren so we reserved connecting bayside rooms for a family weekend. The grounds are fantastic and we used many of the facilities. We had one issue that was quickly resolved by Mr. Quick to our complete satisfaction. The staff was friendly and made us feel that they were genuinely involved in ensuring we had everything we needed. One note, there is now a resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: pooltimeya
Reviews.Content: LOVED this resort. I came with my young daughter and other famiy members and this suited all of our needs. Loved spending time at the resort and it was very convient to head to activities in San Diego as well. If you want to enjoy your time in San Diego - this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “An anniversary to remember.”
Reviews.Author: JimJoannDiamondBarCA
Reviews.Content: We spent our 30th anniversary at Paradise Point and what a great decision it was! The hotel is impeccably decorated, the grounds are lovingly cared for and our accommodations were clean, large and the beautiful view of the bay was the icing on the cake. Thanks also to the great staff who made us feel very welcome. It really did feel like paradise and we will be back sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: “Love at first everything!”
Reviews.Author: adenunzio
Reviews.Content: The HJotel grounds, room, staff, location and amenities are incredible. AMAZING views make it even better. Loved out stay and we will definitley be returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jujuarceo
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little late on a Friday evening and were checked in promptly. The twinkle lights all around the trees gave it a magical appearance that we loved as we drove to our one bedroom suite located on Mission Bay. Beautiful rooms and decor, very clean too.The last day of our trip we used the put put golf course with family and friends. Very fun! That night we had a bonfire which the hotel set up for us. It was a beautiful evening on the bay sitting in chairs around a campfire. The perfect ending to our short vacation! Thanks Paradise Point Spa and Resort!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to get away in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: pboone01
Reviews.Content: With all the things to do and see in San Diego, why not stay at an island resort where you can truly relax with the beautiful scenery, multiple pools and hot tubs, fire pits, on the bay or at some of the pools and excellent restaurants. You also have the bay surrounding the resort where you can take those nice long walks, pick up some shells or rent some boats! The resort is no comparison to a hotel with thick walls where you don't hear anyone, no one in a room above you and the friendliest staff which I'm not saying this from a onetime visit but we have been there 6 times in 3 years and it's always first class service.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: lozzag2009
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed from the moment we arrived at this 'hotel'. After a late journey down from LA we were both tired and hungry and frustrated that no food what so ever was available at the hotel at any time after 10pm. We arrived at around 10:30pm and were given some Pizza take out menus - however these only deliver up to 11pm so no luck there. We had to wait 10 or 15 mins at this late time just to check in as well as the receptionist was dealing with a complaint on the phone - we should have realised then what we were in for. We stayed in a Lanai Garden Bungalow and it was GROSS. Extremely dirty - in fact there was dirty tissue stuck to the bathroom wall and previous guests shaving gel on the shower fitting for the entire 4 night stay. There were dead flies stuck to the ceiling of the bathroom too which was very unpleasant. My partner left a pile of coins - mixed currency on the side the first day when we were out - and out our return we were surprised to find that the maid had taken it! Fair enought it wasn't a huge amount of cash, but surely by the sheer volume of coins that were there was (50+) and the fact that we had not left would make it clear to the maid that this was NOT a tip? We would certainly not tip the LACK of cleaning anyway. Additionally - watch out for the refrigerator in your room. Ours was very loud, so much so that we needed to unplug it in order to get to sleep. We let the maintenance team know and they simply came over the necxt day and replugged it in. We left it unplugged for the remainder of our stay. The walls are also paper thin - if your neighbour runs their tap you'll surely be woken up - you can hear everything that it going on around you from the room which makes for some poor nights sleep and very little chance of a lie in. To sum up - this hotel is very beautiful on the outside (grounds / restaurants / lobby etc) - however the owners a clearly too tight to invest on the inside. Over priced and absolutely not 4*, more like 2*.

Reviews.Title: “A true and beautiful resort with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: typomonkey
Reviews.Content: I went to Paradise Point Resort for Spring Break with my husband and teenagers. I did not expect the hotel to be as good as it was. It truly was a pleasure to stay here. Because the rooms are bungalow style, our stay was very peaceful with no noise issues the whole week. We were able to send the kids off on a surrey bike, they loved being free to roam without us. We felt comfortable to let them go on their own since the whole property is private. The rooms were newly renovated, and the theme was cute. The beds were super comfortable. There was plenty of towels, and drawer space. I loved the coffee makers- they were the single cup brew style, so the coffee would not get stale. The shampoo, conditioner, body soap were really nice- pump style so we did not run out. The 18-hole putt-putt golf was a fun bonus. We loved the beach, the water-sport rentals (we rented a speed boat and paddle boat at reasonable prices), the many pools and hot tubs dotted throughout the property, the beautiful park-like setting with water fountains and whimsical artwork all around, and the fire pits on the beach and some of the pool areas. I liked most that they did not enforce the pool hours in a super strict way; the guests that stayed on were very respectful of the quiet hours... it was a win-win. The poolside bar, waterfront cafe, and waterfront restaurant were all wonderful, good ambiance and good food (but a little overpriced). I bought multiple things from the store (including the replacement for a forgotten swimsuit), they had everything there; we even purchased zoo tickets from them since they were the better deal at the time. The negative drawback, was that they nickel-and-dimed their guests. They added a nightly parking charge and the prices in their restaurants and shop are high, we have no choice but to pay since the property is on an island. Still, the next time we are in San Diego, I will do my best to get a room at this hotel, God willing... since everyone in the family really enjoyed their time here.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with other reviews. The floors are filthy. Bring slippers.”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: The floors in this hotel are simply filthy. Just walking around, you're feet are ccompletely covered with black debris. It is simply quite nasty. The management of this hotel needs to either provide patrons with slippers (like they do in Asian hotels) or they need to mop the floors every other day (not just sweep). They need to understand that this hotel is essentially like bungalows which go directly outside. When patrons walk into the room, they come straight off the street or grass or dirt; they don't walk through a nice lobby, then through a carpeted hallway to wipe off the dirt from their shoes like in other standard hotels. They basically "walk in off the street" so to speak, dragging in all the dirt from the street. The floors are dark-brown wood, which camoflages the appearance, but your feet tell the ultimate story. Other than the extremely dirty floors, the hotel is quite nice. The beds are nice, the bathroom is nice, and the location is great. It's a very nice hotel. If they provided disposable slippers for each guest or mopped the floors regularly, they really could improve their quality. They certainly should at least mop the floors between patrons (whic they did not do before I arrived).

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: BillRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and had some doubts. When we got there, it was obvious that it was not a brand new hotel. However the grounds are beautiful. When we got to our room, the air conditioner was making a racket. (The room was spectacular, though.) I thought that we were going to have problems, and I called the desk. Within 10 minutes two maintenance men were there. They said that they did not want to disturb us by working on it, so they replaced it with a brand new one, smiled and went on their way. Any time I asked for anything, the response was similar. It was taken care of right away and done right. The only problem I had was with wake-up calls. They missed two out of the three I requested. The resort is on an island in a tropical setting. I noticed one review that complained because there were bugs. I did see some. I also saw sea gulls, fish, and other types of wildlife that have a tendency to live in a place like that. I can live with that. Each day the room was spotless. I requested extra coffee each day. It was always there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & beautiful! Not clean!”
Reviews.Author: taves7
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Paradise Point Resort. It was such a beautiful location and very centrally located. The front desk staff were so nice and helpful. The pools were nice, but the main pool was CRAZY with children. I went to the smaller pools to get away from the hubbub and relax in the hot tubs. Towels were provided, which is great, and our duck friends visited frequently. Everyone in my party liked the resort, but we were all disappointed with the lack of cleanliness in our room. We too experienced the black feet syndrome after walking around our room barefoot. Kleenix and toilet paper were not replenished. I had to beg for more towels before getting sent more. The maids didn't do a great job in cleaning up the bathroom, etc. They pretty much made our beds and took out the trash. We were very disappointed in this aspect of the resort. Our rooms were humid and the bathrooms were a tropical nightmare. The shower curtain couldn't contain the water so it would end up all over the floor. Crazy. The resort really is beautiful and we did head over to the Barefoot Bar. The bar was fun and had heat lamps to keep you warm at night. Enjoyed that. The business center charges an arm and a leg for internet access, FYI.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: Karla408
Reviews.Content: Resort is lovely. Well maintained. Gorgeous grounds filled with meandering pathways, ornamental ponds and tropical flowers. Fabulous location & scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Know what you're getting in to”
Reviews.Author: TravelswithkidsNY
Reviews.Content: P.P. Is a party place. Just know that going in and you should be O.K. If you still book. If you are looking for a quiet family getaway, however, you should keep looking. We booked P.P. On the advice of a San Diego local who said it was the most kid-friendly resort. This is true, up to a certain point... It is kid friendly during the day. We stayed a week in one of the bayside villas. During that week, therewere three huge, catered parties on the beach right outside our room with blasting music that went on until past 10pm. We were still on east coast time, so it was really a nuisance. Our kids are 10 & 7, so it wasn't horrible for us, but had they been babies or toddlers it would have been a nightmare trying to get them to sleep. As it was, we were all a little more groggy for our excursions.. Though the beach seems it should be private, you should know it is adjacent to a public picnicking area and parking lot so you get locals all day long who use the beach for entry into the water for kayaking, paddle boarding,biking, etc.. There are several fire pits on the beach, which we enjoyed using on a few occasions, but we found on the weekend that the locals also wandered over and used those too (dragging scrap wood from their trucks in the parking lot) and there is no security or anyone even bothering to check whether beachgoers are guests or not. I have nothing against locals, but we were spending a lot of money to not have at least first dibs. Lack of security, in general bothered me, especially with kids. One night there were 4 loud,drunk adults shouting on the beach at 3:30AM right outside my door and I had no idea if they were guests of the hotel or not and who I should call. Service at this resort is non- existent. This is the first time EVER in my life I did not tip housekeeping. There were some days that the only evidence they had even been there was that the the trash was emptied and the master bed was made (but they didn't bother to put the pull-out couch back or make up the cot). Luckily we're pretty neat people or the place would have been gross. When we arrived there was a dirty tray from the previous guests room service and they didn't come to pick up our room service trays until a day later. The pros: location is excellent. Very centrally located. The property is beautiful and spacious. There are activities for families to choose from. The restaurant is good, even by NY standards. The gift shop has a very nice selection of necessities, souvenirs and even clothes/ bathing suits/ sun shirts/ flip flops/etc. The villa was just OK. It was big enough for our family of 4. The furnishings are dated & I've already discussed the poor housekeeping. It is WAY overpriced for what you get, in my opinion, but probably because there aren't many family-sized room options.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable cleanliness and somewhat poorly managed.”
Reviews.Author: Ribar1
Reviews.Content: We selected Paradise Point because of the 4-star rating and reasonable price. We found the grounds to be beautiful, but the hotel and room lacked the amenities I would expect with a 4-star hotel. The hotel room floor was filthy, and the room very humid. No amount of cold air could limit the condensation that formed on our windows and keep our clothes from feeling damp. Maid service never seemed to make it around to our room until late afternoon or evening. We often just sent them away because their timing was so poor. The hotel did not appear to be at capacity, so I was never sure why our room could not be tended to during the day. Twice we went to the outdoor bar and were told their would be a long wait - the first time we were told the wait would be over an hour. We found that curious as no other people appeared to be waiting for a seat and the restaurant was less than half full. The second time we inquired as to why there was a wait. Their response was that the kitchen was learning a new menu and could not handle a busy crowd. Huh??? How can an established business not be prepared to seat their guests. i could understand this with a small business but Paradise Point has a conference center on premise. And the menu was quite simple and not extensive - after all - it's a bar! How complicated can it be to make a pizza or tuna sandwich?

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, like a hidden island, beautifully charming”
Reviews.Author: 2thdiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 1st San Diego visit at this 4-star hotel via priceline. It was so worth it. It's truly a resort: after a busy day out and about, we came home to a very nice, clean, comfortable hotel, that's inviting from the entrance. Located across from the Mission Bay Beach & Sea World, and 15 min to La Jolla (north), and 10 min from downtown (south), Paradise is very conveniently located in San Diego. Here are the pluses: 1) Parking is right in front of our suites (5 yards). 2) beachfront view, peaceful, with walking/running trail 3) fire pits in the sand--we roasted marshmallows (and if your room is beachfront, perfect five star camping ground:) 4) plenty of activities to be outside: running/jogging, pedalling around the complex, kiting and segway renting along the Beach (across from hotel). 5) swimming or picnic-ing. 6) contemporary decor, marble bath, just as the photos on website. 7) the hotel staff waived our parking fee 8) free wi-fi! 9) one level rooms, no one is above you, and no noisy hallway like other high rise hotels. 10) we got free upgrade to Garden View! we were thrilled! One Negative: 1) you have to pay $12 to use the hotel's gym Will definitely try to stay at Paradise again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Landscape but Pricey for a Resort”
Reviews.Author: lookingforthebeach
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week here with my wife and while we enjoyed ourselves, I'll have to admit, I was expecting more. Have you ever walked into a hotel and had to wait in line for a long time? I had to do that multiple times here. They never had more than two people working and for the life of me I never figured it out. Anyway, not a big deal in the grand scheme of things, just not the service I was expecting. Next, the room. We had a "garden" or non-beach room, but it ended up with a great view so we were pleased. The beach there is very nice, so again, great plus. The floors in the unit, however, were disappointing. They were dirty and I'm not sure when the last time was they were mopped and cleaned. To make matters worse, our ceiling in the bathroom had black stuff all over it along with yellow spots. It looked like no one had cleaned it for months. I was literally astounded, again, this is supposed to be a top-notch resort. I complained the next day and they fixed it right away - and did a great job. Other than that, the room was fine. There was wireless internet so that was great (it was free, or you could pay in your room for cat-5 connection.) The resort is very pretty. The landscaping is gorgeous and the pools and hot tubs were great. It's great for the kids as they have the "ocean-type" walk-in to the pool, if that makes any sense. All the kids were having a good time for sure. Major plus. On the flip side, and this could be just me so maybe this isn't an issue, but when I've stayed at other resorts, the reason why your room charge was so high is because everything is included. Not so here. You have to pay for everything: Bike rides, mini-golf, etc. You had to pay for internet (until I found the wireless internet the resort provided), and the gym was $12/day. I was really taken back by this, for when comparing it to say, Club Med, once you walk into the resort, everything is included. I know it's not apples-to-apples, but I think I was expecting a Club Med type service/situation and I just didn't get it. The food though was terrific. The grill was ok, but the Baleen was fantastic (pricey, but well worth it - Dinner and drinks for me and the wife was $120 before tip). All in all, it's a nice place. The beach looked nice, but it is so cold this time of year in SD don't even think about getting into the ocean. The resort seemed over-priced and I doubt I would return. It's ok, just nothing to write home about - and that's what I thought was getting. Maybe I'm the one in the wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Beautiful Grounds, Happy Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: hawknet
Reviews.Content: There is no denying that this place is gorgeous and in a perfect location. It was easy to get to, easy to find. even-though it is tucked away on an island in the Bay. There is a feel of openness as well as a feel of being well maintained just upon entering. After taking a leisure walking tour of the grounds I am glad that we did not get a room facing the beach. Though it has it's 3 pluses, 1), not much of a walk to get sand between your toes, 2), fire pit is practically yours (though it is 1st come 1st serve) and 3), if you get a West facing room, the sunset is yours from your cozy comfortable room. The reason I liked our grounds facing room was 1st the grounds are amazing (like you are in a manicured jungle though it won't look that way from the front entrance of the room), the breeze from the Bay is VERY gusty, and 3.) the view of the bay is, well... Boring, almost desolate. The grounds are very Disney World like in as much as the planing , care and cleanliness. We found it very relaxing and special. As for the rooms. we had some pleasant surprises, one mildly unpleasant one and 3 confusing ones. Confusing.... Parking spaces very tight ( I had to let my girlfriend out before I parked because in order to leave space for the guest parking spot next to me I had to let the leaves from the plants brush tightly along the side of my truck and we both thought it was odd that we had to enter into a shared (card locked) foyer before using the same card lock key to get into our room. Imagine after entering trough your front door, you are now in a hallway that only goes left or right (kind of like when you go to a larger theater and you have a choice to go the left side of the theatre or the right) and that there one room at each end. Thankfully the beds where not on adjacent walls. The last confusing part was that parking is an additional 25.00, but thankfully they waved this and gave a 36.00 voucher towards a meal at one of their restaurants. Not sure why, but my guess might be because of the booking problem I had when I booked on the net (I had to call to get it fixed, and they were extremely nice. Very efficient and all about fixing and pleasing) or maybe because we went in the middle of the week (Wednesday). Not sure, but was VERY appreciative!! The mildly unpleasant surprise was once we entered this hallway it smelled like there might be a pool in the next room. I am guessing that is what the other reviewers are refereeing to when they say "moldy", but to us it really smelled like we just entered into an enclosed swimming area. The best surprise was after we opened the drapes and saw the grounds from our own patio. You could not tell at all even after driving around or when we parked, that this was going to be part of our experience. Though the patio was was ours it was not exclusive ( we could see other rooms on the other side of the narrow lagoon) It was still quite nice, the breeze was perfect and once we were in our room, access to my truck was easier then going through the sudo foyer. We did not encounter the same experience other reviewers had in reference to un-cleanliness in the room or hearing our neighbors. Though we weren't really looking hard, everything seemed clean. Nothing jumped out at us and made us think ewwww that's gross. the other really nice surprises, were no bed bugs and the comfort of the bed was heavenly. Two last things... the food at Baleen's (on site restaurant was not only perfectly prepared and the best tasting it was visually pleasing as well. The Barefoot Bar & Grill (the other restaurant on the grounds) had so many great choices for breakfast that we ended up splitting our food. The coffee and the OJ wasn't the best and were the only disappointing parts of the breakfast. TIP....Ask for a resort specialist to see what deals they have going and not all grounds facing rooms are equal as far as view, some are amazing and more private and some are no frills. Ask the hotels resort specialist it if you are curious.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind dirty rooms you will enjoy your stay...Just keeping it real”
Reviews.Author: Tamerajean
Reviews.Content: My expectations were not high after reading resent reviews. I at this point didn't want to stay here but was stuck considering I paid for two rooms in advance with no refunds. When we arrived the front desk staff was really friendly and made you feel welcome. I told them we had two rooms and wanted connecting since one room was for the teenagers but I didn't want the room that was moldy smelling that I had read about in a resent review. She told us one of the rooms was ready but we had to wait a while for the second room to be cleaned. We went to the room to unload our luggage and take a peak at the room. No mold smell this was good, went to wash my hands and noticed the counter was dirty so I took one of there pretty white wash cloths to wash it down with and it turned black along with hair it picked up. Then a problem we could not live with: no connecting door for the kidâ€™s room. So off we go back to the front desk, they were so nice and right away gave us another set of rooms. We are now loaded back up and head for the new rooms, we walk into the first room to be greeted by the smell of MOLD (they must have known this was a problem since they had the bathroom fan on) so off we go to get another set of rooms. This time a gentlemen helped me, he took off our parking charge and gave us a resort credit for the incontinence and offered to upgrade us to a nice room on the beach but we would be sleeping with the kids on a roll-away (give us one room instead of the 2 that we paid for). I declined since I didn't want to sleep with the teenage boys, so he gave us two rooms in the back 40. (We got to listen to the work crew cutting stuff up and trip over the extension cords left out across our walkway). By this time I was just done changing rooms and ready to get on with the vacation. The room was fine except they were so dirty, at first I thought well these just must not get used so it will be better tomorrow after they clean it. After returning the next day from our outing I noticed that nothing had been wiped down and they even left us with dirty glasses. We all were walking around that night in bare feet after showers not thinking the floors would be dirty, our feet turned black! So don't forget flip flops for everyone if you don't want to shower twice before bed. It was like this everyday, on day number 4 they didn't leave us clean wash cloths so I stopped by the front desk to ask for some explaining the reason about black feet. The supervisor talked to me telling me it was not expectable and she would have our room cleaned in detail the next day including getting those floors mopped. I then went to the spa to have a pedicure and manicure done for $258 why not since my floors would finally be clean (it was worth the cost Jennifer was amazing). Needless to say the cleaning we were told would be done WAS NOT. Dirty floors, dirty tub, dirty glasses, dirty counter tops, dirty chairs, and they never wipe down the tables in the rooms. Six blissful days of a dirty room, I'm just keeping it real. Love the fact too that a moldy butter knife set outside the front door on the ground for 6 days (it was there when we got there), you would think the housekeeper would at least pick it up after walking over it everyday. When we were leaving I told a housekeeper as she was going by, she says "NO NOT MY JOB". Upon check out they gave us that long excuse about the changes in housekeeping. On the plus side the property itself is beautiful, the front desk staff in wonderful, the guys out front are really friendly and more than willing to help with anything you may need including directions :)

Reviews.Title: “Happy family getaway”
Reviews.Author: Julielevans
Reviews.Content: We arrived and went to check into our room, we had requested a 2 bed and got a 1... We went to the lobby and they UPGRADED us to the lagoon view with 2 beds!!! It was so beautiful! Our 2 year old had the funnest time feeding the ducks and the view was priceless. We took many walks throughout the day, our 13 year old rode around on a beachcruiser and the staff gave our 2 year old fish food every day we were there! He got to feed the baby sharks and fish. The pools are well kept and the main pool is heated which was nice. We had so much fun making smores at the firepit at the pool. It was nice not having to worry about all the sand on the beach to make our smores with a 2 year old and a 4 month old. Naptime was easy for the babies since housekeeping provided us with a portible crib free of charge. Housekeeping did a great job at keeping our place tidy during our stay. I was surprised at any negative reviews I saw on the rooms or the grounds, we expirienced nothing bad! I would recommend this place to anyone! It was alot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “If I could have given 0 stars, I would have. worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: lcoe
Reviews.Content: We thought the website would look like the rooms, but don't be fooled!! It looks NOTHING like the pictures! We read all the bad reviews and did not believe it- mistake for us! Do you expect a clean room when you check in? Here is what we found when we checked in. Crumbs in the bed, dirty soap dish with dirty soap in the safety vault, old sticky coffee from that last guest under the coffee pot... just to name a few things... Do you want to sleep at night? We did, but the bedroom has an adjoining door to the neighbors and you can hear every word they say all night long! Awful! The ugliest room I have ever seen and the BATHROOM is HORRIBLE! The rooms are supposed to renovated and there is no way that is true. The bathrooms are disgusting. The list price is a joke. They will offer way less in a second! DON"T STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little getaway”
Reviews.Author: flyinghikoki
Reviews.Content: We had a one night Living Social coupon + $40 resort credit to stay in a Lanai room at Paradise Point but we received a super lovely upgrade to a suite which had a separate living room and a kitchenette. The view wasn't great - the bay on the side we were on wasn't great but there was a sandy beach area and fire pits. We ordered room service which was quite good and very responsive - they even forgot an item we ordered and took it right off the bill when they called to see if we enjoyed our meal. It was a great value all-in-all. We traveled with another family so it was nice to have a bigger space where we could hang out all together. The renovations to the resort are very nice - the furniture and accessories are all still fresh and new. We enjoyed the pools and think we'll go back if we can find another special. Only issue were the concrete ditches providing drainage to the bay from the resort - the uneven concrete is a hazard and an eyesore. Note that parking is $25/day but at least the wireless was free.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point lived up to it's name and then some”
Reviews.Author: hillkokonis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Lanai Garden guestrooms for 2 nights in late March. The room was beautiful! It had been freshly & tastefully renovated very recently. It was EXACTLY as the picture shows on their web-site which in my book is all that one can ask for. The bed was very very comfortable and made for a great nights sleep, the linens were top quality. Our room was at the back of the property with the lanai and patio doors backing onto a beautiful green garden space with lots of privacy. We used the tennis courts and they were very well maintained and in very good condition. For the price that we paid, the value that Paradise Point gave us was a 10 out of 10. When you deliver what you say you are going to deliver and even surpass that? As I said, that is really all that you can ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Lush beautiful unique but some issues.”
Reviews.Author: minnesotajul
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Not a typical hotel, these rooms are ground-level bungalows. The mildew on the drapes and overpowering mold smell of our first room forced us to move (further away from our friends and the convention center). The second room was better but there was still a bit of mildew/mold on the lower walls and one morning we woke up to a very wet floor as the rain had come in under the door. There were two locked doors to adjoining rooms and we could hear the plumbing from the our neighbors very early in the morning as if they were in our bathroom. The beds are okay, a bit squeeky. We had our own little patio with two chairs and a tall hedge for privacy. Grounds: Grounds were lush and tropical--bird of paradise, palm trees, just gorgeous. But we spent a good amount of time on our feet being lost, as the roads curve around all over the place and the units look the same. You can sometimes catch a ride on a golf cart. The beach is lovely but it was too cold to enjoy it even fully clothed. Service: We found the service to be excellent from the front desk, gift shop, bell staff, etc. Food: Only 2 restaurants on property. Although pricey, we got tired of Barefoots and wanted to try Baleens but it was closed that night. Having no car and being there for business, we ate at the Barefoot a lot. Good food but I was hoping for more "California fare" and the service varied from good to not great, depending on the server. It was a huge problem for them to give separate checks. They need to fix that issue. Overall, for the low group rate we got, I would stay again, but not at the rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a Beautiful Tropical Garden Setting”
Reviews.Author: shellvacation
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our March Break vacation at the Paradise Point Spa & Resort. The staff were very warm and friendly. They were able to answer any questions we had about the surrounding area. The amenities and grounds were beautiful and very well maintained. My children enjoyed the basketball courts, the outdoor ping pong, and swimming in main pool -- one of five that they have to offer. The room was comfortable but on the smaller side for a family of four. Unfortunately the sound proofing is non-existent and as a result, noise from the television, phone, and even regular converstations are clearly heard between the walls. We were woken on three mornings at 5:15 am due to noise from the neigbour's television and kept up to midnight once due to a Friday night party. On the one evening we were forced to call the front desk. The response was immediate and very much appreciated. We would definitely consider returning to Paradise Point but only if they were able to provide a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: enelso16
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 with 3 kids under 10 who travels a couple of times a year. This is the first hotel in 20 years that I didn't leave a tip for room service. This hotel is filthy and was a complete disappointment. We had two king suites on the bay beach and stayed for 3 days. The only reason we continued our stay is because we were gone all day at the SD zoo and SeaWorld - otherwise we would have changed hotels. I can't believe American Express recommended this place. The furnishings look like the pictures but the rooms we stayed in smelled of mold and animal urine, the carpets were filthy and the travertine tile in both our suites had not been mopped and had hair throughout the suite. The rooms we stayed in had stains on the walls that could have been easily wiped up. The rooms has very poor ventilation and moisture builds up at night which intensifies the poor smell. You won't find a telephone book or a clock in these rooms or any kind of utensils other than the two tiny dirty glasses in the bathroom. So if you want to drink a glass of California wine - good luck. If our housekeeping was indicative of everyone else's experience, the entire department should be fired. They were very inconsistent. One day they brought coffee and one day they didn't. One day they forgot soap and then gave 2 soaps the next day. They made the bed and gave new towels but didn't clean the floors or vacuum the rug. Also - the beach on the side we stayed on is sad. The bay is not the ocean. Right outside our suite was some kind of concrete runoff gone amuck. It was a danger enough that I didn't feel comfortable having my 7 and 10 yr old play football in that area. To top it off, my 3 year old with sensitive skin got a rash all over his face the one night he slept on the hotel pillow rather than his pillow pet. I mentioned the cleanliness issue to the front desk as I checked out. She responded that it was an issue the hotel was addressing and took off my parking and internet charges. You won't see us back here. Stay at the Grand Pacific Palisades up in Carlsbad and you will have a much better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point was a true paradise.”
Reviews.Author: mkhines
Reviews.Content: This was our family's 1st trip to California. We chose to stay at Paradise Point without knowing what to expect. We read some reviews prior to booking our stay. We arrived at night and could tell it was going to be beautiful. The grounds were amazing and exceeded our expectations by a mile. There was even a movie crew on site making a commercial. Although the appearance on the outside of our building was nothing spectacular, the interior had been updated with current decor. The bathroom was not fully updated, but nothing to complain about. The pools were heated and clean. There were palm trees, lily pads, ducks, huge beautiful trees along walking trails with bridges. It also had a private minature golf course (which we did not take advantage of...but wished we did). We would highly recommend this location for business or leisure. It was a wonderful retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Like Something from a movie set”
Reviews.Author: tohellor
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel and alot of effort has been put into keeping it look well, however found the staff to be a little rude and not very helpful. Pool area is very nice, however its very e xpensive to buy food/ drinks and you are not allowed to bring your own in. Situated about a 10 or 15 minute drive from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Off the hook!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_bunny3838
Reviews.Content: I took my family to Paradise Point resort and spa for 2 nights in March. We absolutely LOVED this resort. Stunning does not cover it! Great location (5 minutes to Seaworld) and minutes to Old Town, Beaches and restaurants. Greeted by friendly, helpful, adorable staff members. Room was ready as soon as we arrived (approx. noon). We had the standard Lanai Patio room, was very impressed, large, clean, modern. Views from private beach was incredible. Grounds are impressive, took many photos of beautiful gardens. Food was ok, expensive, but fairly good. Although was not impressed at paying $63 for room service breakfast, 3 muffins, 3 juice, 2 coffee. Pools are gorgeous, loved the outdoor fire pits and tiki torches. The main pool is best, heated, sandy beach area and hot tub to die for. MUST STAY in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “How the comercial says it "Priceless".”
Reviews.Author: cheddarstyle
Reviews.Content: We (Family of 5) were greeted at the door by wonderful staff including the Resort host -Mr. Quick. Our view from our room was like a screensaver on my computer that I sit and dream about all day. Beautiful wooden floors, flat screen tv's and 10 min after settling in, we were greeted once again by magnificent staff who were delivering milk and cookies for my children. Being 30 ft away from the ocean is a plus, watching my kids play in the sand while my wife and I relax on the patio furniture and enjoy the sun.... Priceless! Room service was great, resort store was clutch (milk for my 1 year old) and the all around hospitality was well above par. Couldn't ask for a better and more relaxing time. Thanks,

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful and relaxing resort with the most welcoming and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: rosegang
Reviews.Content: I was planning a very spontaneous trip for three friends and I to celebrate our friendship and help us heal from some rough periods in our lives. We came upon Paradise Point Resort and Spa and decided to celebrate a week there and enjoy the city of SanDiego. The resort itself was beautiful and welcoming and provided us with a the relaxing environment we were looking for; yet close enough for easy access to all the sites of SanDiego. However, the absolute best part of staying at this beautiful beach front resort was the caring and helpful staff. Every one we spoke to, before our trip and during, had our best interest at heart. We want to particularly mention Elizabeth Markling and the staff at Island Market. She was always there for us in directing us to the best places to eat and things to do, and would follow up with us to make sure we got there and enjoyed it. One time we were walking lost trying find a restaurant North of Paradise Point when Elizabeth called to check on us and helped get us directed to the right place. She and the staff at Island market helped us daily mapping out our adventures for the day . Elizabeth's skills and knowledge were most helpful, but most of all she did it all with a smile and personal touch. Thank you Elizabeth, Island Market Staff and Paradise Point for the most wonderful vacation stay! Mary, Ann, Mary and Judy (Our rooms were magnificent! Know that our travels have included Africa, Hawaii, Alaska, Dublin and throughout the United States)

Reviews.Title: “Best Place EVER!”
Reviews.Author: shannonlafayette
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing experience at the Paradise Point Resort. My husband and I flew in from Austin on March 10th to have a couples romantic weekend before the birth of our second child. When we checked into our room, we realize something wasn't right. The room hadn't been cleaned! However, we called the front desk and the manager, same lady who checked us in, made it right in every sense of the word. She was extremely apologetic and explained that an error had occured and the room we were given wasn't ready to be rented. She then upgraded us to the most amazing bay front room. It was perfect, and everything else from that moment on was perfect. Awesome room, lots of privacy, excellent food, very clean room and great maid service. We were beyond happy with our stay here and will certainly tell everyone we know about this place. Thank you again for such awesome hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: huntingtonbch
