At night, the grounds are beautifully lit with a romantic feel. All the staff we encountered were very friendly. Adult pool was nice and relaxing. The lounge chairs were padded with a thick cushion so we easily fell asleep. Over all, we enjoyed our experience at Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, give it a ten”
Reviews.Author: SPARKY0210
Reviews.Content: Don't be swayed by some of the bad reviews, I thought it was true paradise. We had room 119, garden room, the room was clean, perfect, had 2 queen beds, large room, great maid. I love ducks, we fed them every day on our patio. This room is close to the lobby, pools and restaurants. The grounds were immaculate and the lawns are all golf course quality. I didn't see any trash anywhere on the resort. You may want to book the least expensive room, then once there ask for an upgrade to a bayside one bedroom suite, we were offered one for $50 more, but decided to stay in our room. The concerieges - there were always 2 on duty were very friendly and helpful. Pick up brochures at the airport, I didn't see any on display at the hotel. A steak at baleens will run you $33, french toast or a hamburg at the barefoot restaurant is $12.50. The food was all excellent. If you want to walk to another restaurant, take a right out of the resort, walk over the bridge, take a right to the restaurant next to the Dana hotel. There is a bus stop at the end of paradise resort. great area for riding bikes on mission bay, can ride to pacific beach in 15 minutes. There's waterfalls and fountains all over the resort. This is the best resort I have every stayed at, I felt like I was in the caribbean. I also saw a soap opera star at the barefoot restaurant. Rented a power boat for $80/hour, can also rent waverunners $95/hour, pedal boats $20/hour, sailboats and others. I love this place. If you don't like your room just ask for another. Reviewers should give thier room number.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxed stay”
Reviews.Author: stora
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at this hotel and would rate it as above average. Was given a garden room that opened up at the back to a pretty garden and little pond. The gardens that surround the rooms are beautiful and well kept and coming from a gardener that is praise indeed !! The picture on the website is a little bit misleading as it is of a top price room and all the rooms are in fact joined together one side or the other so they are not detached but we did not hear much noise from next door even though they had a young baby so the walls cannot be that thin. We ate at the bar & grill and it was a Saturday night , great live band, fantastic setting , bit pricey, but the Thunderbird racing was on that weekend so it was fun to see how the others live who have money. Food was nice and well presented and once they had all gone on Monday it was lovely and quiet again and no problem getting a table. It is true what someone wrote before, if you have breakfast there the birds can be a bit of a problem and both times we ate in the morning the food was only lukewarm so I think they had a bit of a delay in the kitchens. There are not any other restaurants in walking distance but a few nice one's within five minutes drive going right out of the hotel. Great hotel if you are into water based activities but we did not go in the beach and the pools were lovely and quiet. The concierge does keep maps of all the local tourist spots so do ask him first, I wish we had before we bought a useless map in the gift shop. Watch the in room movies, as we got charged twice for the same film as it connects really quick even if you are just browsing. One word of warning, on our last day we bought three cakes and three hot drinks from the stall outside the gift shop to have on our homeward jouney and they cost 23 dollars- thirteen pounds in English money- at home it would have been Â£ 7.50 and that is being generous !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - not a 4-star as advertised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a nice weekend and booked through Hotwire. Hotwire listed the hotel as a 4-Star property and was NOT. We have stayed at many 4-star Hotwire hotels and been pleased, but this was not the case here. Rooms are very dated, dark - with a strange dim spotlight that highlights the bed. The rooms were large and provate, but the parking area is very dark and not well marked. The secuirty guard banged in my door at midnight to move my car because it was parked in the wrong spot - even though they were 4 empty spaces next to mine and the reason it was not in marked spot was because the numbers were worn off. The pool looked nice, but there was power boat races going on around the property and we were informed that we should leave by 8 AM and come back after 4 PM if we wanted any solitude and not have to face traffic congestion. Beachfront here means a sandy beach overlooking a bay/lake that overlooks mobile homes and camping areas. I give this place a 1-star and advise you to book elsewhere - not value oriented either. Parking was $18/night for a non-urban hotel - crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time here - a few probs but not major.”
Reviews.Author: sarah333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and our trip down the west coast of America. When we checked in we were upgraded to a bayside view room which was fantastic of them. They seemed really organised at check in and had someone on a golf cart who was lovely ready to show us where our room was - which was really helpful. The room was massive and had such a lovely view, we really liked the complex there were windy roads with gorgeous flowers and vegitatin and ponds with ducks and they also had massive fish and sharks swimming in a river at the back of the restaurant. It was a beautiful setting. There was also a lovely gift shop with all sorts of bits and pieces and food and drink. The pool areas were great and it's nice to have an afult only pool to get away from screaming kids - although when we went there was no staff there to serve drinks so we ended up going to the main pool anyway. We ate at the Baleen restaurant which was expensive as you'd expect but the food was absolutely delicious. The only down sides were the barefoot bar and grill where we had breakfast - the food was gross, we had poached eggs that were liquid. The plates weren't cleared very fast and there were pigeons and seagulls walking over the empty tables trying to pinch food - it was horrible! There were staff members just stood about chatting whilst this was going on which i thought was wrong. We also thought we'd give the place a try for an evening meal but again it wasn't up to much. Also the beach wasn't that nice and had quite a lot of rubbish on it - the hiring of sports equipment was also REALLY expensive so we didn't bother. Car parking charges are ridiculous too. But all in all we had a great time and if we came back to San Diego we'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but going downhill!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I just got back from this resort. The location is incredible, the main pool is very nice. Nice tropical feel. We've stayed here before and I have to say, the rooms were much cleaner in the past. For the price we paid, this place should be immaculate, but no way! Our curtains in our room were torn. The sink in the bathroom wouldn't turn off completely. We ordered room service and the plates were dirty. There were ants in our room. They didn't clean our room everyday. We were pretty disappointed. It's like they initially wanted this resort to be upscale, but got lazy over the years. It's a shame, because we've loved this place in the past, but we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, tropical atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, three kids (ages 6, 3 & 2) and I just returned from a weekend at this resort and were very pleased. After reading all the negative reviews, I was a little hesitant to stay here. Our main objective was clean grounds with a tropical atmosphere and walking distance to the beach, all of which were met at Paradise Point. Considering the price difference between a Bay View room or a Lanai Garden View room, we found the latter more affordable for us. Upon check-in I requested a room with a view of the lagoon (thanks to the advice of another reviewer). Our room (123) was clean, very near the lobby and overlooked a lagoon with ducks, which the kids loved to visit on our walks of the grounds. The room did not have a window, so we had to leave the air conditioner on to keep cool. It would have been nice to really enjoy some of those wonderful evening breezes. The front door is all glass, so there is some natural light in the room. The lush landscaping is really beautiful. There are winding paths all throughout the complex, so keep the map provided by the front desk. We requested 2 queen beds and a crib for our youngest. We found the sleeping arrangement comfortable at night, but with 5 people moving around, it was cramped in the morning while getting ready. We didn't spend much time in the room, so it wasn't a huge issue for us. We spent 1 entire day at the main pool. The shallow end is painted to look like sand, but is really concrete. Regardless, it is very shallow for the small kids and gently slopes from ankle deep to approx 5 ft. deep. My family had an absolute blast at the pool. We met a very nice family and spent the day talking to them in the shallow waters while our children played and splashed. The main pool has a beach cafe and provides waitress service for beverages (alcohol & non-alcohol) and lunch items (burgers, hot dogs, chicken wraps, salads), which was convenient so we didn't have to interrupt our fun to shower & dress the children to have lunch. Some of the other reviews noted the restaurants on the property as "pricey, and not very good", so we ate off-site for most of our meals. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and accomodating. If you plan to venture out by car, the concierge can provide a list with Driving Directions to all major attractions/points of interest in San Diego. Overall, Paradise Point was perfect for us and we plan to return next time we visit San Deigo. While the cost was more than we typically spend on a hotel room, the grounds and landscaping were beautiful and perfect for our family get away. We never made it to the beach area, but maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “It's so bad we had to leave the next day!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The beach was dirty with debris. Run down facility with cabinet door that won't close fully. Sofa-bed was tilted with legs higher than head--> not only gave me a head rush, but also gave me a glimpse of what women go through during pelvic exams. The toilet kept running. Infested with ants and spiders. The carpet was so dirty I wouldn't let my toddlers walk on it without shoes. It's a shame. The resort has great potential being in the middle of Mission Bay with great views. $18 dollar parking fee a day is just ridiculous! We stayed at their Bayside Bungalow at $425 a night plus tax! We had planned to stay for 3 nights. We just couldn't stand being there for more than 24 hours. We left the next day and found another resort and had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Not the same”
Reviews.Author: MarkRosenthal
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of this hotel since it was Vacation Village many years ago. Princess took over followed by Noble Hotels. When Noble first took over they really improved both the service, rooms, and the beautiful grounds. But since then everything has slowly but noticably dropped each time we have stayed there. This trip the grounds were noticably dirty and the community trash bin outside our room was overflowing with garbage for two days before being emptied. Room serivce was ordered twice and one time the food was so bad we had to complain and they happily took it off of the bill. Unfortunately the dirty dishes stayed outside our room for almost a day, and this happened twice. The same day we had a full day of going to the zoo followed by the the Padre game. After a very long, hot, and tiring day we returned to find our room hadn't been serviced and of course that meant we had no clean towels. The grounds are still nice but Paradise Point is one of the most expensive hotels in the area and you just expect better. The one thing I have noticed lately is that their seems to be less and less employess patroling the grounds doing maintenance and it shows. For the price you pay you just expect better.

Reviews.Title: “Safety not an issue!”
Reviews.Author: Woodstockpilgrim
Reviews.Content: The resort itself was ok but my daughter said the light in the bath was flickering. I tried screwing the bulb tighter and it came off in my hand. When I looked up inside the globe the light socket was burnt and charcoaled. The bulb had foil wrapped around it to stay in the burnt socket. I immediately went to the front desk and complained that this repair was unsafe and I didn't appreciate my family's safety being treated so lightly. The manager said he agreed and it would be repaired immediately. We went to dinner and thought the fixture was replaced. The next day we saw that the bulb was replaced with a new bulb with new tin foil. I believe this is a big fire issue and it makes me wonder what other safety issues are that can't be seen. If this had been the Days Inn for $60 a night I might not be surprised but the price of the resort would suggest quality and good maintenance without worrying over safety issues. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing end to fabulous trip to USA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had travelled from UK to California for a dream vacation. It was on most accounts! However. we had told our travel agent that we really just wanted to "chill out" in luxury for our last few days before flying back to London from LA. We were greeted on arrival and found reception staff friendly. Room was made available at 4.00pm. We were disappointed with standard of accomodation. The room was "dingy", poorly lit, small, furniture poor quality, carpet dowdy, wardrobe small, bathroom very small but clean. Had imagined something much better than this. The motel we stayed in in Santa Barbara was half the price and at least twice as good and the parking there was free! The gardens were nice and we liked the "adult" swimming pool. We felt the charges for parking were very high plus any extras. We did not complain but having had a fabulous trip to the USA and a wonderful experience covering California from North to South, this was a let down! We decided to make the most of San Diego and what a great City you have! We loved every bit of it and that made up for the shortcomings of Paradise Point We do feel that the management are holding back on their investment in keeping the accomodation up to a high standard. Its not what we would have expected or for that matter had been described by our UK Agent We would not recommend Paradise Point but at the same time, we had the best vacation of our lives in California but we will forget our visit to this particular spot!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 4* resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little worried about staying at Paradise Point. Many reviews had stated that the rooms smelled musty and weren't clean however we found that our room was clean and smelled fresh which I must admit I was relieved about. We had a 'Parlour Suite' which had a king size bed, a sofa queen, a small dining table and chairs, refrigerator, sink area, a vanity area with a wash basin and separate bathroom/toilet. The room looked as if it had been recently painted and gave the feel of a beach house. The resort just needs some TLC - the lagoons were rather dirty, full of bird feathers and debris and the main swimming pool, although well used, never really looked clean and did not entice you to go in for a dip. There were a lot of birds about and obviously where you have wild birds you also have bird poo and plenty of it - everywhere!! The birds were very off putting around the 'Barefoot Bar and Grill' as they used to land on the tables and finish any food scraps before the servers had time to clear the tables. It was unhygienic and unpleasant as they came swooping in and landed on the next table. The food at the 'Barefoot' was Ok but on the expensive side for what you got. The breakfasts were a real let-down after having been to the Mirage in Las Vegas. The 'Baleen' was more upmarket and although expensive the meals we did have in there were excellent. Tennis. bikes, croquet, putting, boats, jet skis etc were all available but were very cost prohibitive. My son is 14 and did not want to go on the beach but had he been younger I would not have wanted him to play on the beach as both the sand and the water looked dirty. Not the pristine white sands that the brochure describes. We stayed at Paradise Point for 8 nights and although we had no major problems we thought that the resort was overpriced and we weren't sorry to move on.

Reviews.Title: “When Good Hotels Go Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bathroom is the first tipoff to a bad hotel experience. And this bathroom had "Awful" written all over it. Let's just say that the maintenance crew had not been especially diligent. We tried to get to sleep, but a bad band was playing loudly at the bar. The front desk said the noise would stop at 10, but it lasted until 11. Sleep deprivation is part of the Paradise Point experience, as the turbo leaf blowers started at 6:30 AM. Then we took our little boy to the "heated" pool. As President Clinton might have said, it all depends on what the definition of the word "heated" is. We pulled him out when his lips turned blue. Then we had breakfast, though by the time the servers brought us the runny eggs, the time was closer to lunch. It reminds me of an old joke. In a raffle, first prize would be a week at Paradise Point. Second prize would be two weeks. It's a shame, since the place looks as if it used to be nice. But it isn't nice anymore.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at paradise point was perfect. The staff was excellent and they where always available to answer questions. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. The view from the room was spectacular. I would never stay anywere else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, noisy air con”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 7 nights, and were disappointed at the size and condition of our room. The carpet was nylon, and fraying around the edges. Decor was tired and grubby and the air con unit, although very efficient, was so NOISY that we were unable to sleep, and when the refrigerator kicked in, it sounded like a plane was in our room! Eventually we became accustomed to it, and slept better after the first 2 nights - the bed was extremely comfortable. The shower was really powerful. The best facility on the resort, without a doubt, was the adult pool. Its well appointed with luxurious sun beds, and the bar is nice. We were disappointed that, having paid a lot of money to stay there, they were keen to grab more money for things like use of the gym, and PARKING!! Food and atmosphere at the Barefoot Bar was good. Surroundings imaginatively planned, gave a real Tropical feel. Staff were friendly and helpful. All in all, we would definitely return, but would try to ensure that our room was better.

Reviews.Title: “Due For Renovation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from what was going to be a 4 night stay, after 2 nights. I spent more time in the lobby dealing with room problems than on my vacation. It's too bad. Five years ago I had a nice experience, but the hotel has become very run-down. My room was changed 4 times, each with problems. Each room had a musty odor, worn and dirty carpets, and cob-webs. The first one had only one bed even though I requested 2 (not going to work with 3 kids.) The next room had no windows and felt like a dungeon. One room had a water leak, which looks like it had been a problem for quite a while. Our last room had a bathroom light fixture explode, sending shattered pieces of light bulb everywhere, and had missing window coverings on the front door (which is a see-thru glass door that faces the street.) The grounds are nice, but right now some of the lagoons look more like swamps. The main pool is nice, with the other 4 being nothing to speak of. The prices are high, especially for the present condition, and everything is an extra expense -- self-parking, gym, bikes, mini-golf, etc. This hotel is in desperate need of some major TLC!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Not For the $$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in San Diego and would highly recommend this as a family vacation destination. We stayed at the Paradise Point Resort upon the recommendation from a friend, although were somewhat cautious about staying there after reading other peoples' reviews. The Resort grounds are absolutely gorgeous!!! There was lush greenery, flowers and ponds throughout...not to mention the convienience of having a beach within walking distance. Our kids, ages 4 & 7 were enchanted by the water, the beach and the daily visits from ducks, who came to our patio daily for a friendly visit (this was a real winning point for the kids). We found our room accomodations to be "adequate", with a "beach house" feel. There was nothing fancy about the room we were assigned to: a small room with 2 double beds, a small table, a television hutch with drawers and a small dorm-sized refrigerator (which we found helpful to stock with drinks and lucheon meats), as the Resort's restaurants were over priced and the food was only "adequate". There was a sizable walk-in closet a nice sized vanity area, with the bath & toilet in a separate room. The cleanliness of the room was questionable...although we had no difficulities with any ants or other bugs. I didn't feel the accommodations were worthy of the heafty price we paid per night. Also note that this agency has the nerve to charge for parking on top of what you're already paying!!! ($18 per night). The pool areas are nice, but not very clean. If you plan to spend lots of time in and around the actual Resort, this is a beautiful place to stay, but if, like us, you plan on visiting all the attractions in San Diego, you may consider someplace more reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: mauigrays88
Reviews.Content: The price that the Noble Resorts charge for a stay at this (resort?) is outrageous. Although the executive suite that we (2 adults & 2 children) stayed in was large and spacious the surrounding resort, employees and atmosphere did not warrant the inflated summer rate that we were charged. When you stay at a Resort you expect higher quality with knowledgeable employees and premier service. None of this was true all through the resort from the front desk, checking in to the Barefoot Bar & Grill. A blatant example would be after waiting 40 minutes for a simple meal to arrive to your table a manager gives you the excuse that the computer is at fault. Other tables were served and families left before our dinner arrived! We would not visit this motel again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but not enough for the $$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 17-20 with my wife and 2 kids (age 10 & 13). Room: We selected a garden view that had 2 queen beds. Room was small and had more of a street view than garden. Inside the room was a table with 1 chair, a lounge chair, a TV and small refrig. There was a closet with iron and board next to a vanity area. The bathroom was small in size. There was an area in the back (outside) that had 2 lounge chairs. Depending on the size of your family, you might feel squeezed in as we did. The whole complex is one level, so no one above you! Recommendations: If you want a "garden view, ask for one away from the street that actually looks over a pond or garden. Parking: You park right next to your room. However, it costs $15 per day! Grounds: Lots of flowers, trees, birds, ducks, ponds, fish and trash. For such a big, beautiful area, it's a shame that the grounds are not kept up better. There were areas of trash in the ponds and even a dead duck. The duck was still there when we left! Some of the ponds smelled due to lack of moving water. Pools: There's 5 pools in this complex. The "main" pool area is a sandy, beach like area surrounded by lots of lounge chairs. There's also a food/drink area for kids and adults. The problem here is that the pool is only 3 1/2 ft deep. This is great for small kids to maybe 7. If you want to actually swim, this area won't work. There's also a jucuzzi. The other "heated pools" include: >An adults area only. Nice pool and jucuzzi, but not for kids >The "waterfall" pool was great for my kids. Heated and 8ft deep. Activities: 18 hole, min golf ($9 per person), bike rentals ($10-$20per hr). There's a marina that has sailboats, motor boats, pedal boats ($20-$80 per hr). The beach area has several "fire" pits. One suggestion would be to bring your own wood and have a beach party. The complex charges you $50 for a small stack of wood, some marshmellows and stuff to make smores. Food: Room Service (didn't use so I don't have a recommendation).The complex has 2 places to eat: 1 casual, 1 semi-upscale. We ate 2 times at Barefoot (casual). We sat outside next to a pond area that included sharks, sting-rays...Food was average. There's a kids menu. Adult plates averaged $12-15. They also serve breakfast. Didn't eat at the "upscale" place. Didn't eat at the "main" pool area. There's also a "Market/Gift shop". Prices are way overpriced. We actually paid less at PetCo park than the complex "market" Location: From a location point of view, you're within minutes of everything. 10 mins to Belmont Park, 15 mins to Balboa Park/Zoo, 5 mins to Sea World, 15 mins to Seaport Village, 15 mins to Old Towne. The complex offers no transportation to local attractions. There were several taxi's I saw however. Overall it was just average. Not enough to make me stay again at current $$.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort--not so beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: MeinPhx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two girls, ages 5 and 7, to San Diego from July 10th-15th. I had originally read some good reviews on this hotel--it was not until a few days before departure that I started reading some bad ones. If I had it to do over again I probably would have picked a different resort. Check in was fine- we arrived about 1:30 and our room was ready. Very nice man gave our girls and my husband a ride in his shuttle to our room and I followed in the van. I was immediately disappointed with the location of the room. It was right next to the convention center . This made our view from our room some type of wood fence that was used to hide some of their equiptment. Since I had not specified where I wanted my room, I did not complain. I was also disappointed about the size of the room. There were two queen sized beds and a small desk with two chairs. The TV was set into an armoure that also held a very small refridgerator. If my husband and I had been traveling alone the amount of space would have been fine. The bathroom sink was very nice, but again very small. The shower/bath was also tiny.There was a strong must smell in the room. I decided not to fret as we were planning on spending the majority of the time at the pool and Sea World. We ordered room service that night. Took about 30 min to get our food. I would give it a 2 on a scale of 1 to 5. Not cheep by the way! In the morning we woke up to find we had visitors in the bathroom. Ants! I was not pleased about this. I do not go camping because I like the outdoors to stay outdoors!! We called housekeeping and advised them we would be gone for the day and would appreciate the ants be gone when we came back. Sea World was wonderful. Only stayed a few hours. Did breakfast with Shamu--I highly reccomend this for the kids!! They loved it!! Decided to go back to the hotel and swim. We would finish Sea World the next day. We really enjoyed the main pool. There were many families, but that was fine with us...we had ours with us!! The service at the pool was great. We always had a drink in our hand and the food was OK. Not a very big selection and the prices were high, but it was nice to be able to eat at the pool. The girls had their hair braided poolside. They thought that was neat. I would give the pool area a 4 on my 1-5 scale. The ants did make a return a couple of times and eventually I did not smell the musty smell. Must have gotten used to it. When we checked out we complained again about the ants and the fact that one day we came back and had no parking space--there was something going on at the convention center. They ended up crediting two days of parking which was $18/day. There were many on site activites- boat rental, bike rental, ect. We did not visit the beach at the resort, we drove to Mission Beach. Don't get me wrong. We had a wonderful time on our vacation. The room issues did not ruin the week, however I would not reccomend this resort or stay here again. It was definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Just Got Back from Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2Travel23
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 3 nights at the Paradise Hotel for a short vacation to San Diego. Our room was clean and nice and the grounds are decently maintained overall. The service was attentive, especially at the pool, where we ate lunch one day. We also ate one meal at the Barefoot Bar and Grill and the service was friendly and the food decent. The only bad thing is there are tons of large birds everywhere at the Barefoot Bar and Grill and one was eating eggs off of a table near us, which I thought was really gross. The family sitting there must have found it acceptable because they just sat there and allowed it. The restaurant should post signs discouraging that because the birds are a bit of a nuisance. I felt safe walking around the resort, even at night, because of all the families and other people around. The main pool is very large and warm and the pool area is kept clean. Some areas of the grounds could use a little TLC, such as a bit of trash in the lagoons and the water is a little funky in some places. Some of the outdoor furniture by the lagoons could also use a cleaning as well (the pool furniture is kept very nice). We stay at a lot of hotels and I felt that Paradise Point did an overall good job of meeting our needs. I am picky and would be quick to point out anything gross or dirty in our room. The curtains in our room need to be replaced because they were torn and worn on top. Other than that, the beds are very clean and comfortable and the rooms are quiet. I guess people's impression of this resort depends a lot on where the room is located and there is a lot of variation. Our room did not smell musty at all, nor was the carpet dirty, as I have read in other reviews. Why some rooms are cleaner than others seems strange to me as well (different housekeeping staff?). This is a nice, family-orientated place to relax. There are lots of kids everywhere, so we felt very comfortable (I was not the only pregnant lady by the pool). I wanted a place to stay with the kids while my husband worked in San Diego and not have to drive anywhere during the day. Our room was right on the bay and we had a lovely view. We walked on the beach at night and enjoyed all the bonfires and other people around. One last thing-the prices for snacks are very high in the gift shop and restaurants are pricey (the resort does seems to nickle and dime you). Since the rooms have refridgerators, we went to a grocery store and stocked up on juice boxes, bottled water, yogarts, fruit, etc. and ate breakfast on our little patio. For dinner, we left the resort and ate at some of the wonderful places San Diego has to offer, such as in Old Town, and for a lot less than Paradise Point. Great way to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Flaws and Red Flags within the first two hours!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: GOOD POINTS: Lots of lush mature vegetation, I love flowers so lots of hibiscus and tropicals for my outdoor pleasure. Nice to be able to park the car right near our casita room. We are from the desert so the cool and green was NICE. On the pond I amused myself with feeding the ducks, and the fish for the snowy egret that stayed at my side all wkend. Food was okay--fruits and veg. were fresh-- San Diego is fairly compact so location didn't matter that much.. Nice conference room on the water with windows. Hate those dark-hole rooms in hotels. Easy to get around off-property, near La Jolla and other beaches. One staff member that stood out to me, she was helpful and a jewel. NOT VERY GOOD: First thing in the room, had no screen on the sliding door--so I called maintainance and they had to come and put one on. We live with A/C all summer so I wanted FRESH AIR all weekend. I spoke Spanish to the gentlemen, and tipped him, after all--it's management that screwing up not him. Water main broke and we were out of water within the first two hrs. Then they shut if off 9pm-5am to repair it. Left us a note with bottled water...as it should be! Two locks on the door, only one worked, the deadbolt above did not. Seemed like I could never get printed info from the Concierge--he was not there, and they didn't leave out any brochures --as if they were stingy or something, I wanted some maps and info on what to do, go, see. None to be found put out in racks. We asked for extra hangers for our room, and we got these WIRE ONES that looked like what you get at the cleaners with the cardboard bar on the bottom. Gee I mean, I can live with those but hey, what we were paying for a ROOM?? COME ON... SPELLED OUT CHEAP to me the first hour! OVERALL IMPRESSIONS: Would not pay to go back. The price doesn't compare to what you get. I like comfy rooms and clean, not worn. I need to feel, safe, clean and okay with the energy of room. The worn also makes it not feel very clean. Details mean alot! The details were overlooked.... Beds okay, nothing special--could be more firm. Our room felt like it was a bit dated and worn. And we were there for a conference, so our group bought a big block of rooms. You'd think they'd want our business back. I think some of the reviews I have read come from people with kids and some can live with a certain messyness and chaoticness -- I come from a family of 10 kids so I am not a snob. Families with kids can dirty up the rooms, or don't care about dingy carpets, etc.....so they overlooked the room points. We didn't go to SeaWorld so that was irrelevant to us, the location. I worked for the airlines, travelled extensively and have been to many nice resorts and even motel 6's...we've lived in Europe and all over the U.S, and can enjoy nice Motel 6's to the very posh. Paradise Point survives because of people who buy into mediocrity, and pay that kind of money for inferior services and goods, so it promotes it. The property is old and needs heavy revamping, which is why the pipes keep breaking, etc. No money is being put into the hotel for upgrading--shame, it's a nice property, just poorly managed. You can just look at it to tell. The rooms and details of the property look deteriorated. One day it might shut down from run down. Also, when I check into a resort or hotel, their main business is to supply a comfortable place to sleep and be during our stay, and the first impression I get is when I walk into that room. I mean, I told my husband, hey--here I am having to be on the phone calling for MAINTAINANCE, etc. and these are the things I do at HOME! When I arrive on vacation, I shouldn't have to be taking care of ordinary room maintainance things because that is what I am paying a resort to provide! So that didn't set a very nice TONE for our 5 day stay. My niece lives in San Diego and she kept telling me that we were staying at a VERY NICE RESORT. We brought her back to our room and she walked in and said--"oh..this doesn't look like what I'd expect, for what you paid." So BINGO! We had a nice time, but really, this has been one of the most expensive places we have stayed this past year --I am talking about the room price--nice resorts always will have expensive eateries....so that is a given....close enough to other places to eat within a short drive....the little restaurant on the water was okay but we didn't eat at the nite-dining one. I am surprised for such a large resort there were only 2 restaurants on the property. There was some nice staff that helped to make our stay pleasant, those are the few that go out of their way to please and put in 110%, but not all were like that. I am so surprised, our 1st trip to San Diego and for that area, seems like other resorts and hotels would be UP from this place. A family in the casita next to us, showed me on the map some other resorts they stayed in, and recommended! The family was from Carlsbad. Next time we will choose one of those recommended places.

Reviews.Title: “Totally overated!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Problems started from the beginning. Our room wasn't ready until 6pm and that was after complaining several times. There was no hot water the first night. The ice machines didn't work. You have to flush the toilet 5 times to get it to fully flush. The buildings themselves are run down. Don't be decieved by the website in thinking you will get a private bungalow. There is no such thing. The rooms are in blocks of 6 per building. The restaurants are ridiculously overpriced and the food is awful with very little selection. Cigarrette butts are all over the property. The pool is not a sand bottomed pool as it appears on the website. It just looks like sand but is actually rough concrete. This "resort" is the most overrated hotel on the planet!!! The only good thing is it is conveniently located to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Overall had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: s0479
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about staying here after reading some of the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. We arrived before checkin time and had to wait about 40 minutes for a room but the clerk let my daughter pick where we wanted to stay on the grounds. We ended up right next to the governors suite, so one room away from the bay. The room was a bit small, with 2 queens beds and the bathroom was tiny! But the room was clean and had no musty smell. The staff, restaurants, pools and spa were great. Great location to Sea World. I don't often stay at 4 stars and this wasn't quite as luxurious as I thought it would be but I got a good price and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomm, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After visiting San Francisco and Las Vegas for the previous 6nts we were looking for some wind down time on arrival at San Diego. We had to wait 2 hours to checkin , sitting with our luggage around the pool waiting for a room to become available (this after queueing at checkin 3 times to chase it).The checkin staff were unwelcoming, lacked knowledge about the location of the hotel and frequently were unable to change travellers cheques into cash (even with a limit of just $100 a day). Lanai garden rooms are lovely, beds really cosy, good bathrooms and lots of living space and gardens beautifully manicured although our patio did not get much sun. Restaurants are well situated, good food, friendly staff but get booked up quickly so reserve ahead. Good walks around mission bay and access to beach (fine sand)from the hotel.Slightly awkward to get around without a car but no 9 bus runs every 30mins to old town for approx $1.75 and then connects with the trolley into downtown city centre at various stops which is useful. San Diego zoo is brilliant although $32 a head to get in including buses/skyfari etc but worth it! Visit new baseball stadium and see the San Diego Padres- its a great experience and the stadium is well placed for transport and does tours if no matches on, such is its attraction. Coronado island by ferry is a "must do" and the beach at the Coronado hotel is free so take your towel and sunscreen and chill out! Everyone in San Diego was great except the frontdesk staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: VEGASRUSS
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights 5 days at Paradise Point and really enjoyed our stay. This resort is great for families with lots of resort activities. Our Daughter loved movie night at the pool. The Barefoot Bar and Grill on property has a great menu and service. Our room was in a perfect location to the beach and main pool/spa......we did talk to several people that were not satisfied with the location of thier room. The resort is minutes from Sea World which was our favorite attraction, breakfast with Shamu is a must do!!!! The only downfall of our stay was the $18 a day parking fee. Overall, the property was clean with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but with problems”
Reviews.Author: kelly38
Reviews.Content: We (myself, husband, & 6 yr old son) just returned from staying at this resort for 2 nights. We booked a room for 3 assuming we would have two beds OR 1 bed with a pull out sofa for our son. SURPRISE! That night we tried pulling out the sofa bed only to find it would not pull out!! I called the front desk & was told if I had read the fine print on my reservations it states "Special requests, including bed types are not guaranteed." She had someone bring over a roll-away within minutes & I was told we would be upgraded in the morning. My husband went to the front desk in the morning & was told there was no other rooms available BUT we we not be charged for the roll-away for 2 nights!! Now wasn't that generous!! In the long run we were also compensated with a $50 credit to our room. All in all it was a nice stay but somehow we feel a little bit taken advantage of. We will not stay there in the future beacause of the above incident!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: kgreenaz
Reviews.Content: PRO: -we paid for a garden lanai room and asked for one near the beach. We were just across the street from the beach which was great for my 2 & 3 year old boys. -Main pool was nice and warm. -Location to SeaWorld makes it all worth it. Able to come back for naps and go back afterwards. -Barefoot Bar had yummy food for adults & kids. Room service was good, too. CON: -$18 to park my own car was not disclosed when reserving room online. -Between taxes & park fee, add $40 a day (at least) to your room rental rate. -Had no maid service the entire time: we left at 9:30am for SeaWorld each day and returned at 2:30 for naps. Maid service ends at 4pm. We had to order clean towels but never had the room cleaned the four days we stayed. -Except for the main pool, the others pools are dumpy. -The mini-golf course was being re-seeded and not worth $9 to play on sand. -Loved the toiletries that are from the spa but the room was small and old. I brought lots of scented candles that did not help. I would look at another hotel first to see if there is anything comparable. If not, I would definitely stay at the PPH again. Employees were friendly. We had a water main break on our last night so had no water from 9pm - 5m but were given bottles of Evian. Liked the close proximity to the public beaches across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I went over the Memorial weekend. It was our first time going to the hotel and I was a little worried. Especially after reading the other reviews. The place was wonderful. The grounds were beautiful. Very lush. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Tony gave me and the kids a great ride over to the room. The location of our room was perfect. Right by the main pool and close enough to walk a few steps to the beach. We basically stayed the whole trip by the pool. Playing a movie by the pool Saturday night was a great touch. Yes, there were a lot of kids by the main pool. But what do you expect. It is a holiday weekend. The only negitive thing I could say is about the $18 fee for parking. I would expect that for valet, not for parking our own car. In any case, if wont stop us from going back.

Reviews.Title: “Not All It Claims To Be”
Reviews.Author: kayjay13
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in May 2005. We had reservations for two nights, but checked out after only one. Some info: -- The staff is friendly and helpful enough, the lobby is nice, and the pool area is beautiful. -- The carpet in our overpriced room was *filthy* (black socks in an hour). -- As many others have said, the rooms are musty. Bring air freshener. -- The grounds are interesting and fun for the kids, with lagoons (which are not for water play, as they're nasty), many many birds (ducks, etc.), a cool fish/shark/ray pond. They have chairs on little docks in the lagoon areas, to make you want to sit and relax. But once you get near them, you see that they're essentially fowl furniture -- complete with poop all around. Ewe! The worst part -- the clincher -- was the "white-sand beach" we were expecting our room to open out to (per the brochure). It's dirt! Dirty DIRT. Not "sand" by any stretch of the imagination. The highlight was the pool area. That's the only place there's any actual sand for the kids to play in. The pool area makes it worth staying here again, just in a regular garden room -- not a pricey bay-view bungalow. My advice: pick the cheapest room, enjoy Sea World, the zoo and Balboa Park for most of your time, and allow for plenty of pool time. As little room time as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Attended a wedding and was very disappointed. The views were simply great but the food service and the food very below par. At the wedding reception the appetizers room just did not have enough chairs, and the room was very stuffy for the amount of people that were suppose to be in that room. Being served the dinner the waiters were dripping food on people, chairs and with no apologizes. For a hot dish the food was cold. In the morning there was to be a immediate family brunch in the Barefoot Cafe. We tried and tried to make reservations weeks before the wedding with no luck, finally, someone understood that there was going to be 35 people showing up for this breakfast and assisted, but it was a disaster. In a long table of people some people received their food 20-30 minutes before other people. We had crying children who were hungry and had to watch other people eat because their food was not there. The food again was very cold. I would not recommend this hotel for a family like gathering as a wedding this was beyond a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing ”
Reviews.Author: Santu
Reviews.Content: Little duplex bungalows located within a 44 acre resort. Old with mature landscaping. Interiors have been updated. We stayed in a one bedroom bayside parlour suite. Very nice, bedroom small, but had dual sinks with toilet and tub inbetween. Small bayside patio with not so comfortable chairs. Very quiet atmosphere. But the best is the spa. If you are looking for a great massage, facial, etc. in San Diego. This is it. Had a stone massage by Matt, pedicure by Trisha, and facial by Bree. Loved everyone. Not cheap and they automatically add the 20% gratuity to your bill. Ate at the Balleen Restaurant. Wonderful "Lobster Martini" for an appetizer and I had the filet one night for dinner and crabcakes the next night. Came with avacado dip which I don't like, so they made a special tomoto sauce. Very accommodating and a relaxed atmosphere. Resort casual dress. Had room service twice. Since the place is so big, food was slightly cool by the time we received it. It was just okay. Only problem, is they don't come back and get the trays, leave it up to the cleaning people. Biggest drawback, no ceiling fans and no robes in rooms. Quite unusually not to have robes especially at a spa resort. Overall, I would probably go back here only for the spa experience. Pool was crowded with families and small children. Too close I guess to Sea World. Beautiful grounds, friendly staff, we did not have an ant problem, but left our door open one morning and in walked three ducks. Quite comical. Got them out with a few Ritz crackers...... Airport in San Diego is terrible, have been there many times, but now is extremely crowded. Had to wait in line 20 minutes to use the restroom. Treated like cattle throughout the airport. Makes us not want to go back for a short weekend. It deinately needs major overhaul. Too bad because it is so convenient to Las Vegas for us. Beware that security lines are long for check in and there are not enought seats in gate area. Not a pleasant end to a relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The little things add up....”
Reviews.Author: Tagger87
Reviews.Content: I found this property to be disappointing. There were too many little things that taken together raise big red flags. I was in an upgraded bayview room. I walked in to a strong cleaning scent that wasn't extremely pleasant. I opened the patio door to let the room air out while I unpacked. Minutes later, two ducks were wandering into the room. There was no screen on the door (even though there was a track for one), so you couldn't leave the door open without the ducks wandering into the room. There were cigarette butts all over the lawn outside the room. The butts remained, even after the landscapers spent the next morning grooming the grounds outside my room. The security lock on the main door to the room appeared to have been reattached before, like the door may have been kicked-in in the past. The ice machine and pop machine were located a good 5+ minute walk from the room and the grounds are very dark at night. The spa was terrible -- small, cheap and overpriced (they constantly are upselling you -- talking you into additional services and/or products. I had a facial and the therapist insisted that I needed a brow waxing and made me feel like I'd be an ugly fool not to let her do it. Then she wanted to sell me very expensive products for my face...). Back to the spa -- no waiting area, no whirlpools, very small saunas and steamrooms and only two showers in the locker room. And they only gave you one small bath towel. There were no piles of towels anywhere in the locker room -- just one small towel in your assigned locker. The "business center" was a joke. I wanted to FedEx some materials back to my office, so I went to the "business center" to find an unstaffed room with computers, printers, fax machines and credit card readers for your payment. No packing materials, etc. I went to the front desk and was told to go to the conciege. The conciege couldn't give me a box and waybill, but would take my items, have me fill out a long form and have "the shipping department" send them for me (for a fee). No thanks. I carried my items back on the plane. I think the place just needs a little more TLC and needs to be managed by a company that will bring higher standards. The meeting and banquet space did appear to be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is not called Paradise for nothing! We stayed with family in the cabanas for 3 nights. We rented all three rooms and it was great to leave it open during the day but then have the privacy at night. It was absolutely incredible to go and let the kids swim in the bath water temperature pool that was absolutely immaculately maintained, then come back to the room to relax and the kids could go look for sea shells on the beach. We had bon fires at night-(I recommend bringing wood or buying some if you are traveling from a far distance like I was). We roasted hot dogs and made s'mores. It was AWESOME. The rooms were as immaculate as the grounds, I don't know how they do it with the sand from the beach just outside your door but they did a great job. Sea World is just down the street and we were able to sit out at our bon fire and watch the fireworks from the park on the weekend nights. The small kitchen area was great as well, the microwave was great for heating my nephews bottles and the fridge allowed us to keep hot dogs on hand for the bon fires. There are tons of activities that are offered as well and my only regret was not making the time to use the jet skis and kayaks-they had kayakers leaving from the beach in the morning just outside our door- (How cool is that?). They also offer an unbelivable spa and my mother recieved the whole treatment-she absolutely loved it! Overall I would highly recommend this resort. We only stayed the short 3 nights and then went on to Anaheim but didn't want to leave and plan to return for a full week next year!

Reviews.Title: “Don't nickel-and-dime me!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I pay this much for a Spring Break resort for my family, I certainly don't want to be fooled. I felt "fooled" everytime I turned around here. From the $18 NON-VALET parking charge per night to the $2.25 soda machine price, this place is out to squeeze you. They charge $10/day for high-speed internet, and nick you for $9 for the mini-golf course. I guess my $350+ room charge is just for the room! What does my daily "resort fee" cover?! Sloppy service at the restaurant; daily complaints about the myriad cig butts outside of our unit failed to motivate housekeeping to clean them. Having stayed at many resorts in AZ, FL, HI, and CA through the years, I found that this was the one where I paid the most and got the least.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite paradise...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's funny to me as a Californian how people from England think this hotel is HEAVEN because there is a pool and a jacuzzi. That's pretty standard in every hotel here. But, if you're looking for one of those warm weather resorts with a huge pool near the ocean - this is definitely NOT it. I live in Los Angeles and we drove down for a few days with our 6 year-old daughter. This place is a great location if you're headed to Sea World. (It's next door.) And it was loaded with folks from England who we enjoyed meeting. But, it had some kinks that bugged me. When we arrived (a bit before the 4 PM check-in) the computer was down and they couldn't check us in. We had to wait an hour to check-in. The main pool is not very big and the jacuzzi is small and up the steps from the pool. There are three other pools on the property - but the others are much smaller and only one other one is heated. (It was chilly when we were there.) There is only one jacuzzi. This might seem picky - but, this is a huge complex with dozens of rooms. If the weather had been warmer and more people were in the pool and jacuzzi - you wouldn't have been able to move. As it was - I kept bumping into people when I was swimming. Our room was a lanai room - no view of anything except the parking lot in front of our room. Okay, that's what we paid for, but forget about the barbecue pit and view of the water unless you want to pay $300 a night. (Not really worth it.) Our room was conveniently located next to the main lobby and pool though. And it gave us easy access to our car. There seemed to be a lot of hidden costs where you felt nickel and dimed: $18 for parking, $10 to use the gym. The food at the restaurant was not very good and overpriced and the service was poor. And if you want to order one of those tropical drinks while you sit by the pool - it's $9.00. Oh and leave the golf clubs at home - that silly putting course they have is for kids and they charge extra to use it! Our first morning we were woken up by the gardeners at 6:15 AM mowing the lawn right outside our room. We complained and got $50 off the room. But, I would have prefered the sleep. That afternoon we returned from Sea World to find my earrings were missing from the room. We complained again and got more money off - but, again I would have preferred the return of my opal earrings. The rooms are nicely decorated in "country" style. But, the maid short-sheeted our beds every night and by morning I was sleeping on a bare mattress. When you go to San Diego you have three choices of areas to stay in: the Gaslamp area downtown which is terrific - you can walk everywhere. But, maybe not the best place for families with young children. There's Old Town which is a must see, another walking area and some nice hotels are there, (Best Western Hacienda is wonderful) but you might get some freeway traffic noise. Then there is the Mission Bay area near Sea World. Paradise Point is really on a point that juts out into Mission Bay. You have to know though that this is a marina and boating area - and you are not allowed to swim at the beach across from the hotel. The other problem with Paradise Point is that you have to drive to get to anything. You can't walk to restaurants or stores or pick up the trolley to Mexico like in the Gaslamp or Old Town area. Still I think if you have kids you might like the space at Paradise Point where the kids can run around. San Diego is a compact city though (unlike LA!) and Old Town and downtown San Diego are only a few minutes drive away. If you stay at Paradise Point, I'd suggest getting your drinks and some snacks at the grocery store. Thankfully there's a small (empty) fridge in the room and if you just drive down the road from the hotel you'll find a Von's and Ralphs. There are some things to reccomend this hotel: the staff at the front desk was courteous, the hotel was clean and well maintained and there was an effort to accomodate the guests. There's some nice touches on the property like the fountains that turn into torches at night. I'm sure the spa is nice - although I didn't have a treatment. But, I have to tell you the $10 for the gym was worth it because it also alllows you to use the eucalyptus steam room in the spa - now that was HEAVEN!

Reviews.Title: “How can you not love this property?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back 4/12/2005. After booking I read the reviews which seem to be quite varied, so we simply prepared for the worst of the reviews to be partly true. I cannot recall a more delightful stay!!! We booked a garden lanai but wished we had a room on the bay, once we got there. For $25 more per night we were moved to a room on the bay for our remaining two nights. Not only that, but we were at Sea World, so all we had to do was round up our suitcases and leave them together in the room. The bellman came by when the new room was ready and moved our bags. I was afraid we'd have to check out at noon and back in at 4, but no, they moved us directly over at 3:30. I don't understand the parking complaints, your space is reserved and right at your front door. So $18.00 is a little steep, but the overall cost is not. People that don't bring a car probably appreciate this expense not being "included". Food was great at the restaurants, every single staff member was cheery and polite. Every big "tower" hotel we drove past we all agreed "I'm glad we're not staying there!" My boys 11 and 13 will absolutely NOT sleep in the same bed and in any other hotel I've been in when there are 2 queen beds they do not allow a rollaway. These guys did. Not only that, but in our particular room the closet was soooo big that the rollaway fit in the closet and we still had plenty of room for everthing else, including accessing the door that went from the closet to the back end of the bathroom! What fun. On our last day our plane didn't leave until 10:00pm so after check out we were permitted to use the grounds the entire day. I will go only there whenever I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 3 joining rooms. 2 of them were bugalows. The view was awesome. We got to see seaworld fireworks everynite while doing a bonfire with the kids. Which is located in front of your bugalow when you open your door. The Adults and kids loved it. We made new friends at the bonfire and it was so relaxing at day and night. The rooms were awesome, especially the beds, they were heaven. We loved the pool and jacuzzi it was "HEAVEN". After a long day at seaworld, sand diego zoo try the jacuzzi it is heaven. put your feet on the jet stream it is "WONDERFUL". My mom went to the spa and love every minute of it. We like the fact that in the day we can open the doors and it can become one big house and at night close the doors and have privacy. The staff was awesome, my husband and I tipped the bellmen 20 dollars and I have never tipped someone that much. Very professional and friendly with the kids. My 7 and 14 year old son loved him. I recommend if you stay there to make sure you leave your shoes and sandals outside of the rooms. Due to all the sand, because the bay is right there. I dont know how they keep the rooms up but our room was very well kept and beautiful. We stayed there for 4 nights and headed to anaheim to disney and universal. We all wished we stayed there for our whole entire vacation. great food, great service, great place to vacation. This resort has made our vacation a memorable one. We are still talking about it. I highly recommend this resort. We already have planned to stay here next year and planned to stay there our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort! Service ok in some areas”
Reviews.Author: 071810f
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and had mixed feelings when we went. I stayed right on the water and had 2 rooms. I think that some of the ant comments were rooms in the garden area, located inside the resort. I had no ant problems and my room was about 50 feet from the harbor... right near my room was a bonfire pit and several lounge chairs. The room rate was $297 (incl tax) and it was very nice.. 2 queen beds, tv, refrigerator, coffee maker... the bathroom was very spacious! The only bad part was I felt like I was in a bubble.. the doors were glass and had a sheer fabric for privacy. Behind the sheer fabric was a plastic thicker cloth, so at night I felt fine, but I could see people peeking in while they walked the beach. The check in process was ok. I didn't know that check in was 4:00 and I had a massage at 4. I checked in at 3:00 only to be told my 2 rooms were not ready yet. My one friend decided not to get a spa treatment and said she'd wait til 4. Well by 5 we still had no room. The resort gave us a $30 credit but heavily hinted to use it at the bar. I guess they did not want to "refund" any money, eh? If you want a place to stroll or water sports, this is a great place. Plenty of hideaway area to sit and relax... lots of Ducks and fowl walking around... not at all intimiadated by the guests. I wish we had more time to sit around the outside area with a drink... or even lounged in the check in area. I do admit that the service was prompt. We had one of the doors missing a sheer fabric. I called housekeeping and they fixed it in 15 minutes. Their concierge was friendly but not very helpful in suggesting a reasonable priced steak restaurant. They had a stack of menus to choose from local restaurants but they were as pricey as you can get.. well the one she showed me was "Max's" and steaks were $30+. She offered making reservations, which was helpful, but We ended up going to a local Outback Steakhouse, off the 8 freeway. It was a bit frustrating that the concierge had no clue where the nearest Outback was when we asked for directions. The massage treatment was wonderful... price was no different than any other resort ($95 for a 50 min sweedish, $145 for an 80 min serenity massage) but I did find their automatic 20 percent tip a bit outrageous. I know I could have adjusted it if I didn't feel it was worth 20 percent, but they should allow the guest to determine, not have them tell you how much. I think the $18 parking was a bit outrageous. You do get to park right near your bungalow (or they call it the Lanai) but the area was so squishy, I felt the car next to me would ding my car. I think if you want to park near you can pay. If you don't mind walking you should have free parking near the Gift Shop. The breakfast at the Barefoot restaurant was tasty and good, but a bit pricey. $8 for oatmeal and raisins, $3.95 for a carafe of coffee (per person), $3.95 for OJ (but squeezed with pulp), and $11 for corned beef hash with an egg & holandaise sauce on top.

Reviews.Title: “tropical paradise in san diego”
Reviews.Author: draycot2
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews we were a little worried about our visit , however we found the hotel name very apt, you really are in paradise. The resort is a tropical oasis with very good standard accomodation and excellant staff. We certainly did not have any problem with service or ants in the room. The only slight downside was the maid service, although very thorough the room was often not serviced until 5.00pm. The bayside grill is excellant and in a lovely setting. We did also have an excellant meal at the Balleen restaurant, but this was quite expensive, especially for children and the added service charge, the coffee at $8 dollars was expensive. The resort is situated ideally for the old town and the Gaslamp Quarter and only a mile from Seaworld. If you are looking for a relaxing tropical resort then Paradise piont is a must

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the place was great! Accomodations are totally cute, and I am a hotel snob. You get an individual cabana so your walls aren't on top of anyone elses. You get your own back patio with a little meadow in back, there you can see everyones back door, but still very private. Has its own fridge and microwave, close by ice machines. The decor is little country house. Not too over modern. Bed is comfy. You can go get drunk on one side of the complex and the little golf cart will bring you back to your little cabana and be nice. Room service, spectacular, however pricey. Do plan on tipping, as there are lots of people to serve you

Reviews.Title: “Fair, at best.”
Reviews.Author: UncleBoomsky
Reviews.Content: Very pricey--so then again is most of San Diego. We were greeted by a long line of angry people waiting to check in. Rooms simply were not ready and available as scheduled. While waiting we were offered the option of going to get food at one of the restaurants. I have a peanut allergy and even though I asked, yes they served me peanuts. They were most unhelpful in managing that having security ask me questions to protect them from lawsuit but pretty much left me on my own to find medical care. Even when I didn't eat peanuts, food was fair. Parking a disaster. We were promised a full size crib but they only had pack and plays. On the whole, it seemed like a place that wanted to do it right but was run by a bunch of amateurs. At least the Dan Brown's book that I brought along was a good read.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: shgardeajr
Reviews.Content: We planned a family vacation for a week (March 19-26) in San Diego and I decided on Paradise Point. After reading some of the negative reviews, I thought I'd made a mistake, but decided to keep our reservations. I was very pleased with our entire stay. The room was very well kept and clean, and the resort was beautiful. The staff was attentive and very kind. The kids enjoyed playing in our "backyard" which was a lawn surrounded by lush vegetation. The heated pools and nearby beach were enjoyed as well. Sure, room service and parking may be expensive, but no more than other luxury resorts. I can also add that the food was delicious. Overall, we loved being in the middle of Mission Bay and thoroughly enjoyed our vacation. We wished we had more time to enjoy the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: JoGo13
Reviews.Content: We visited the Paradise Point Hotel in March, 2005. I can only say that we had a wonderful experience. The rooms, although not very fancy...were more than adequate, were clean and had very comfortable beds, not usually found away from home. The service was exceptional with all the hotel employees being friendly, helpful and always polite. The restaurants were excellent, the grounds absolutely beautiful...with lush tropical plants and folliage. The spa was lovely and added to a most relaxing and enjoyable vacation. With something for people of all ages, I would recommend Paradise Point to anyone. Before leaving for this vacation, I read many reviews with some being quite negative...I will tell you that not one of the terrible things I read were experienced by us. To be honest, everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. I cannot wait to return for another absolutely perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!! Beautiful paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: MJfortworth
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a week. March 11-18. It was a wonderful place. The beachfront bungalow was amazing. A great view out the door and windows and very private. The service at the hotel was very good and the room was clean and the bed turned down when we came back every day. The entire island is beautifully landscaped and around every corner there are beautiful flowers and lush gardens with palm trees. The fancy restaurant, Baleen, is absolutely perfect for a nice dinner. Outside patio seating is ideal and the food is first class. The informal Barefoot Bar and Grill is great for a casual meal. It is right in front of the Bay and it is a fun atmosphere that makes you feel like you are on a tropical island. The Marina is right across the walkway and there are plenty of sailboats, jet skis, and powerboats for rental, with reasonable prices. Overall, I was very impressed by the hotel and regardless of other reviews, everyone should try it out. I do recommend the rooms directly in front of the bay and beach.. Other rooms are nice but not as impressive. The proximity to the aiport, Sea World, and downtown is great. Perfect location and easy driving from everywhere. This is THE place to stay in San Diego. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Sheraton instead!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShareTravelInfo
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here for almost a week. Was told to wait for a golf cart attendant to guide me to my room. Waited 20 minutes and ended up finding it on my own. Opened the door to my "bungalow" and the smell of bleach almost knocked me over. The walls and furniture had mold on them. Furnishings looked like something a shelter would have. Checked out and went to the Sheraton downtown. Many complaints from others who did stay there for the conference - they charge extra for everything. $10 for a half hour to rent a bike and $18 for a full hour. $18 a day to park in the space reserved for the bungalow. $10 to use the gym. Stayed there years ago when it was run by Princess resorts and it was gorgeous. It's a disgrace now.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: ThomasB
Reviews.Content: Our kids liked it because of big, heated pool and pretty, maze like 40-some acre grounds that they could wander. Well-designed property that makes great use of water on and surrounding property. Clever mini golf with natural grass. We had none of the horrors described in other reviews, but agree re faded glory, needs capital investment. Our room smelled of too much lemon-scented cleaner, and housekeeping didn't get here until 4pm one day. Kitchenette had no dishes, but agreeable staff brought them quickly when we called. One light was flickering, etc. Restaurants were overpriced, but settings were pretty. Weak on a few details, and the manager should probably be replaced. We wouldn't stay here on our own, but would return if travelling this way with our kids again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip in July 2004 and fell in love with the Paradise Point Resort that we didn't want to leave! We had none of the problems that are in some of the other reviews. We had just the opposite. Our rooms were very clean & nice and offered plenty of room for a family of 4. The staff was nice, courteous & helpful. The food was good. Our 2 children had a blast at the pool & playing on the beach and feeding the ducks. It is very family oriented.The grounds are covered in all types of blooming colorful hibiscus and plants, it's very beautiful. The environment is tropical & serene. We have already booked our trip for this summer and are staying longer because we had such a wonderful experience, it is now an annual family trip. It is definatley worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: GilhamStreet
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel I was expecting to find the words "Helter Skelter" scrawled in blood on the wall of our room when I opened the door. I was happy (and quite relieved) to find them painted a rather cheery shade of yellow. The room itself was clean & tidy. It did have a slight mildewy smell, but one you really only notice when you first walk in, and certainly not enough to poison us in our sleep. The grounds were well maintained, with some bird poo here and there, but unless the grounds crew followed the ducks around with a roll of paper and some bleach, I don't think it could be avoided. The main pool area was a nice place for a swim or to have a cocktail and relax. My boyfriend and I stayed over a weekend, and I'd say the majority of guests seemed to be families with small children and groups of girls on Bachlorette weekends, fine for us, but I don't know how romantic it would be for honeymooners. Overall, the worst part of the trip was having to deal with the traffic on the way down from Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: groovynet
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I read all the bad reviews on this site, so frankly, I was skeptical about staying there, however, the convention was booked and our room was paid for, so we decided to take our chances :) I must say that I was very pleased with our room and the grounds and our stay there! Okay, they do charge $18 a night to PARK (UNREAL!!!), so be aware! The room was clean, and the resort was lovely. We had a $400/night room so I would expect it to be over the top. Loved the patio, with lounge chairs, and all the beautiful flowers and green green green everywhere. We didn't dine in the restaurants on site (everything was catered for convention), the beach was clean and very pretty. I can say that I was really pleasantly surprised and happy with our stay there and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: sunshine3
Reviews.Content: The bungalows were comfortable and "homey", nothing fancy. The beds were comfortable, and the view out the sliding door to the little stream with ducks was charming. We were well located with a short walk to the lobby and the Bay just one bungalow away. The grounds are lovely. The only problems I encountered were a few ants in the bathroom, and I'm not fond of shower/tub combos. The food on site was pricey and just okay, although the chicken wrap at Barefoot Grill was delicious! The outdoor seating at both of the open onsite restaurants provided lovely views. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It. don't know where the bad reviews are coming from.”
Reviews.Author: JK&JS
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there for Valentine's Day with my girlfriend. I live in the area but threw together a quick surprise for my girlfriend. I was a little cautious after reading mixed reviews. Although, I've come to realize that these reviews can often be tainted because people didn't get the weather they wanted or had other bad experiences beyond the control of a hotel. I've stayed at several luxury resorts for work such as the Ritz-Carlton (Naples, Boston, Atlanta, San Juan), Westin Diplomat, The Jefferson (Richmond), Loews Coronado, and several other. Paradise Point is not at that level but I paid at least $200 less per night. I thought the grounds were gorgious and I found the staff extremely nice and friendly. I thought the rooms were comfortable and nice. I really enjoyed the privacy and layout of the resort. All the rooms are "bungalow' style. They upgraded us to a bay view after I told them about the occasion and because there was availability. The room was a bit musty at first but the mositure we've had in area is probably the cause of that. After we opened the patio door and let the breeze come through the room, it was very nice. We ate lunch at the grill. I didn't find it as expensive as everyone else in these reviews. It's not fast-food prices and the food was good. All and all we both thought the property was nice and well worth the cost. It offers a lot more than a cookie-cutter downtown hotel. The best advise I could give is to take these reviews with a grain of salt. I would definitely recommend this resort if you're looking for affordable accomodations in a great location. It offers you a resort feel and more on-site activities than a chain hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “All the bad postings are true”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did not listen to the bad reviews of this property, their website makes it seem like a 5-star resort. but, DO NOT STAY HERE. We just returned from a 1 night trip that I had won a $200 gift certificate for from work. The room was small, I asked for 1 king bed, got 2 queens instead, the bathrooms were DISCUSTING, the toilet had so much mold under the tank lid it was caked on about 1/2 an inch wide, which you could only see if you were sitting in the bath tub or bend down in the shower. The door to the closet was broken which made it unaccessable. The furnature was warped which made the drawers unable to open without a huge tug that I thought was going to bring down the 25" TV. The wicker chair in the corner was FILLED with dust and the lamp shade was torn at ever edge. There were ants in the bathroom & on the counters, which given the wet "tropical" surroundings I guess it could be expected. The bed mattress was the only thing that was actually nice about the room. The window that looked out on to the "lagoon" collected so much moisture we couldnt even see out of it. and that "lagoon" turned out to be a small shallow duck pond that looked more like water collected in a rain storm. The heater was so bad, 1 it didnt work that well, 2, it was so loud we couldnt sleep when it was halfway working. there is a small frig on the shelf next to the tv that kicked on every 15-20 minutes with a high-pitched whining noise.
